original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i sku'i ngo bo 'gro ba'i don du spros pa gzhon nu don thams cad grub pas chu bo nee ranydza na'i 'gram du byang chub kyi shing drung du /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i sku'i ngo bo 'gro ba'i don du spros pa gzhon nu don thams cad grub pas chu bo nee ranydza na'i 'gram du byang chub kyi shing drung du /
translated: Here, the Bhagavān, the essence of the body of Vajrasattva, emanated for the benefit of migrating beings as the youthful Siddhārtha, who, on the bank of the Nairañjanā River, under the Bodhi tree,

original: stong pa nyid bcu drug bsdus par gyur pa mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug bsdus par gyur pa mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: entered into the samādhi called “immovable,” which is the collection of the sixteen emptinesses.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang @2a * //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang @2a * //
translated: “I have attained perfect, complete enlightenment.”

original: chub bdag gis thob po zhes bsams pas brag bzhin du mi g-yo bar gnas par gyur ro //
analyzed: chub bdag gis thob po zhes bsams pas brag bzhin du mi g-yo bar gnas par gyur ro //
translated: He remained immovable like a rock.

original: de'i tshe srid pa'i rtse mo'i steng du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rim pa'am /
analyzed: de'i tshe srid pa'i rtse mo'i steng du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rim pa'am /
translated: At that time, above the peak of existence, the maṇḍala wheel is arranged in stages.

original: dpag tshad lnga stong gi bar gyi tshad kyi steng dang 'og gi rim pas mngon par dga' ba dang / 'og min dang / rin chen 'byung gnas dang / bde ba can dang / me teg can zhes bya ba thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lngas byin gyi brlabs pa rin chen sna bdun gyi rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing lnga g-yo bar gyur te /
analyzed: dpag tshad lnga stong gi bar gyi tshad kyi steng dang 'og gi rim pas mngon par dga' ba dang / 'og min dang / rin chen 'byung gnas dang / bde ba can dang / me teg can zhes bya ba thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lngas byin gyi brlabs pa rin chen sna bdun gyi rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing lnga g-yo bar gyur te /
translated: The five buddhafields of Akshobhya, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, Amoghasiddhi, and Vairochana, which are blessed by the five tathagatas, such as Vajrapani, and are made of the seven precious substances, shake from the bottom to the top, up to five thousand yojanas.

original: ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba'i sangs rgyas lngas kyang gzhan gyi sems mkhyen pa'i dbang gis gzhon nu don thams cad grub pa byin gyis brlab pa'i ting nge 'dzin mkhyen par gyur to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba'i sangs rgyas lngas kyang gzhan gyi sems mkhyen pa'i dbang gis gzhon nu don thams cad grub pa byin gyis brlab pa'i ting nge 'dzin mkhyen par gyur to //
translated: The five buddhas who arise from samadhi also, through the power of knowing the minds of others, know the samadhi of blessing the youth Sarvarthasiddha.

original: de'i tshe phan tshun bsam pa gcig pas //
analyzed: de'i tshe phan tshun bsam pa gcig pas //
translated: At that time, with a single thought,

original: gang na gzhon du don thams cad grub pa gnas pa der nye bar gshegs so //
analyzed: gang na gzhon du don thams cad grub pa gnas pa der nye bar gshegs so //
translated: they approach where the youth Sarvarthasiddha is.

original: nye bar gshegs nas bar snang gi nam mkha' la til gyi gang bu bzhin du khyab nas kye don thams cad grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan 'di ni mthar thug pa'i gnas thob pa'i rgyu ma yin pas de nyid spongs shig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: nye bar gshegs nas bar snang gi nam mkha' la til gyi gang bu bzhin du khyab nas kye don thams cad grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan 'di ni mthar thug pa'i gnas thob pa'i rgyu ma yin pas de nyid spongs shig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Having approached, they pervaded the sky like a sesame pod and said, “Oh Bodhisattva who has accomplished all goals, this meditation is not the cause of attaining the ultimate stage, so abandon it.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung @2b thos nas ting nge 'dzin las langs nas lha'i mig gis mtha' yas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i skus yongs su gang ba'i nam mkha'i khams la bltas nas pus mo gnyis sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung @2b thos nas ting nge 'dzin las langs nas lha'i mig gis mtha' yas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i skus yongs su gang ba'i nam mkha'i khams la bltas nas pus mo gnyis sa la btsugs te /
translated: Having heard the Tathāgatas’ speech, he arose from samādhi and with his divine eye, saw the realm of space completely filled with the bodies of infinite Tathāgatas. He placed his two knees on the ground,

original: phyag bzhi byas nas bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ji lta bu lags zhes gsol ba btab pa byas so //
analyzed: phyag bzhi byas nas bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ji lta bu lags zhes gsol ba btab pa byas so //
translated: made four prostrations, and asked, “Blessed One, what is the true samādhi?”

original: de'i tshig gsan ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa la sogs pas ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin gyi spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhi thugs ka nas sprul te /
analyzed: de'i tshig gsan ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa la sogs pas ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin gyi spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhi thugs ka nas sprul te /
translated: As soon as he heard those words, the four goddesses such as Locanā, who are the nature of the wisdom seal, were emanated from the heart of Bhagavat Akṣhobhya and so forth.

original: dang po 'od zer gyi 'khor los dbang bskur zhing slob dpon la sogs pa dbang bzhi pos dbang bskur te /
analyzed: dang po 'od zer gyi 'khor los dbang bskur zhing slob dpon la sogs pa dbang bzhi pos dbang bskur te /
translated: First, they conferred empowerment with a circle of light rays and conferred the four empowerments such as the master empowerment.

original: rnal 'byor bzhi la sogs pa'i rim gyis man ngag nye bar bstan la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bcug cing mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bzhi la sogs pa'i rim gyis man ngag nye bar bstan la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bcug cing mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: They taught the intimate instructions in stages such as the four yogas and caused them to enter perfect complete enlightenment.🔽Then they disappeared.

original: byang chub sems dpas kyang sa bcu gcig pa thob nas mtshan phyed kyi dus su sangs rgyas te thor ngas kyi dus su bdud bcom nas gong du dga' ldan gyi gnas der gshegs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang sa bcu gcig pa thob nas mtshan phyed kyi dus su sangs rgyas te thor ngas kyi dus su bdud bcom nas gong du dga' ldan gyi gnas der gshegs so //
translated: The bodhisattva also attained the eleventh bhūmi and became a buddha at midnight. At dawn he conquered Māra and went to the abode of Tuṣhita above.

original: nye bar gshegs nas rin po che sna bdun gyi rang bzhin gyi khang bzangs sprul la /
analyzed: nye bar gshegs nas rin po che sna bdun gyi rang bzhin gyi khang bzangs sprul la /
translated: Having gone there, he emanated a palace of the nature of the seven precious substances.

original: thugs ka nas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga spros te /
analyzed: thugs ka nas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga spros te /
translated: From his heart he emanated the five tathāgatas.

original: de rnams kyis gsol ba btab pas dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud nyi khri lnga stong gsungs so //
analyzed: de rnams kyis gsol ba btab pas dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud nyi khri lnga stong gsungs so //
translated: They made a request, and he taught the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra in 25,000 chapters.

original: tshe'i snyigs ma dang / lta ba'i snyigs ma dang / nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma dang / sems can gyi snyigs ma dang / bskal pa'i snyigs ma dang ldan pa shes rab dang brtson 'grus dman pa'i sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir yang gsol ba btab pa byas te /
analyzed: tshe'i snyigs ma dang / lta ba'i snyigs ma dang / nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma dang / sems can gyi snyigs ma dang / bskal pa'i snyigs ma dang ldan pa shes rab dang brtson 'grus dman pa'i sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir yang gsol ba btab pa byas te /
translated: In order to benefit sentient beings who are endowed with the degeneration of life, the degeneration of view, the degeneration of afflictions, the degeneration of sentient beings, and the degeneration of the eon, and who have inferior wisdom and effort, they made a request.

original: bcom ldan 'das mdor bsdus pa'i rgyud bka' stsol cig dang / gang gi phyir da ltar byung ba'i sems can rnams ni rgya che ba'i don 'dzin par mi nus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mdor bsdus pa'i rgyud bka' stsol cig dang / gang gi phyir da ltar byung ba'i sems can rnams ni rgya che ba'i don 'dzin par mi nus so //
translated: They said, Blessed One, please teach a condensed tantra, because sentient beings of the present time are unable to uphold a vast meaning.

original: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis kyang de las bsdus pa le'u bco brgyad pa brgya phrag bco brgyad kyi tshad tsam gyi rgyud gsungs so //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis kyang de las bsdus pa le'u bco brgyad pa brgya phrag bco brgyad kyi tshad tsam gyi rgyud gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One Vajradhara, endowed with great compassion, also taught an abbreviated tantra of eighteen chapters, the size of eighteen hundred chapters.

original: lag na rdo rje yang sdud pa po yin te /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje yang sdud pa po yin te /
translated: Vajrapani is also the compiler,

original: des ni gcig nas gcig gi rim gyis mi'i yul du 'jug par byas so //🔽de nas brtsams te glegs bam la sogs pa byung ngo //
analyzed: des ni gcig nas gcig gi rim gyis mi'i yul du 'jug par byas so // de nas brtsams te glegs bam la sogs pa byung ngo //
translated: for he caused it to enter the human realm by means of a succession from one to another.

original: gang gi @3a * //
analyzed: gang gi @3a * //
translated: Then, beginning with that, it appeared in the form of books and so forth.

original: phyir lo 'bum phrag nyi shu'i tshad tsam gyi rdzogs ldan gyi dus su zhal gyi man ngag 'ba' zhig tu byung ngo //
analyzed: phyir lo 'bum phrag nyi shu'i tshad tsam gyi rdzogs ldan gyi dus su zhal gyi man ngag 'ba' zhig tu byung ngo //
translated: For twenty million years, the time of completeness, it appeared only as oral instructions.🔽During the time of three-quarters, the root tantra appeared, and during the time of two-quarters, its branches, which determine that, appeared.

original: gsum ldan gyi dus su rtsa ba'i rgyud byung bar gyur pa dang / gnyis ldan gyi dus su de dag gtan la 'bebs par byed pa de'i yan lag byung ba dang// skal ldan gyi dus su de'i bshad pa'i rgyud dang / de ma rtogs pas gang zag gis brtsams pa'i 'grel pa la sogs pa yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gsum ldan gyi dus su rtsa ba'i rgyud byung bar gyur pa dang / gnyis ldan gyi dus su de dag gtan la 'bebs par byed pa de'i yan lag byung ba dang// skal ldan gyi dus su de'i bshad pa'i rgyud dang / de ma rtogs pas gang zag gis brtsams pa'i 'grel pa la sogs pa yang 'byung ngo //
translated: During the time of one-quarter, its explanatory tantras and commentaries composed by individuals who did not understand that appeared.

original: gsum ldan ni lo 'bum phrag bco lnga'i tshad dang / gnyis ldan ni lo 'bum phrag bcu'i tshad dang / skal ldan ni lo 'bum phrag lnga'i tshad yin no //
analyzed: gsum ldan ni lo 'bum phrag bco lnga'i tshad dang / gnyis ldan ni lo 'bum phrag bcu'i tshad dang / skal ldan ni lo 'bum phrag lnga'i tshad yin no //
translated: The one possessing three is the measure of fifteen hundred thousand years, the one possessing two is the measure of ten hundred thousand years, and the fortunate one is the measure of five hundred thousand years.

original: de la dpal gyi ri bo la gnas pa'i 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud las mdor bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa'i thabs 'di ma 'ongs pa'i sems can la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir bsdus te /
analyzed: de la dpal gyi ri bo la gnas pa'i 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud las mdor bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa'i thabs 'di ma 'ongs pa'i sems can la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir bsdus te /
translated: Now, the noble Nagarjuna, who resided on the glorious mountain, condensed this sadhana called the Glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra for the benefit of future sentient beings.

original: de dang por nyan pa po 'jug pa'i ched du brjod pa la sogs pa lnga po des bshad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de dang por nyan pa po 'jug pa'i ched du brjod pa la sogs pa lnga po des bshad par bya ba yin te /
translated: It is to be explained by him with the five, beginning with the statement of purpose, for the sake of engaging the listener.

original: de ma brjod na nyan pa po 'jug pa med pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di ni don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma brjod na nyan pa po 'jug pa med pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di ni don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is not stated, the listener will not engage, and it would follow that this treatise would be pointless.

original: de rnams kyang rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / 'brel ba dang / dgos pa dang de'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / 'brel ba dang / dgos pa dang de'i dgos pa'o //
translated: Those are the means of expression, the object of expression, the connection, the purpose, and the purpose of that.

original: gang gi phyir ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir ;
translated: For what reason?

original: / tha snyad la ni 'jug phyir dang // gzhan rnams la ni dngos gzhi'i phyir //
analyzed: / tha snyad la ni 'jug phyir dang // gzhan rnams la ni dngos gzhi'i phyir //
translated: Because it engages in conventions, and because it is the basis for others.

original: brjod pa med pas 'jig rten 'di //
analyzed: brjod pa med pas 'jig rten 'di //
translated: If there were no expression, this world

original: long dang lkugs pa 'dra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: long dang lkugs pa 'dra bar 'gyur //
translated: would be like the blind and the mute.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: de la rjod par byed pa ni mdor bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa'i thabs te /
analyzed: de la rjod par byed pa ni mdor bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa'i thabs te /
translated: Therein, the expression is the means of achievement called the concise.

original: de ni don dang bcas pa yin na don med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ni don dang bcas pa yin na don med pa yin zhe na /
translated: If that is meaningful, then why is it meaningless?

original: smras pa / don dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / don dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: It is said: It is meaningful.

original: de'i don yang dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u bco brgyad kyis sgrub pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa byis pa'i blo gros kyis khong du chud par mi nus pa bsdus nas bstan pa ni mdor bsdus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gi dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa'i don du thabs ni 'di nyid yin no zhes sgrub pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: de'i don yang dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u bco brgyad kyis sgrub pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa byis pa'i blo gros kyis khong du chud par mi nus pa bsdus nas bstan pa ni mdor bsdus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gi dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa'i don du thabs ni 'di nyid yin no zhes sgrub pa'i thabs so //
translated: And its meaning is this: The generation stage of achievement by the eighteen chapters of the glorious King of Tantras, the Guhyasamaja, cannot be comprehended by the intellect of a child. Having collected it, it is taught as the concise, and it is the means of achievement, saying that this alone is the means for achieving the mandala of the Bhagavat Vajradhara.

original: mdor bsdus pa yang yin la sgrub thabs kyang yin pas mdor bsdus pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs te las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa yang yin la sgrub thabs kyang yin pas mdor bsdus pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs te las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is a compendium and also a means of achievement, thus it is a compendium means of achievement, which is the retention of the rite.

original: brjod par bya ba ni don gyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni don gyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The subject matter is the characteristic of the meaning,

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa zhes bya'o //
translated: which is called the creation stage.

original: @3b de'i dbye ba ni dang po'i sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog dang las kyi rgyal po mchog ste gsum mo //
analyzed: @3b de'i dbye ba ni dang po'i sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog dang las kyi rgyal po mchog ste gsum mo //
translated: Its divisions are three: the first application, the supreme king of mandalas, and the supreme king of rites.

original: de rnams kyi dbye ba sum cu rtsa brgyad ni gzhan las gsungs te 'dir ma bstan to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbye ba sum cu rtsa brgyad ni gzhan las gsungs te 'dir ma bstan to //
translated: Their divisions are thirty-eight, which are taught elsewhere and are not presented here.

original: le'u bcu bdun pa las de'i mdo bsres byas te /
analyzed: le'u bcu bdun pa las de'i mdo bsres byas te /
translated: The summary of that is made in the seventeenth chapter.

original: de la le'u bcu gnyis pa las /
analyzed: de la le'u bcu gnyis pa las /
translated: Therein, the twelfth chapter states:

original: dgon pa chen po'i sa phyogs su //
analyzed: dgon pa chen po'i sa phyogs su //
translated: In a place in a great wilderness

original: me tog 'bras bu sogs kyis brgyan //🔽ri bo dben par dngos grub kun //
analyzed: me tog 'bras bu sogs kyis brgyan // ri bo dben par dngos grub kun //
translated: adorned with flowers, fruits, and so forth,🔽in an isolated mountain,

original: bsdus pa yang dag sgrub par byed //
analyzed: bsdus pa yang dag sgrub par byed //
translated: one should accomplish the collection of all powers.

original: ces bya ba'i mdos khyad par gyi gnas dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i mdos khyad par gyi gnas dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: This passage indicates the special place of visualization.

original: le'u gsum pa las gsungs pa'i //
analyzed: le'u gsum pa las gsungs pa'i //
translated: The third chapter states:

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus gnas pa'i //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus gnas pa'i //
translated: In the middle of the realm of space,

original: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya //
translated: one should meditate on the mandala of the Buddha.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdos byang chub sems kyi rdo rje'i gzugs bsgoms la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdos byang chub sems kyi rdo rje'i gzugs bsgoms la /
translated: Thus, having meditated on the form of the vajra of the mind of enlightenment,

original: le'u bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'i /
analyzed: le'u bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'i /
translated: [one should recite the following verse] from the fifteenth chapter:🔽Resembling the light of Vairocana,

original: rnam par snang mdzad 'od dang mtshungs //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdos kha dog dkar por bdag nyid bsgoms la /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad 'od dang mtshungs // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdos kha dog dkar por bdag nyid bsgoms la /

original: le'u bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa las gsungs pa'i aom sum bha ni sum bha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags dang / bsam gtan las skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang bgegs bskrad pa bstan to //🔽dngos po med pas sgom pa med //

analyzed: dam tshig las ni re re spro //

analyzed: le'u brgyad pa las gsungs pa'i //

analyzed: nam mkha' dbyings kyi dbus gnas pa'i //

analyzed: yi ge aom ni sku rdo rje //

analyzed: le'u gsum pa las gsungs pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi de kho na nyid bstan to //

translated: The “oṃ” syllable and so forth mentioned in the thirteenth chapter teach the complete body of the deity preceded by the arrangement of the three syllables and the pride of the vajra.

original: snying gar zla ba bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa le'u bcu gnyis pa las gsungs pa'i mdos ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' bsgom par bstan te /
analyzed: snying gar zla ba bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa le'u bcu gnyis pa las gsungs pa'i mdos ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' bsgom par bstan te /

original: rjes su rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: rjes su rnal 'byor ro //

original: le'u bcu gcig pa las gsungs pa'i thlhim zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdos skye mched byin gyis brlab pa bstan to //
analyzed: le'u bcu gcig pa las gsungs pa'i thlhim zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdos skye mched byin gyis brlab pa bstan to //

original: num nas brtsams spyi bo'i bar //
analyzed: num nas brtsams spyi bo'i bar //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa le'u brgyad pa las gsungs pa'i mdos phung po byin gyis brlab pa bstan to //

original: sa ni sangs rgyas spyan bshad pa /
analyzed: sa ni sangs rgyas spyan bshad pa /

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa le'u bcu bdun pa las gsungs pa'i rdo rje'i mdos khams byin gyis brlab pa bstan to //

original: le'u bcu gsum pa las gsungs pa'i khro bo'i 'khor lo bsgom pas yan lag dang nying lag la dgod pa bstan to zhes shin tu rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: le'u bcu gsum pa las gsungs pa'i khro bo'i 'khor lo bsgom pas yan lag dang nying lag la dgod pa bstan to zhes shin tu rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The consecration of the limbs and minor limbs is taught by the meditation on the wrathful wheel taught in the thirteenth chapter. Thus, it is the very highest yoga.

original: rdo rje dkyil 'khor dbus gnas pa //
analyzed: rdo rje dkyil 'khor dbus gnas pa //
translated: Abiding in the middle of the vajra maṇḍala,

original: zhes bya @4b ba la sogs pa le'u bcu gcig pa las gsungs pa'i mdos yi ge h'um la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya @4b ba la sogs pa le'u bcu gcig pa las gsungs pa'i mdos yi ge h'um la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bsgom par bya ste /
translated: and so forth. The meditation on Akṣobhya and so forth is taught by the Sūtra taught in the eleventh chapter, which is the transformation of the letter hūṃ and so forth.

original: le'u bcu gnyis pa las gsungs pa'i /
analyzed: le'u bcu gnyis pa las gsungs pa'i /
translated: The consecration of the body is taught by the Sūtra taught in the twelfth chapter.

analyzed: dpal ldan sangs rgyas sku 'chang pa //

analyzed: le'u bdun pa las gsungs pa'i rigs gsum gyi tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis nga rgyal byas la /
translated: One should do the pride with the verses of the three clans taught in the seventh chapter.

original: le'u drug pa las gsungs pa'i sngags rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: le'u drug pa las gsungs pa'i sngags rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: Having blessed with the mantras taught in the sixth chapter,

analyzed: sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa bstan to zhes rnal 'byor chen po'o //

original: phyag rgya 'dus byas pa ni le'u brgyad pa las bstan to //
analyzed: phyag rgya 'dus byas pa ni le'u brgyad pa las bstan to //
translated: The union of the created seal is taught in the eighth chapter.

original: le'u bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'i rigs kyi dbye ba'i mdos de la dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: le'u bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'i rigs kyi dbye ba'i mdos de la dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: The focusing on that is taught by the plow of the clan division taught in the fifteenth chapter.

original: le'u bdun pa las gsungs pa'i rdo rje mdos rdo rje dang padma la snyoms par 'jug pa bstan to //
analyzed: le'u bdun pa las gsungs pa'i rdo rje mdos rdo rje dang padma la snyoms par 'jug pa bstan to //
translated: The vajra plow is taught in the seventh chapter, and the vajra and lotus union is taught.

original: le'u dang po las gsungs pa'i rdo rje mdos de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa bstan to //
analyzed: le'u dang po las gsungs pa'i rdo rje mdos de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa bstan to //
translated: The vajra plow taught in the first chapter is the entry of all Ones-Gone-Thus.

original: de nyid las gsungs pa'i mdos dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor spro bar bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid las gsungs pa'i mdos dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor spro bar bstan to //
translated: The ritual action of summoning the pledge beings is taught by the ritual action mantra stated in that very [chapter].

original: le'u dang po nas gsungs pa'i phyung ba'i sngags kyis pha rol tu spro ba bstan to //
analyzed: le'u dang po nas gsungs pa'i phyung ba'i sngags kyis pha rol tu spro ba bstan to //
translated: The ritual action of summoning the wisdom beings is taught by the extracted mantra stated in the first chapter.

original: le'u dang po nas gsungs pa de nyid dang / le'u bcu gcig pa las gsungs pa'i mdos dbang bskur ba bstan to //
analyzed: le'u dang po nas gsungs pa de nyid dang / le'u bcu gcig pa las gsungs pa'i mdos dbang bskur ba bstan to //
translated: The ritual action of conferring empowerment is taught by the ritual action mantra stated in the first chapter and the one stated in the eleventh chapter.

original: le'u bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'i rdo rje mdos rgyas gdab pa bstan to //
analyzed: le'u bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'i rdo rje mdos rgyas gdab pa bstan to //
translated: The ritual action of sealing is taught by the vajra ritual action stated in the fifteenth chapter.

original: dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog gi //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog gi //
translated: The ritual action of the supreme king of maṇḍalas

original: le'u drug pa nas gsungs pa'i rdo rje mdos phra mo'i rnal 'byor bstan to //
analyzed: le'u drug pa nas gsungs pa'i rdo rje mdos phra mo'i rnal 'byor bstan to //
translated: is taught by the vajra ritual action of subtle yoga stated in the sixth chapter.

original: le'u gsum pa las gsungs pa'i rdo rje mdos de'i dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: le'u gsum pa las gsungs pa'i rdo rje mdos de'i dbye ba bstan to //
translated: The ritual action of its divisions is taught by the vajra ritual action stated in the third chapter.

original: le'u bcu gsum pa'am bdun pa las gsungs pa'i mdos bzlas pa'i cho ga bstan to //
analyzed: le'u bcu gsum pa'am bdun pa las gsungs pa'i mdos bzlas pa'i cho ga bstan to //
translated: The ritual action of the recitation procedure is taught by the ritual action stated in the thirteenth or seventh chapter.

original: le'u bcu bdun pa las gsungs pa'i mdos 'od du zhu ba dang / slar ldang ba dang / lha mo rnams kyis bskul ba dang // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstod pa bstan to //
analyzed: le'u bcu bdun pa las gsungs pa'i mdos 'od du zhu ba dang / slar ldang ba dang / lha mo rnams kyis bskul ba dang // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstod pa bstan to //
translated: The chapter seventeen passage teaches the dissolution into light, the rising up again, the urging by the goddesses, and the praise by the Tathagatas.

original: le'u bcu bdun pa dang / bcu gnyis pa dang / bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'i mdos tshim pa'i cho ga bstan to //
analyzed: le'u bcu bdun pa dang / bcu gnyis pa dang / bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'i mdos tshim pa'i cho ga bstan to //
translated: The chapter seventeen, chapter twelve, and chapter fifteen passages teach the rite of satisfaction.

original: le'u bcu bdun pa las gsungs pa'i mdos dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo nye bar bsdu ba bstan to //🔽le'u bcu @5a * //
analyzed: le'u bcu bdun pa las gsungs pa'i mdos dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo nye bar bsdu ba bstan to // le'u bcu @5a * //
translated: The chapter seventeen passage teaches the withdrawal of the mandala wheel.

original: gnyis pa las gsungs pa'i mdos nang gi sbyin sreg dang / mchod pa dang / gtor ma bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis pa las gsungs pa'i mdos nang gi sbyin sreg dang / mchod pa dang / gtor ma bstan to //
translated: The chapter twelve passage teaches the inner fire sacrifice, worship, and bali offering.🔽The chapter seventeen and chapter fifteen passages teach the rite of requesting departure and going to sleep.

original: le'u bcu bdun pa dang bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'i mdo dag gis gshegs su gsol ba dang / nyal pa'i cho ga dag bstan to zhes las kyi rgyal po mchog go//
analyzed: le'u bcu bdun pa dang bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'i mdo dag gis gshegs su gsol ba dang / nyal pa'i cho ga dag bstan to zhes las kyi rgyal po mchog go//
translated: Thus, the Supreme King of Yogatantras.

original: de ltar brjod par bya ba rnam pa du ma 'og nas dbye bas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar brjod par bya ba rnam pa du ma 'og nas dbye bas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the many topics to be expressed will be explained below by divisions.

original: sgra dang don dag gi brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid nyi 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: sgra dang don dag gi brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid nyi 'brel pa'o //
translated: The relation of word and meaning is the relation of the expressed and the expresser.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa ji ltar bshad par rigs she na /
analyzed: sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa ji ltar bshad par rigs she na /
translated: How is it proper to explain the relation of word and meaning?

original: gang gi phyir bde par gshegs pa rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bde par gshegs pa rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa med pa'o //
translated: Because there is no invariable concomitance of word and meaning, there is no relation of word and meaning.

original: de la 'brel pa ni rnam pa gnyis te de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / de las byung pa'i mtshan nyid de mi rtag pa dang byas pa la sogs pa bzhin dang me dang du ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de la 'brel pa ni rnam pa gnyis te de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / de las byung pa'i mtshan nyid de mi rtag pa dang byas pa la sogs pa bzhin dang me dang du ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: There are two kinds of relation: the relation of identity and the relation of origination, like impermanence and being produced, and like fire and smoke.

original: gnyis po de dag kyang sgra dang don gyi phyogs su med do //
analyzed: gnyis po de dag kyang sgra dang don gyi phyogs su med do //
translated: But neither of these two is present in the case of word and meaning.

original: gang gi phyir sgras ni skyes bu'i dgongs pa mngon par brjod pa'i phyi rol gyi don la skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgras ni skyes bu'i dgongs pa mngon par brjod pa'i phyi rol gyi don la skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because a word does not arise in external objects as the intention of a person is expressed.

original: phyi rol gyi don yon na yang de mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yon na yang de mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: Even if external objects existed, that would not occur,

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no desire on the part of the person.

original: phyi rol gyi don med kyang sgra 'byung ba mthong ba ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med kyang sgra 'byung ba mthong ba ste /
translated: Even if external objects did not exist, sound would occur,

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa 'jug pa'i phyir rgya mtsho la sogs pa'i sgra brjod pa bzhin no zhes rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med do //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa 'jug pa'i phyir rgya mtsho la sogs pa'i sgra brjod pa bzhin no zhes rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med do //
translated: because the desire of the person would be engaged, just as the sound of the ocean, etc. is uttered.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa sngon du 'gro ba yin la dper na me yod pas du ba 'byung ba dang / me med pas du ba skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes skye ba'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa sngon du 'gro ba yin la dper na me yod pas du ba 'byung ba dang / me med pas du ba skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes skye ba'i rim pa'o //
translated: The relation of cause and effect is preceded by the relation of invariable concomitance, as for example, smoke occurs when there is fire, and smoke does not occur when there is no fire.🔽The relation of invariable concomitance is also preceded by the relation of cognition, as for example, fire is known from the perception of smoke, and the absence of fire is known from the absence of smoke.

original: rtogs pa'i rim pa yang du ba mthong bas me shes pa dang / me med pas du ba med pa shes par 'gyur ro zhes sgra dang don dag gis de las byung ba'i 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rim pa yang du ba mthong bas me shes pa dang / me med pas du ba med pa shes par 'gyur ro zhes sgra dang don dag gis de las byung ba'i 'brel pa med do //
translated: The relation of invariable concomitance does not exist between words and their meanings.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The relation of identity also does not exist.

original: tha dad pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are perceived as different.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ni tha mi dad pa gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ni tha mi dad pa gtso bo yin te /
translated: The relation of identity is the principal nondifference.

original: shing dang sha pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shing dang sha pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the relation of a tree and a śiṃśapā.

original: bsgrub bya dang sgrub pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad ni gzhan sel ba'i blos byas te /
analyzed: bsgrub bya dang sgrub pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad ni gzhan sel ba'i blos byas te /
translated: The relation of the property-possessor and the property is a convention created by the mind that excludes other.

original: dngos po thams cad ni ldog pa du ma dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni ldog pa du ma dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all things have many exclusions.🔽Because all things

original: gang @5b phyir dngos kun rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: gang @5b phyir dngos kun rang bzhin gyis //
translated: are by nature

original: rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir //
analyzed: rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir //
translated: established in their own natures,

original: mthun dngos gzhan gyi dngos dag la //
analyzed: mthun dngos gzhan gyi dngos dag la //
translated: the relation of the property-possessor and the property

original: ldog pa la ni brten pa can //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa la ni brten pa can // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is based on exclusion.

original: sgra dang don dag la de lta bu'i mtshan nyid ma mthong ste /
analyzed: sgra dang don dag la de lta bu'i mtshan nyid ma mthong ste /
translated: We do not see such a relation between words and their referents.

original: gang gi phyir sgra ni khar yod pa dang / dngos po ni phyi rol du yod pa ste de dag tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra ni khar yod pa dang / dngos po ni phyi rol du yod pa ste de dag tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Because words exist in the mouth and things exist externally, they are different.

original: phan tshun las tha mi dad pa khas blangs nas bum pas kha khengs par 'gyur ba dang / me zhes brjod pas kha tshig par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes rigs pas de'i bdag nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: phan tshun las tha mi dad pa khas blangs nas bum pas kha khengs par 'gyur ba dang / me zhes brjod pas kha tshig par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes rigs pas de'i bdag nyid kyang med do //
translated: If you accept that the object is not different from the cognition, then the pot would fill the mouth when you say “pot,” and the fire would burn your mouth when you say “fire.”🔽Thus, by reasoning, the identity of the object and cognition is also refuted.

original: de bas nas brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i 'brel pa ni sgra dang don dag la mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bas nas brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i 'brel pa ni sgra dang don dag la mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, the relation between the object of expression and the means of expression is not tenable for words and meanings.

original: bden te rang gi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ni med de don gyi bya ba byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden te rang gi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ni med de don gyi bya ba byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: True, there is no relation of intrinsic identity because the object does not perform a function.

original: de med pa ni dngos po thams cad skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa ni dngos po thams cad skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because all things are momentary.

original: dngos po'i skad cig ma 'jig na sgra 'byung ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i skad cig ma 'jig na sgra 'byung ste /
translated: When a thing’s moment ends, the word arises.

original: de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid med pas brdar byas pa yang med do zhes sgras ni tha snyad gang la bya ba yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid med pas brdar byas pa yang med do zhes sgras ni tha snyad gang la bya ba yin /
translated: At that time, since there is no intrinsic identity, the conventional term is also absent. So what is the word’s referent?

original: rnam 'grel las kyang /🔽sgra rnams brdar byas pas don te /
analyzed: rnam 'grel las kyang / sgra rnams brdar byas pas don te /
translated: The Pramānﬁ avārtika says,🔽The meaning is that words are conventionally designated.

original: de ni tha snyad bya phyir bshad //
analyzed: de ni tha snyad bya phyir bshad //
translated: It is explained in order to make conventions.

original: de tshe rang gi mtshan nyid med //🔽des na de la brda med do //
analyzed: de tshe rang gi mtshan nyid med // des na de la brda med do //
translated: Then it has no intrinsic identity.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, there is no conventional usage for it.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba don gyi bya ba yin no zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba don gyi bya ba yin no zhes brjod na /
translated: If you say that the activity of the consciousness that has the characteristic of conceptualization is the activity of the object,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: that is not reasonable,

original: gsal bar snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no appearance of clarity.

original: gsal bar snang ba nyid ni don gyi bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba nyid ni don gyi bya ba yin no //
translated: The appearance of clarity is the activity of the object.

original: rigs pa'i thigs pa las kyang //
analyzed: rigs pa'i thigs pa las kyang //
translated: And the Drop of Logic says,

original: don gang zhig nye ba dang mi nye ba dag las shes pa la snang ba tha dad pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: don gang zhig nye ba dang mi nye ba dag las shes pa la snang ba tha dad pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: “That object which has a different appearance for consciousness depending on whether it is near or far is an intrinsic identity.

original: de las gzhan ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Any other is a universal.”

original: de bas na spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod de /
analyzed: de bas na spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod de /
translated: Therefore, there is a connection with a universal,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la so sor snang ba'i don ni spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la so sor snang ba'i don ni spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: because the object that appears individually to a conceptual consciousness is explained to be a universal.

original: de bas na rnam rtog la snang ba'i bum pa'i rnam pa las bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na rnam rtog la snang ba'i bum pa'i rnam pa las bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the word “pot” arises from the aspect of the pot that appears to a conceptual cognition.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa yod do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa yod do //
translated: There is a relation of cause and effect.

original: 'chad pa pos smras pa'i bum pa'i sgra las kyang nyan pa po rnam lar shes pa la bum pa'i rnam pa skye zhes go bzlogs pas kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa yod ngo //🔽sgra rnams rnam rtog las byung ba dang / sgra las rnam rtog rnams 'byung ba'i zhes @6a * //
analyzed: 'chad pa pos smras pa'i bum pa'i sgra las kyang nyan pa po rnam lar shes pa la bum pa'i rnam pa skye zhes go bzlogs pas kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa yod ngo // sgra rnams rnam rtog las byung ba dang / sgra las rnam rtog rnams 'byung ba'i zhes @6a * //
translated: And from the word “pot” spoken by the speaker, the aspect of a pot arises in the cognition of the listener.

original: bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained that words arise from conceptual cognitions and conceptual cognitions arise from words.

original: de ltar dngos po'i 'brel ba bgag nas sgra dang don gyi rnam par rtag pa'i 'brel ba bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po'i 'brel ba bgag nas sgra dang don gyi rnam par rtag pa'i 'brel ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, having refuted the relation of real entities, the relation of the word and the aspect of the object is presented.🔽All conventions of the word and object are made by the conventional expressions.

original: brjod pa kun rdzob kyis sgra dang don gnyis byas pa'i tha snyad thams cad 'di yin no zhes shin tu phal cher thal bas chog go //
analyzed: brjod pa kun rdzob kyis sgra dang don gnyis byas pa'i tha snyad thams cad 'di yin no zhes shin tu phal cher thal bas chog go //
translated: This is the most extensive explanation.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang phyir 'brel ba bstan pa yis //
analyzed: gang phyir 'brel ba bstan pa yis //
translated: Because the relation is taught,

original: nyan pa po rnams 'jug par 'gyur //🔽de phyir bstan bcos thams cad kyi //
analyzed: nyan pa po rnams 'jug par 'gyur // de phyir bstan bcos thams cad kyi //
translated: The listeners will be engaged.🔽Therefore, the connection

original: 'brel pa sngon du bshad pa yin //🔽zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa sngon du bshad pa yin // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: of all treatises is explained first.

original: dgos pa bstan par ma byas pas //
analyzed: dgos pa bstan par ma byas pas //
translated: The purpose should be stated,

original: dman pa yang ni 'jug mi 'gyur //
analyzed: dman pa yang ni 'jug mi 'gyur //
translated: because the inferior will not engage without it.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi dgos pa ni nges par brjod par bya ste de yang thos pa la sogs pa rab kyi tha mal pa'i lus spangs nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha'i sku thob pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi dgos pa ni nges par brjod par bya ste de yang thos pa la sogs pa rab kyi tha mal pa'i lus spangs nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha'i sku thob pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The purpose of the words should be stated, and that is said to be the attainment of the transcendent divine body, having abandoned the ordinary body of the lowest of the best of hearers and so on.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: That is the perfection of one's own purpose.

original: de'i dgos pa yang bstan pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i mtshan nyid de gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dgos pa yang bstan pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i mtshan nyid de gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The purpose of that is said to be the perfection of others' purposes, characterized by benefiting migrating beings through teaching and so on.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'gro ba ma lus rang bzhin mngon mdzad pa'i //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus rang bzhin mngon mdzad pa'i //
translated: The nature of all migrating beings is manifestly accomplished

original: de bzhin gshegs nyid gang gi zhal las byung //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs nyid gang gi zhal las byung //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: from the mouth of the Tathāgata himself.

original: gzhan dag na re phyin ci ma log pa'i rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni dgos pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re phyin ci ma log pa'i rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni dgos pa yin la /
translated: Others say: The purpose is the definition of unmistaken realization.

original: de khong du chud pas yi dam gyi lha'i sku thob pa ni de'i dgos pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de khong du chud pas yi dam gyi lha'i sku thob pa ni de'i dgos pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The attainment of the body of the deity of one's commitment through comprehending that is the purpose of that.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: gzhan gyi don med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhan gyi bya ba gtso bo yin no zhes brjod pa la sogs pa lnga po bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhan gyi bya ba gtso bo yin no zhes brjod pa la sogs pa lnga po bstan to //
translated: Because it is devoid of the purpose of others, the five topics are stated, beginning with the statement that the principal activity of bodhisattvas is for the sake of others.

original: yang na rab tu byed pa 'di'i dngos po gsum ni gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: yang na rab tu byed pa 'di'i dngos po gsum ni gtso bo yin te /
translated: Or else, in this treatise, the three topics are principal:

original: bya ba dang / bya ba'i 'bras bu dang / bya ba'i 'bras bu'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang / bya ba'i 'bras bu dang / bya ba'i 'bras bu'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: activity, the result of activity and the result of the result of activity.

original: de las mdor bsdus pa 'di le'u bcu bdun pa las bsdus pa ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las mdor bsdus pa 'di le'u bcu bdun pa las bsdus pa ni bya ba'o //
translated: In this regard, the summary in the seventeenth chapter is the activity.

original: bde blag tu 'gro bar rtogs pa ni bya ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bde blag tu 'gro bar rtogs pa ni bya ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The realization of the path of easy progress is the result of activity.

original: de rtogs pas dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa ni bya ba'i 'bras bu'i 'bras bu yin no zhes kha cig  zer ro //
analyzed: de rtogs pas dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa ni bya ba'i 'bras bu'i 'bras bu yin no zhes kha cig  zer ro //
translated: The attainment of the state of glorious Vajradhara through realizing that is the result of the result of activity.

original: de la dang po bgegs zhi bar bya ba'i phyag btsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang po bgegs zhi bar bya ba'i phyag btsal bar bya ste /
translated: First, one should pay homage in order to pacify obstacles.

original: gang gi phyir mngon par 'dod pa'i lha la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba ni 'jug pa yin no zhes dam pa rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon par 'dod pa'i lha la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba ni 'jug pa yin no zhes dam pa rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the practice of the holy ones that the preliminary is to pay homage to the deity of one's desire.

original: de la bgegs rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la bgegs rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of obstacles:

original: lus @6b kyi ni rims la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus @6b kyi ni rims la sogs pa'o //
translated: Physical obstacles are such things as fever.

original: ngag gi ni tshig rtsub la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi ni tshig rtsub la sogs pa'o //
translated: Verbal obstacles are such things as harsh speech.

original: sems kyi ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Mental obstacles are such things as attachment.

original: yang na bems po dang bems po ma yin pa dang / gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ni bgegs so //
analyzed: yang na bems po dang bems po ma yin pa dang / gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ni bgegs so //
translated: Alternatively, obstacles are of the nature of both the inanimate and the animate and both.

original: bams po ni grang ba dang dro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bams po ni grang ba dang dro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The inanimate are cold, heat, and so on.

original: bems po ma yin pa ni rgyal po'i rtsod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bems po ma yin pa ni rgyal po'i rtsod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The animate are disputes with the king and so on.

original: gnyi ga ni gnyi gas sbrul pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ni gnyi gas sbrul pa'o //
translated: Both are both.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽Too much rain and drought,

original: shin tu char dang char dkon dang // byi ba cha ga ne tsho dang // phan tshun rtsod pa'i rgyal po rnams //
analyzed: shin tu char dang char dkon dang // byi ba cha ga ne tsho dang // phan tshun rtsod pa'i rgyal po rnams //
translated: rats, quarrels, and kings who fight among themselves,

original: drug po rnam par 'tshe bar bshad //
analyzed: drug po rnam par 'tshe bar bshad //
translated: These six are said to be harmful.🔽🔽

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: The six are said to be the obstacles.

original: bgegs rnams de dag thams cad bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal bas rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bgegs rnams de dag thams cad bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal bas rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All these obstacles are completely pacified by the homage to the Blessed One.

original: 'dir rigs pa ni phyag 'tshal bar byas nas skyes bu chen po la rab tu bstod pas bsod nams thob cing bsod nams ma yin pas ldog pas mi dge ba las byung ba'i phyi dang nang gi bgegs rnams nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes bde bas bstan
analyzed: 'dir rigs pa ni phyag 'tshal bar byas nas skyes bu chen po la rab tu bstod pas bsod nams thob cing bsod nams ma yin pas ldog pas mi dge ba las byung ba'i phyi dang nang gi bgegs rnams nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes bde bas bstan
translated: Here, the reasoning is that by performing the homage, one attains merit through the great being's praise, and non-merit is averted. Thus, the external and internal obstacles arising from non-virtue are completely pacified. This is taught by the Blessed One.

original: bcos rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes 'gal ba dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: bcos rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes 'gal ba dmigs pa'am /
translated: The statement the composition will be completed is an observation of contradiction,

original: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i phyag 'tshal bas bgegs nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i phyag 'tshal bas bgegs nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or an observation of a contradictory effect. By the homage, the obstacles are completely pacified.

original: dper na 'dir ni grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir dang de bzhin du 'di na ba mo'i reg pa med de du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dir ni grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir dang de bzhin du 'di na ba mo'i reg pa med de du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, here there is no cold touch because there is fire, and similarly, here there is no touch of frost because there is smoke.

original: khams gsum spyod pa las grol mkha' dang mnyam gyur dngos kun ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: khams gsum spyod pa las grol mkha' dang mnyam gyur dngos kun ngo bo nyid //
translated: Liberated from the activities of the three realms, equal to space, the nature of all things,

original: dag cing zhi ba rnams dben bde mchog rang bzhin rnal 'byor pa nyid yul //
analyzed: dag cing zhi ba rnams dben bde mchog rang bzhin rnal 'byor pa nyid yul //
translated: pure, peaceful, isolated, the supreme bliss, the nature of the yogi himself, the object.

original: rtogs dka' brtag par dka' la bdag gzhan rab phan khyab cing spros pa med //
analyzed: rtogs dka' brtag par dka' la bdag gzhan rab phan khyab cing spros pa med //
translated: Difficult to realize, difficult to comprehend, benefiting self and other, pervasive, unelaborate,

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi zhi ba mnyam med mnyam sku mi rtogs tshul gcig la phyag 'tshal /
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi zhi ba mnyam med mnyam sku mi rtogs tshul gcig la phyag 'tshal /
translated: I pay homage to the peace of the victors, the unequaled, equal, nonconceptual, single body.

original: zhes smros pa las /
analyzed: zhes smros pa las /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rgya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku ste /
analyzed: rgya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku ste /
translated: The extensive explanation is the body of the buddhas.

original: sku gsum la phyag 'tshal ba ni 'dud de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: sku gsum la phyag 'tshal ba ni 'dud de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: The homage to the three bodies is bowing down. What is it like?

original: khams gsum spyod pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams so //
analyzed: khams gsum spyod pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams so //
translated: The activities of the three realms are the afflictive and knowledge obscurations.

original: de rnams las grol ba ni bral ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams las grol ba ni bral ba'o //
translated: Liberated from them is being free.

original: de bzhin du mkha' dang mnyam gyur pa ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mkha' dang mnyam gyur pa ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar gnas pa'o //
translated: Similarly, equal to space is abiding like space.

original: bum pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i phyogs gcig pa yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i phyogs gcig pa yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Is it the same as the space in a vase? No, it is not.

original: dngos po kun gyi ngo bo nyid //🔽ces bya ba ni sems can dang / snod kyi @7a * //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi ngo bo nyid // ces bya ba ni sems can dang / snod kyi @7a * //
translated: The nature of all things.

original: 'jig rten ngag gi chos nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten ngag gi chos nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature of the speech of the world of beings and the world of the container.

original: des ni chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi phyag 'tshal bar bstan to //
analyzed: des ni chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi phyag 'tshal bar bstan to //
translated: This shows the homage to the nature of the body of truth.

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni zhing yongs su dag pas na dag pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni zhing yongs su dag pas na dag pa'o //
translated: The Buddha is pure because of the purity of the field.

original: 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pas na zhi ba'o //
translated: He is peace because of the nature of clear light.

original: chos kyi sku las byung bas na rnam dben pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku las byung bas na rnam dben pa'o //
translated: He is isolated because of the origination of the body of truth.

original: chos kyi bdud rtsis gang bas na bde mchog gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi bdud rtsis gang bas na bde mchog gi rang bzhin no //
translated: He is the nature of supreme bliss because of being filled with the nectar of truth.

original: sa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul yin pas na rnal 'byor pa nyid yul lo //
analyzed: sa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul yin pas na rnal 'byor pa nyid yul lo //
translated: He is the object of the yogi because of being the domain of the bodhisattvas who have attained the levels.

original: des ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin gyi phyag 'tshal bar bstan to //🔽sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos dang bral bas na rtogs dka' brtag par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: des ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin gyi phyag 'tshal bar bstan to // sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos dang bral bas na rtogs dka' brtag par dka' ba ste /
translated: This shows the homage to the nature of the body of perfect enjoyment.🔽It is difficult to realize because it is free from the phenomena of mind and mental factors.

original: sku dang gsung gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku dang gsung gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to conceive because it is the essence of body and speech.

original: skye ba la sogs pa bstan pas bdag la rab phan no //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa bstan pas bdag la rab phan no //
translated: The teaching of birth, etc. is for one's own benefit.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba bstan pas gzhan la rab phan no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba bstan pas gzhan la rab phan no //
translated: The teaching of the performance of the aims of beings is for the benefit of others.

original: kun du 'gro bas na khyab pa ste /
analyzed: kun du 'gro bas na khyab pa ste /
translated: The word pervading means all-pervading.

original: dgon pa la 'bar ba'i me bzhin no //
analyzed: dgon pa la 'bar ba'i me bzhin no //
translated: It is like a forest fire.

original: chos kyi skur gyur pas na spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi skur gyur pas na spros pa med pa'o //
translated: The word unconstructed means having the nature of the Dharma Body.

original: des ni sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin gyis phyag 'tshal bar bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin gyis phyag 'tshal bar bstan to //
translated: This shows the homage with the nature of the Transformation Body.

original: nye bar bsdu bar bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu bar bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the summary is to be explained:

original: zhi ba ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Peace is the Dharma Body.

original: mnyam med ni de nyid do //
analyzed: mnyam med ni de nyid do //
translated: It is unequaled because of its uniqueness.

original: de dang mnyam pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de dang mnyam pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: It is equal because of the equality of the Enjoyment Body.

original: sems dang bral ba'i phyir mi rtogs tshul gcig ces bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: sems dang bral ba'i phyir mi rtogs tshul gcig ces bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The word one means non-conceptual, because of the absence of mind in the Transformation Body.

original: de ltar rgyal ba rnams kyi rnam pa gsum gyi sku la phyag 'tshal lo zhes yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar rgyal ba rnams kyi rnam pa gsum gyi sku la phyag 'tshal lo zhes yi ge'i don to //
translated: Thus, I pay homage to the three bodies of the Victorious Ones is the meaning of the words.

original: khams gsum spyod pa las 'grol ba ni bgegs bskrad pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum spyod pa las 'grol ba ni bgegs bskrad pa'o //
translated: The removal of obstacles is the removal of the three worldlinesses.🔽

original: mkha' dang mnyam par gyur pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mkha' dang mnyam par gyur pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Equal to space means the nature of emptiness.

original: dngos kun ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes kyi gzhi'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dngos kun ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes kyi gzhi'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of all things means the nature of the basis of gnosis, which is the nature of the five transcendent ones.

original: ngag pa ni rin chen sna bdun gyi rang bzhin gyi gzhal yas khang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ngag pa ni rin chen sna bdun gyi rang bzhin gyi gzhal yas khang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of the palace means the nature of the immeasurable palace, which is the nature of the seven precious things.

original: lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin yin pas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin yin pas na zhi ba'o //
translated: Peaceful means the nature of the mandala of resolute interest.

original: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo yin pas na rnam dben no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo yin pas na rnam dben no //
translated: Solitary means the nature of the ultimate mandala.

original: gdan gyi dbye ba'i ngo bo yin pas na bde mchog rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gdan gyi dbye ba'i ngo bo yin pas na bde mchog rang bzhin no //
translated: Supreme bliss means the nature of the mandala of the divisions of seats.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas na rnal 'byor pa nyid yul lo //🔽yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas na rtogs dka' ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas na rnal 'byor pa nyid yul lo // yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas na rtogs dka' ba'o //
translated: The object of the yogi means the nature of the gnosis of the dharmadhatu.🔽Difficult to realize means the nature of the three syllables.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las @7b rdo rje'i rnam pa yin pas na brtag par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las @7b rdo rje'i rnam pa yin pas na brtag par dka' ba'o //
translated: Difficult to analyze means the nature of the form of the vajra.

original: spro ba'i bdag nyid yin pas na bdag dang gzhan la rab phan no //
analyzed: spro ba'i bdag nyid yin pas na bdag dang gzhan la rab phan no //
translated: Since it has the nature of delight, it is the benefit of self and other.

original: de'i nga rgyal gyi bdag nyid yin pas na khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nga rgyal gyi bdag nyid yin pas na khyab pa'o //
translated: Since it has the nature of pride, it is pervasive.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gcig tu bsdus pas na spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gcig tu bsdus pas na spros pa med pa'o //
translated: Since it is the single collection of all tathāgatas, it is unelaborate.

original: rgyal ba'i sku ni dpal rdo rje 'chang gi sku 'grub pa ste rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sku ni dpal rdo rje 'chang gi sku 'grub pa ste rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The victor’s body is the accomplishment of the body of glorious Vajradhara, which is yoga.

original: ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i bdag nyid yin pas na zhi ba ste /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i bdag nyid yin pas na zhi ba ste /
translated: Since it has the nature of the gnosis being and the concentration being, it is peace.

original: rjes su rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: rjes su rnal 'byor ro //
translated: It is subsequent yoga.

original: mnyam med ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: mnyam med ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: The unequaled are the tathāgatas and bodhisattvas.

original: de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pas na mnyam med mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pas na mnyam med mnyam pa ste /
translated: Since they are empowered by them, it is the empowerment of the unequaled, which is very unequaled.

original: shin tu rnal 'byor ro //🔽sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlabs pas na mi rtog tshul gcig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: shin tu rnal 'byor ro // sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlabs pas na mi rtog tshul gcig ces bya ba ste /
translated: It is extremely unequaled.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'o //
translated: Since the body, speech, and mind are empowered, it is the single principle of nonconceptuality, which is great yoga.

original: de ltar dang po'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid yin pas na spyi'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar dang po'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid yin pas na spyi'i don to //
translated: Since it is the nature of the first yoga, it is the general meaning.

original: khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba //
analyzed: khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba //
translated: Liberated from the activities of the three realms.

original: zhes bya ba ni rlung gsum nye bar bsdus pas gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rlung gsum nye bar bsdus pas gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: This is the single state of the three winds gathered together.

original: mkha' dang mnyam gyur pa ni 'dod pa'i gdugs kyi rtsa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: mkha' dang mnyam gyur pa ni 'dod pa'i gdugs kyi rtsa la gnas pa ste /
translated: Becoming equal to space, it abides in the desire-realm channel parasol.

original: rtsa dbu ma la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa dbu ma la gnas pa'o //
translated: It abides in the central channel.

original: dngos kun do bo nyid ces bya ba ni spyod pa dang mi spyod pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dngos kun do bo nyid ces bya ba ni spyod pa dang mi spyod pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The nature of all things refers to the nature of the active and inactive.

original: sna yi rtse mor yungs kar bsam //
analyzed: sna yi rtse mor yungs kar bsam //
translated: Visualize a mustard seed at the tip of the nose.

original: 'gro dang mi 'gro yungs kar las //🔽zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'gro dang mi 'gro yungs kar las // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The moving and unmoving world arises from the mustard seed.

original: / kunda ltar dkar ba yin pas na dag pa'o //
analyzed: / kunda ltar dkar ba yin pas na dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure because it is white like a jasmine flower.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo yin pas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo yin pas na zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peaceful because it is the nature of nonconceptuality.

original: yungs kar gyi tshad tsam yin pa'i phyir rnam dben no //
analyzed: yungs kar gyi tshad tsam yin pa'i phyir rnam dben no //
translated: It is isolated because it is the size of a mustard seed.

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa las byung bas na bde mchog rang bzhin no //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa las byung bas na bde mchog rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of supreme bliss because it arises from the union of method and wisdom.

original: rang rigs pas na rnal 'byor pa nyid yul lo //
analyzed: rang rigs pas na rnal 'byor pa nyid yul lo //
translated: It is the object of the yogi because it is of the same kind.

original: rags pa dang phra ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas na rtogs dka' brtag par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: rags pa dang phra ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas na rtogs dka' brtag par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to realize and difficult to investigate, because it is free from gross and subtle discursive thought.

original: spro ba dang bsdu bdag gis 'gro ba'i don mdzad pas na bdag dang gzhan la rab phan no //
analyzed: spro ba dang bsdu bdag gis 'gro ba'i don mdzad pas na bdag dang gzhan la rab phan no //
translated: It is of benefit to self and other, because it acts for the benefit of beings by expanding and contracting.

original: 'gro ba skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas na khyab ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas na khyab ba'o //
translated: It is pervasive, because it is the cause of the creation of the world.

original: phung po dang dbang po dang rlung nye bar bsdus pas na spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang dbang po dang rlung nye bar bsdus pas na spros pa med pa'o //
translated: It is free from elaboration, because it includes the aggregates, faculties, and winds.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phung po rnams kyi nye bar grags pa'i rgyal ba rnams nye bar bsdus pas na rgyal ba'i sku ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phung po rnams kyi nye bar grags pa'i rgyal ba rnams nye bar bsdus pas na rgyal ba'i sku ste /
translated: It is the body of the Victor, because it includes the Victors, who are well known as the aggregates.

original: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is of the nature of the Dharma Body, the Enjoyment Body, and the Apparition Body.

original: de nyid bshad pa zhi ba ni gsang ba'i sna rtse la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa zhi ba ni gsang ba'i sna rtse la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is explained as peace, because it abides at the tip of the secret place.

original: mnyam med @8a * //
analyzed: mnyam med @8a * //
translated: It is unequaled,

original: mnyam pa ni snying ga'i padma'i nang na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa ni snying ga'i padma'i nang na gnas pa'o //
translated: because it abides in the heart center.

original: mi rtog tshul gcig ces bya ba ni kun rdzob sna'i rtse la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtog tshul gcig ces bya ba ni kun rdzob sna'i rtse la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the single mode of non-conceptuality, because it abides at the tip of the nose in the relative.

original: phyag 'tshal ba ni nyams su myong ba ste sbas pa'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba ni nyams su myong ba ste sbas pa'o //
translated: The homage is the experience, the hidden.

original: snang ba gsum dang bral bas na khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba gsum dang bral bas na khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba'o //
translated: Since it is free from the three appearances, it is free from the conduct of the three realms.

original: 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pas na nam mkha' dang mnyam gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pas na nam mkha' dang mnyam gyur pa'o //
translated: Since it is the nature of clear light, it is equal to space.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i ngo bo yin pas na dngos kun ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i ngo bo yin pas na dngos kun ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Since it is the nature of the animate and inanimate, it is the nature of all things.

original: shes rab kyi rang bzhin dang bral bas na dag pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi rang bzhin dang bral bas na dag pa'o //
translated: Since it is free from the nature of wisdom, it is pure.

original: thabs kyi rang bzhin dang bral bas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi rang bzhin dang bral bas na zhi ba'o //
translated: Since it is free from the nature of method, it is peace.

original: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin dang bral bas na rnam dben no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin dang bral bas na rnam dben no //
translated: Since it is free from the nature of ignorance, it is isolated.

original: phyag rgya'i thabs kyis thob pas na bde mchog rang bzhin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i thabs kyis thob pas na bde mchog rang bzhin no //
translated: Since it is attained by the method of the seal, it is the nature of supreme bliss.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas blang bar bya bas na rnal 'byor pa nyid yul lo //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas blang bar bya bas na rnal 'byor pa nyid yul lo //
translated: Since it is to be taken up by the yoga of the perfection stage, it is the object of the yogi.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mi shes pas rtogs par dka'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mi shes pas rtogs par dka'o //
translated: Since it is not known by the yoga of the perfections, it is difficult to understand.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs par dka' bas na brtag par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs par dka' bas na brtag par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to investigate because it is difficult to realize for yogins of the stage of generation.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rgyur gyur pas na bdag gzhan rab phan no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rgyur gyur pas na bdag gzhan rab phan no //
translated: It is the highest benefit for self and other because it is the cause of benefiting self and other.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas na khyab pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas na khyab pa'o //
translated: It is pervasive because it is the nature of the gnosis of the dharmadhatu.

original: snang ba la sogs pa'i gsal ba gsum bral bas na spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa'i gsal ba gsum bral bas na spros pa med pa'o //
translated: It is free of elaboration because it is free of the three illuminations of appearance and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo yin pas na rgyal ba rnams kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo yin pas na rgyal ba rnams kyi sku'o //
translated: It is the body of the victors because it is the essence of all tathagatas.

original: zla ba'i snang ba yin pas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i snang ba yin pas na zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because it is the appearance of the moon.

original: nyi ma ltar snang ba yin pas na mnyam med mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma ltar snang ba yin pas na mnyam med mnyam pa'o //
translated: It is unequaled equality because it is the appearance like the sun.

original: mtshams kyi snang ba dang de dag dang bral bas na mi rtog tshul gcig ces bya ba ste sbas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi snang ba dang de dag dang bral bas na mi rtog tshul gcig ces bya ba ste sbas pa'o //
translated: It is the single mode of nonconceptuality because it is free from the appearance of the directions and so on.

original: snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa dang bral pa'i bsgoms pa las byung bas na khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa dang bral pa'i bsgoms pa las byung bas na khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba'o //
translated: It is liberated from the activities of the three realms because it is the meditation free from the attainment of appearance and so on.

original: 'od gsal ba las byung bas na nam mkha' dang mnyam par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba las byung bas na nam mkha' dang mnyam par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is equal to space, since it arises from the clear light.

original: sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis dang mtshungs pas na dngos kun ngo bo nyid do //🔽chos kyi skur bdag byin gyis brlabs pas na dag pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis dang mtshungs pas na dngos kun ngo bo nyid do // chos kyi skur bdag byin gyis brlabs pas na dag pa'o //
translated: It is the nature of all things, since it is similar to the twelve examples of illusion.🔽It is pure, since it is the consecration of the body of truth.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur bdag byin gyis brlabs pas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur bdag byin gyis brlabs pas na zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace, since it is the consecration of the body of communal enjoyment.

original: sprul pa'i skur bdag byin gyis brlabs pas na rnam dben no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i skur bdag byin gyis brlabs pas na rnam dben no //
translated: It is isolation, since it is the consecration of the emanation body.

original: rang rig pas na bde ba mchog rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang rig pas na bde ba mchog rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of supreme bliss, since it is self-knowing.

original: sa bcu pa la ye @8b shes kyi dbang nyid thob pas na rnal 'byor pa nyid yul lo //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la ye @8b shes kyi dbang nyid thob pas na rnal 'byor pa nyid yul lo //
translated: It is the object of the yogi, since it is the attainment of the consecration of intuition on the tenth stage.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa bcom pas na rtogs dka' brtag par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa bcom pas na rtogs dka' brtag par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to realize, since it is difficult to conceive, having destroyed the conceptions in one's own and others' continuums.

original: sgyu ma lta bu yin na yang bdag dang gzhan la phan par mdzad pas na bdag gzhan rab phan no //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu yin na yang bdag dang gzhan la phan par mdzad pas na bdag gzhan rab phan no //
translated: It is the benefit of self and other, since it benefits self and other, even though it is like an illusion.

original: chu'i zla ba dang 'dra bas na khyab pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i zla ba dang 'dra bas na khyab pa'o //
translated: It is pervasive, since it is like the moon in the water.

original: 'od gsal ba las byung bas na spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba las byung bas na spros pa med pa'o //
translated: It is free from conceptual elaboration because it arises from clear light.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mos pa'i dbye bas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sku 'chang bas na rgyal ba rnams kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mos pa'i dbye bas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sku 'chang bas na rgyal ba rnams kyi sku'o //
translated: It is the body of the victors because it bears the bodies of the five tathāgatas by the division of the aspects of interest.

original: dam tshig sems dpa'i ngo bo yin pas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa'i ngo bo yin pas na zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because it is the nature of the commitment being.

original: ye shes sems dpa'i ngo bo yin pas na mnyam med mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa'i ngo bo yin pas na mnyam med mnyam pa'o //
translated: It is unequaled equality because it is the nature of the wisdom being.

original: ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i ngo bo yin pas na rtog med tshul gcig ste sbas pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i ngo bo yin pas na rtog med tshul gcig ste sbas pa'o //
translated: It is the single way of nonconceptuality because it is the nature of the concentration being.

original: chags pa dag chags pa dang bral ba dang / chags pa bar ma dang bral bas na khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa dag chags pa dang bral ba dang / chags pa bar ma dang bral bas na khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba'o //
translated: It is free from the conduct of the three realms because it is free from attachment, from the absence of attachment, and from the absence of attachment in the middle.

original: nam mkha' spros pa thams cad zhi ba yin pas nam mkha' dang mnyam gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' spros pa thams cad zhi ba yin pas nam mkha' dang mnyam gyur ba'o //
translated: It is equal to space because space is the pacification of all conceptual elaboration.

original: khams gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas na dngos kun ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas na dngos kun ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of all things because it is the nature of the three realms.

original: chags pa spong bas na dag pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa spong bas na dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure because it abandons attachment.

original: chags pa dang bral ba med pas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba med pas na zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because it is free from the absence of attachment.

original: chags pa dang bral bas rnam dben no //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral bas rnam dben no //
translated: It is isolated, being free from attachment.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir bde mchog gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir bde mchog gi rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of the supreme bliss, because it is innate.
