original: rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyi tshad mas rtogs pas na rnal 'byor pa nyid yul lo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyi tshad mas rtogs pas na rnal 'byor pa nyid yul lo //
translated: It is the object of the yogi, because it is realized by the valid cognition of yogic perception.

original: smig rgyu la sogs pa'i rtags med pas na rtogs dka'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu la sogs pa'i rtags med pas na rtogs dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to realize, because there are no signs such as mirages.

original: phra ba'i lta bas rtogs pas brtag dka' ba'o //
analyzed: phra ba'i lta bas rtogs pas brtag dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to investigate, because it is realized by subtle views.

original: de las ldang ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don grub pas na bdag gzhan rab phan no //
analyzed: de las ldang ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don grub pas na bdag gzhan rab phan no //
translated: It is the benefit of self and other, because the benefit of self and other is accomplished from it.

original: kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems kyi nam mkha'i khams thams cad khyab pas na khyab pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems kyi nam mkha'i khams thams cad khyab pas na khyab pa'o //
translated: It is pervasive, because the relative bodhicitta pervades the entire realm of space.

original: don dam pa byang chub sems ni rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas na spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa byang chub sems ni rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas na spros pa med pa'o //
translated: The ultimate bodhicitta is free from conceptuality, so it is free of proliferation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyal ba rnams kyi sku ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyal ba rnams kyi sku ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku'o //
translated: For that reason, the body of the victors is the dharmakāya of the buddhas.

original: zhi ba ni ril por 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni ril por 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is peace, because it is realized by the samādhi of grasping the whole.

original: mnyam med mnyam pa ni rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis thob pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam med mnyam pa ni rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis thob pa'o //
translated: The incomparable equality is attained by the samādhi of subsequent destruction.

original: thams cad kyi 'bras bu yin pas na mi rtog tshul gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi 'bras bu yin pas na mi rtog tshul gcig go //
translated: Since it is the result of all, it is the single mode of non-conceptuality.

original: phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid du byas pa ste mthar thug pa'o //🔽khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba ni 'jig rten @9a * //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid du byas pa ste mthar thug pa'o // khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba ni 'jig rten @9a * //
translated: The phrase I pay homage is the culmination of self-empowerment.

original: gyi chos brgyad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gyi chos brgyad dang bral ba'o //
translated: Liberated from the conduct of the three realms, it is free from the eight worldly dharmas.

original: mkha' dang mnyam gyur pa ni sa bcu gnyis pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' dang mnyam gyur pa ni sa bcu gnyis pa thob pa'o //
translated: Having become equal to space, it attains the twelfth stage.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pas na dngos kun ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pas na dngos kun ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Since it is the nature of the vajra-like samādhi, it is the intrinsic nature of all entities.

original: kun rdzob kyi rnam par rtog pa spong bas na dag pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi rnam par rtog pa spong bas na dag pa'o //
translated: Since it abandons relative conceptuality, it is pure.

original: don dam pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas na zhi ba'o ;
analyzed: don dam pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas na zhi ba'o ;
translated: Since it is free from ultimate conceptuality, it is peace.

original: / bden pa gnyis dang gnyis su med pas na rnam dben no //
analyzed: / bden pa gnyis dang gnyis su med pas na rnam dben no //
translated: Since it is neither of the two truths nor non-dual, it is isolated.

original: chos kyi bdud rtsi'i char 'bebs pas na bde mchog gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi bdud rtsi'i char 'bebs pas na bde mchog gi rang bzhin no //
translated: Since it rains down the nectar of Dharma, it is the nature of supreme bliss.

original: zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis khong du chud pas na rnal 'byor pa nyid yul lo //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis khong du chud pas na rnal 'byor pa nyid yul lo //
translated: It is the domain of the yogis, because it is realized by the yogis who are endowed with uncontaminated intuition.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin pas na rtogs dka'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin pas na rtogs dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to understand, because it is the domain of supramundane intuition.

original: de'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa yin pas na brtag dka' ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa yin pas na brtag dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to analyze, because it is the aspect of the intuition attained subsequently to that supramundane intuition.

original: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la phan 'dogs pas na bdag gzhan rab phan no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la phan 'dogs pas na bdag gzhan rab phan no //
translated: It is the benefit of self and other, because it benefits the life-streams of all sentient beings.

original: mtha' gnyis dang bral bas na khyab pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis dang bral bas na khyab pa'o //
translated: It is pervasive, because it is free from the two extremes.

original: de nyid kyi phyir spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir spros pa med pa'o //
translated: It is free from conceptual elaboration, for the same reason.

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi sku zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid do //🔽phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rnam par rtog pa med pas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi sku zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid do // phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rnam par rtog pa med pas na zhi ba'o //
translated: The body of the victors is the nature of all the buddhas.🔽It is peace, because it is free from the conceptualization of the realm of nirvana with and without remainder of the aggregates.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa la sogs pa spong bas na mnyam med mnyam ba'o ;
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa la sogs pa spong bas na mnyam med mnyam ba'o ;
translated: It is the equality of the unequaled, because it is free from the conceptualization of the aspects and the non-aspects, etc.

original: /'bras bu'i ngo bo yin pas na mi rtog tshul gcig go //
analyzed: /'bras bu'i ngo bo yin pas na mi rtog tshul gcig go //
translated: Since it is the nature of the result, it is the single principle of non-conceptuality.

original: phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid du 'jug par bya zhes pa'i don te mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid du 'jug par bya zhes pa'i don te mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Homage is the meaning of engaging in that nature, which is the ultimate.

original: de ni bshad pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ni bshad pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: That is the fourfold explanation.

original: yang na khams gsum spyod pa las grol zhes bya ba ni thugs rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na khams gsum spyod pa las grol zhes bya ba ni thugs rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin no //
translated: Alternatively, liberated from the conduct of the three realms is the nature of Cittavajra Vajradhara.

original: mkha' dang mnyam gyur zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mkha' dang mnyam gyur zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Become equal to space is the nature of Ratnavajra Amitābha.

original: dngos kun ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dngos kun ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of all things is the nature of Buddhalocanā.

original: dag pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin no //🔽zhi ba ni don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin no //🔽rnam dben ni spyan gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dag pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin no // zhi ba ni don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin no // rnam dben ni spyan gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Pure is the nature of Amitavajra Akṣobhya.🔽Peace is the nature of Amoghavajra Vajrapāṇi.🔽Solitary is the nature of Māmakī.

original: bde mchog rang bzhin ni m'a ma k'i'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bde mchog rang bzhin ni m'a ma k'i'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Supreme bliss is the nature of Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: rnal 'byor pa nyid yul ni gos dkar mo'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa nyid yul ni gos dkar mo'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The object of the yogi is the nature of Tārā.

original: rtogs dka' ni sgrol ma'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rtogs dka' ni sgrol ma'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Difficult to realize is the nature of Bhṛkuṭī.

original: brtag par dka' ba ni gshin rje mthar byed kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: brtag par dka' ba ni gshin rje mthar byed kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Difficult to examine is the nature of Yamantaka.

original: bdag gzhan rab phan ni shes rab mthar byed kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gzhan rab phan ni shes rab mthar byed kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Beneficial to self and other is the nature of Prajnantaka.

original: khyab pa ni padma mthar byed kyi bdag @9b nyid do ;
analyzed: khyab pa ni padma mthar byed kyi bdag @9b nyid do ;
translated: Pervasive is the nature of Padmantaka.

original: / spros pa med pa ni bgegs mthar byed kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: / spros pa med pa ni bgegs mthar byed kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Free from conceptual elaboration is the nature of Vighnantaka.

original: zhi ba ni byams pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgyad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhi ba ni byams pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgyad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Peaceful is the nature of the eight bodhisattvas, Maitreya and so forth.

original: mnyam med mnyam pa ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa mchod pa'i lha mo lnga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mnyam med mnyam pa ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa mchod pa'i lha mo lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Unequaled and equal is the nature of the five offering goddesses, Rupavajra and so forth.

original: mi rtog tshul gcig ni khro bo'i rgyal po bcu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi rtog tshul gcig ni khro bo'i rgyal po bcu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The single mode of nonconceptuality is the nature of the ten kings of wrath.

original: de dang 'dra ba rgyal ba rnams kyi sku ni /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba rgyal ba rnams kyi sku ni /
translated: The body of the Victorious Ones, similar to that,🔽is Vajradhara, the nature of the mandala circle of thirty-two deities.

original: rdo rje 'chang sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal ba ni 'dud ces bya ba tshig gi don te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal ba ni 'dud ces bya ba tshig gi don te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: Homage to that is the meaning of the word bow, which is literal.

original: khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba ni nang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba ni nang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Freedom from the activities of the three realms is the nature of inner emptiness.

original: mkha' dang mnyam gyur pa ni phyi stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mkha' dang mnyam gyur pa ni phyi stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Equality with space is the nature of outer emptiness.

original: dngos kun ngo bo nyid ni phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos kun ngo bo nyid ni phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of all things is the nature of inner and outer emptiness.

original: dag pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dag pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Purity is the nature of emptiness.

original: zhi ba ni chen po stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhi ba ni chen po stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Peace is the nature of great emptiness.

original: rnam dben ni don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam dben ni don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Isolation is the nature of ultimate emptiness.

original: bde mchog rang bzhin ni 'dus khyas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bde mchog rang bzhin ni 'dus khyas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Supreme bliss is the nature of emptiness of all phenomena.

original: rnal 'byor pa nyid yul ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //🔽rtogs dka' ba ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa nyid yul ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no // rtogs dka' ba ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The object of the yogi is the nature of emptiness of non-things.🔽Difficult to realize is the nature of emptiness of the unlimited.

original: brtag par dka' ba ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: brtag par dka' ba ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Difficult to investigate is the nature of emptiness of the inherent nature.

original: bdag gzhan rab phan ni thob ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag gzhan rab phan ni thob ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The benefit of self and other is the nature of emptiness without beginning or end.

original: khyab pa ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: khyab pa ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Pervasion is the nature of emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: spros pa med pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: spros pa med pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Freedom from conceptual elaboration is the nature of emptiness of all phenomena.

original: zhi ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //🔽mnyam med mnyam pa ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhi ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no // mnyam med mnyam pa ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Peace is the nature of emptiness of specific characteristics.🔽Uniqueness of equality is the nature of emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: mi rtog tshul gcig ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi rtog tshul gcig ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Non-conceptuality of the single mode is the nature of emptiness of non-things.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rang bzhin rgyal ba rnams kyi sku ni rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo zhes sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rang bzhin rgyal ba rnams kyi sku ni rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo zhes sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, the body of the Victorious Ones, which is the nature of the sixteen emptinesses, is Vajrasattva. This is the non-literal meaning.

original: khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba ni snang ba chung ba'i bdag nyid do ;
analyzed: khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba ni snang ba chung ba'i bdag nyid do ;
translated: Liberation from the conduct of the three realms is the nature of lesser appearance.

original: / mkha' dang mnyam gyur pa ni snang ba 'bring gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: / mkha' dang mnyam gyur pa ni snang ba 'bring gi bdag nyid do //
translated: Becoming equal to space is the nature of middling appearance.

original: dngos kun ngo bo nyid ni snang ba rab kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dngos kun ngo bo nyid ni snang ba rab kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The nature of all things is the nature of the appearance of light.

original: dag pa ni snang ba rab kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dag pa ni snang ba rab kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Purity is the nature of the appearance of light.

original: zhi ba ni snang ba mched pa chung ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhi ba ni snang ba mched pa chung ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Peace is the nature of the small increase of light.

original: rnam dben ni snang ba mched pa 'bring gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rnam dben ni snang ba mched pa 'bring gi bdag nyid do //
translated: Isolation is the nature of the medium increase of light.

original: @10a * // bde mchog rang bzhin ni snang ba mched ba rab kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: @10a * // bde mchog rang bzhin ni snang ba mched ba rab kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The nature of the supreme bliss is the nature of the great increase of light.

original: rnal 'byor pa nyid yul ni snang ba mched pa rab kyi rab kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa nyid yul ni snang ba mched pa rab kyi rab kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The object of the yogi is the nature of the supreme increase of light.

original: rtogs dka' ba ni snang ba nye bar thob pa chung du'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rtogs dka' ba ni snang ba nye bar thob pa chung du'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Difficult to realize is the nature of the small attainment of light.

original: brtag par dka' ba ni snang ba nye bar thob pa 'bring gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: brtag par dka' ba ni snang ba nye bar thob pa 'bring gi bdag nyid do //
translated: Difficult to investigate is the nature of the medium attainment of light.

original: bdag gzhan rab phan ni snang ba nye bar thob pa rab kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gzhan rab phan ni snang ba nye bar thob pa rab kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Beneficial to self and other is the nature of the great attainment of light.

original: khyab pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i rab kyi rab kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: khyab pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i rab kyi rab kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Pervasive is the nature of the supreme attainment of light.

original: spros pa med pa ni 'od gsal ba chung du'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: spros pa med pa ni 'od gsal ba chung du'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Free from conceptual elaboration is the nature of the small clear light.

original: zhi ba ni 'od gsal ba 'bring gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: zhi ba ni 'od gsal ba 'bring gi bdag nyid do //
translated: Peace is the nature of middling clear light.

original: mnyam med mnyam pa ni 'od gsal ba rab kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: mnyam med mnyam pa ni 'od gsal ba rab kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Equality without equal is the nature of greater clear light.

original: mi rtog tshul gcig ni 'od gsal ba rab kyi rab kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtog tshul gcig ni 'od gsal ba rab kyi rab kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The single principle of non-conceptuality is the nature of the greatest clear light.

original: de rnams kyi dbye ba ni nyin par gyi zla ba'i snang ba dang / zla ba phyed kyi snang ba dang sprin dang bcas pa'i zla ba'i snang ba dang / sprin med pa'i zla ba'i snang ba bzhin du snang ba'i ye shes so ;
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbye ba ni nyin par gyi zla ba'i snang ba dang / zla ba phyed kyi snang ba dang sprin dang bcas pa'i zla ba'i snang ba dang / sprin med pa'i zla ba'i snang ba bzhin du snang ba'i ye shes so ;
translated: The divisions of those are the wisdoms of appearance, which are like the appearances of the daytime moon, the appearances of the half-moon, the appearances of the moon with clouds, and the appearances of the cloudless moon.

original: / de bzhin du nyi ma shar ba'i snang ba dang / nyi ma nub bzhin pa'i snang ba dang / sprin dang bcas pa'i nyi ma'i snang ba dang / sprin med pa'i nyi ma'i snang ba lta bu ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: / de bzhin du nyi ma shar ba'i snang ba dang / nyi ma nub bzhin pa'i snang ba dang / sprin dang bcas pa'i nyi ma'i snang ba dang / sprin med pa'i nyi ma'i snang ba lta bu ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Similarly, the wisdom of increase is like the appearances of the rising sun, the appearances of the setting sun, the appearances of the sun with clouds, and the appearances of the cloudless sun.

original: srod kyi mtshams dang nang par gyi mtshams dang / sprin dang bcas pa'i mtshan dang / sprin med pa'i mtshams lta bu ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: srod kyi mtshams dang nang par gyi mtshams dang / sprin dang bcas pa'i mtshan dang / sprin med pa'i mtshams lta bu ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The time of dusk, the time of dawn, the night with clouds, the cloudless night, is the pristine wisdom of the attainment of light.

original: mar ngo phyogs kyi nam mkha' dang / yar ngo phyogs kyi nam mkha' dang / sprin dang bcas pa'i nam mkha' dang / sprin med pa'i nam mkha' lta bu ni 'od gsal ba'i ye shes te /
analyzed: mar ngo phyogs kyi nam mkha' dang / yar ngo phyogs kyi nam mkha' dang / sprin dang bcas pa'i nam mkha' dang / sprin med pa'i nam mkha' lta bu ni 'od gsal ba'i ye shes te /
translated: The sky of the waning fortnight, the sky of the waxing fortnight, the sky with clouds, the cloudless sky, is the pristine wisdom of clear light.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation by the intention.

original: khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba ni srog gi rlung kun du rgyub  dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba ni srog gi rlung kun du rgyub  dang bral ba'o //
translated: Liberated from the conduct of the three realms is the freedom from the movement of the life-force wind.

original: mkha' dang mnyam gyur ni thur du sel ba'i rlung gi kun du rgyu ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mkha' dang mnyam gyur ni thur du sel ba'i rlung gi kun du rgyu ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: Become equal to space is the freedom from the movement of the downward-voiding wind.

original: dngos kun ngo bo nyid ni me dang mnyam pa'i rlung kun du rgyu ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dngos kun ngo bo nyid ni me dang mnyam pa'i rlung kun du rgyu ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: The nature of all things is the freedom from the movement of the fire-coinciding wind.

original: dag pa ni gyen du rgyu ba'i rlung kun du rgyu ba dang bral ba'o//
analyzed: dag pa ni gyen du rgyu ba'i rlung kun du rgyu ba dang bral ba'o//
translated: Pure is the freedom from the movement of the upward-moving wind.

original: zhi ba ni khyab byed kyi rlung nye bar sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni khyab byed kyi rlung nye bar sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: Peace is the gathering of the pervading wind.

original: rnam dben ni rgyu ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam dben ni rgyu ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: Solitude is the absence of movement.

original: bde mchog rang bzhin ni rnam par rgyu ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bde mchog rang bzhin ni rnam par rgyu ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: Supreme bliss is the absence of movement.

original: rnal 'byor pa nyid yul ni yang dag par rgyu ba dang bral ba'o //🔽rtogs dka' ni rab tu rgyu ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa nyid yul ni yang dag par rgyu ba dang bral ba'o // rtogs dka' ni rab tu rgyu ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: The yogi’s object is the absence of movement.🔽Difficult to realize is the absence of movement.

original: brtag par dka' ba ni nges @10b par rgyu ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: brtag par dka' ba ni nges @10b par rgyu ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: Difficult to investigate is the absence of movement.

original: bdag gzhan rab phan ni lus kyi rlung nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gzhan rab phan ni lus kyi rlung nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: The benefit of self and other is the gathering of the body wind.

original: khyab pa ni ngag gi rlung nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa ni ngag gi rlung nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: Pervasion is the gathering of the speech wind.

original: spros pa med pa ni sems kyi rlung nye bar sdud pa'o //🔽de la lus kyi rlung ni 'gro ba dang / bsgul ba dang bskyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: spros pa med pa ni sems kyi rlung nye bar sdud pa'o // de la lus kyi rlung ni 'gro ba dang / bsgul ba dang bskyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Nonconceptuality is the gathering of the mind wind.🔽The body wind has the characteristic of going and moving.

original: ngag gi rlung ni rtog dpyod kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ngag gi rlung ni rtog dpyod kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The speech wind has the characteristic of investigation and analysis.

original: brtags shing dbyang nas tshig brjod pa yin no zhes rigs pas so //
analyzed: brtags shing dbyang nas tshig brjod pa yin no zhes rigs pas so //
translated: It is logical that speech is expressed after investigation and analysis.

original: sems kyi rlung ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sems kyi rlung ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bdag nyid do //
translated: The wind of the mind is of the nature of desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: zhi ba ni 'jug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni 'jug pa med pa'o //
translated: Peace is the absence of engagement.

original: mnyam med mnyam pa ni gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam med mnyam pa ni gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: Equality without equal is the absence of abiding.

original: mi rtog tshul gcig ni 'byung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtog tshul gcig ni 'byung ba med pa'o //
translated: The single mode of nonconceptuality is the absence of emergence.

original: de lta bu'i rgyal ba rnams kyi sku ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nye bar sdud par byed pa ma ning gi bzlas pa'i bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang la phyag 'tshal lo zhes dgongs pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rgyal ba rnams kyi sku ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nye bar sdud par byed pa ma ning gi bzlas pa'i bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang la phyag 'tshal lo zhes dgongs pa yin pa'o //
translated: The body of such Victorious Ones is the one who draws all the Thusly Gone Ones together, the nature of the neutral recitation, Vajradhara. I pay homage to him.

original: khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba ni 'chi ba las pha rol na de bzhin gshegs pa med do zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum spyod pa las grol ba ni 'chi ba las pha rol na de bzhin gshegs pa med do zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Liberated from the conduct of the three realms is free from the concept that the Thusly Gone One does not exist beyond death.

original: mkha' dang mnyam gyur pa ni 'chi ba las pa rol na de bzhin gshegs pa yod do zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mkha' dang mnyam gyur pa ni 'chi ba las pa rol na de bzhin gshegs pa yod do zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Becoming equal to space is free from the concept that the Thusly Gone One exists beyond death.

original: dngos kun ngo bo nyid ni 'chi ba las pha rol na de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa yang yin /
analyzed: dngos kun ngo bo nyid ni 'chi ba las pha rol na de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa yang yin /
translated: The nature of all things is the Thusly Gone One who exists beyond death.

original: med pa yang yin zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: med pa yang yin zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: And it is also non-existent.

original: dag pa ni 'chi ba las pha rol na de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dag pa ni 'chi ba las pha rol na de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Pure is free from the conceptual thought that the Tathagata exists or does not exist after death.

original: zhi ba ni 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Peaceful is free from the conceptual thought that the world has an end.

original: rnam dben ni 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa 'ang ma yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //🔽bde mchog rang bzhin ni 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam dben ni 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa 'ang ma yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o // bde mchog rang bzhin ni 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Solitary is free from the conceptual thought that the world does not have an end.🔽Supreme bliss is free from the conceptual thought that the world both has an end and does not have an end.

original: rnal 'byor pa nyid yul ni 'jig rten ni mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin /🔽mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes rnams par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa nyid yul ni 'jig rten ni mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin /🔽mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes rnams par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The nature of yoga is free from the conceptual thought that the world neither has an end nor does not have an end.🔽The object of yoga is free from the conceptual thought that the world is finite or infinite.

original: rtogs dka' ni 'jig rten rtag pa yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs dka' ni 'jig rten rtag pa yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Difficult to Realize is free from the conceptualization, “The world is permanent.”

original: brtag par dka' ba ni 'jig rten mi rtag pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: brtag par dka' ba ni 'jig rten mi rtag pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Difficult to Investigate is free from the conceptualization, “The world is impermanent.”

original: bdag gzhan rab phan ni 'jig rten ni rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa @11a * //🔽yang ma yin zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gzhan rab phan ni 'jig rten ni rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa @11a * // yang ma yin zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Beneficial to Self and Other is free from the conceptualization, “The world is neither permanent nor impermanent.”

original: khyab pa ni 'jig rten ni rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: khyab pa ni 'jig rten ni rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Pervasive is free from the conceptualization, “The world is both permanent and impermanent.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir spros pa med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is Non-Elaborate.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas na zhi ba'o //
translated: Since it has the nature of emptiness, it is Peace.

original: mtshan ma med pas mnyam ming mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pas mnyam ming mnyam pa'o //
translated: Since it is signless, it is Equality.

original: smon pa med pas na mi rtog tshul gcig go //
analyzed: smon pa med pas na mi rtog tshul gcig go //
translated: Since it is wishless, it is Non-Conceptual.

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi sku ni rdo rje 'chang la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi sku ni rdo rje 'chang la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni drang ba'i don to //
translated: The body of the Victorious Ones is Vajradhara.

original: khams gsum spyod pa las gros ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: khams gsum spyod pa las gros ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the recitation of Great Vajradhara is the purification of the activities of the three realms.

original: mkha' dang mnyam gyur ni thugs kyi bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mkha' dang mnyam gyur ni thugs kyi bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the mental recitation is the equality of space.

original: dngos kun ngo bo nyid ni ngag gi bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //🔽dag pa ni sku'i bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos kun ngo bo nyid ni ngag gi bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no // dag pa ni sku'i bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the verbal recitation is the intrinsic reality of all things.🔽The nature of the physical recitation is purity.

original: zhi ba ni rin chen bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhi ba ni rin chen bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the recitation of the jewel is peace.

original: rnam dben ni don yod bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam dben ni don yod bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the recitation of Amogha is isolation.

original: bde mchog rang bzhin ni zhe sdang bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bde mchog rang bzhin ni zhe sdang bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the recitation of anger is the nature of supreme bliss.

original: rnal 'byor pa nyid yul ni 'dod chags bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //🔽rtogs dka' ni gti mug bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa nyid yul ni 'dod chags bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no // rtogs dka' ni gti mug bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the recitation of desire is the object of the yogi himself.🔽The nature of the recitation of delusion is difficult to understand.

original: brtag par dka' ba ni khro bo'i bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: brtag par dka' ba ni khro bo'i bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the recitation of the wrathful one is difficult to imagine.

original: bdag gzhan rab phan ni ma ning gi bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag gzhan rab phan ni ma ning gi bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the recitation of the neuter is the benefit of self and other.

original: de nyid kyi khyad par ni khyab pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyad par ni khyab pa ste /
translated: The particularity of that is the pervasion.

original: 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is the essence of clear light.

original: / spros pa med pa ni ngag gi spros pa las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: / spros pa med pa ni ngag gi spros pa las 'das pa'o //
translated: Non-elaborated is beyond the elaboration of speech.

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa dang / bral bas zhi ba dang mnyam med mnyam pa dang / mi rtog tshul gcig ste nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa dang / bral bas zhi ba dang mnyam med mnyam pa dang / mi rtog tshul gcig ste nges pa'i don to //
translated: Pacified, incomparable, equal, non-conceptual, and of one mode, is the definitive meaning, because it is free from engagement and so forth.

original: de ltar don bcu bzhi ston par byed pa'i phyag 'tshal ba'i tshig gis rgyud kyi don ma lus par bstan to ;
analyzed: de ltar don bcu bzhi ston par byed pa'i phyag 'tshal ba'i tshig gis rgyud kyi don ma lus par bstan to ;
translated: Thus, the entire meaning of the tantra is taught by the words of homage, which reveal the fourteen topics.

original: / da ni sngar bstan pa'i brjod pa la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /🔽dpal ldan 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi ni //
analyzed: / da ni sngar bstan pa'i brjod pa la sogs pa bshad par bya ste / dpal ldan 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi ni //
translated: Now, the previously taught expressions and so forth are to be explained.

original: don bsdus rtogs par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: don bsdus rtogs par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to understand the summary🔽of the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra,🔽I shall explain the brief

original: sems can kun la phan bskyed pa //🔽mdor byas bdag gis bshad par bya //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan bskyed pa // mdor byas bdag gis bshad par bya //
translated: for the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdor byas pa zhes bya ba sgrub pa'i thabs ni bdag gis bshad par bya ste dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdor byas pa zhes bya ba sgrub pa'i thabs ni bdag gis bshad par bya ste dbye bar bya'o //
translated: The brief means of achievement called the brief will be explained by me, that is, revealed.

original: 'o na gal te sgrub pa'i thabs 'dis dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi don bsdus pa yin na de gzhung gis bsdus sam don gyis bsdus gal te gzhung gis bsdus na de'i tshe don rdzogs par bsdus par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na gal te sgrub pa'i thabs 'dis dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi don bsdus pa yin na de gzhung gis bsdus sam don gyis bsdus gal te gzhung gis bsdus na de'i tshe don rdzogs par bsdus par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Well, if this method of achievement is a summary of the meaning of the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra, is it a summary of the text or a summary of the meaning? If it is a summary of the text, then it will not be a complete summary of the meaning.🔽If it is a summary of the meaning, then what is the use of the treatise?

original: @11b gal te don gyis bsdus na de'i tshe rab tu byed pas ci zhig bya zhe na smras pa gzhung dang don gyis bsdus so //
analyzed: @11b gal te don gyis bsdus na de'i tshe rab tu byed pas ci zhig bya zhe na smras pa gzhung dang don gyis bsdus so //
translated: It is a summary of both the text and the meaning.

original: 'o na gzhung nyung bas don rgyas pa ji ltar bsdu bar nus she na /
analyzed: 'o na gzhung nyung bas don rgyas pa ji ltar bsdu bar nus she na /
translated: Well, how can a brief text contain an extensive meaning?

original: smras pa / tshig gi don thab mo yin pa'i phyir don rgyas pa yang bsdus te /
analyzed: smras pa / tshig gi don thab mo yin pa'i phyir don rgyas pa yang bsdus te /
translated: It is said that because the meaning of the words is extensive, the meaning is also extensive.

original: dper na ji ltar sor gdub kyi me long la glang po che'i gzugs brnyan snang ba de bzhin du tshig nyung ba la yang don mang po bsdus par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dper na ji ltar sor gdub kyi me long la glang po che'i gzugs brnyan snang ba de bzhin du tshig nyung ba la yang don mang po bsdus par shes par bya ste /
translated: Just as the reflection of an elephant appears in a small mirror, so too should one understand that much meaning is contained in few words.

original: chos gang rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chos gang rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the statement, Any phenomenon that arises from causes...

original: phur bu na re yid ma ches //
analyzed: phur bu na re yid ma ches //
translated: Nagarjuna says, Do not doubt this.

original: lnga len na re bud med 'jam //
analyzed: lnga len na re bud med 'jam //
translated: Panchala said, “A woman is gentle.”

original: zla ba na re zhun bza' //
analyzed: zla ba na re zhun bza' //
translated: Chandra said, “She is a mixture.”

original: ser skyen re srog chags brtse //
analyzed: ser skyen re srog chags brtse //
translated: Kapila said, “She is a living being.”

original: zhes bya ba'i mdos rgyal po'i bstan bcos dang 'dod pa'i bstan bcos dang / sman pa'i bstan bcos dang / chos kyi bstan bcos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mdos rgyal po'i bstan bcos dang 'dod pa'i bstan bcos dang / sman pa'i bstan bcos dang / chos kyi bstan bcos te /
translated: Thus, the treatise of the king, the treatise of desire, the treatise of medicine, and the treatise of dharma were compiled in four hundred thousand verses.

original: 'bum phrag bzhi ji ltar bsdus pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bum phrag bzhi ji ltar bsdus pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Just as they were compiled there, they are compiled here in the same way.

original: 'o na rang dbang gis bshad pa yin na ma zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na rang dbang gis bshad pa yin na ma zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If they are explained independently, why not?

original: dpal ldan 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi ni //🔽zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid yin pas na dpal ldan nam /
analyzed: dpal ldan 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi ni // zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid yin pas na dpal ldan nam /
translated: The glorious Guhyasamaja🔽has the nature of method and wisdom, so it is glorious.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gtso bor gyur pas na dpal ldan no //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gtso bor gyur pas na dpal ldan no //
translated: Or it is glorious because it is foremost in the accumulation of merit and wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas lnga yang dag par sbyor ba ni 'dus pa ste yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga yang dag par sbyor ba ni 'dus pa ste yi ge'i don to //
translated: The perfect union of the five buddhas is the Guhyasamaja, the literal meaning.

original: yi ge gsum 'dus pas na 'dus pa ste spyi'i don to //
analyzed: yi ge gsum 'dus pas na 'dus pa ste spyi'i don to //
translated: The Guhyasamaja is the union of the three syllables, the general meaning.

original: stong pa nyid bsgom pa ni 'dus pa ste yang spyi'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bsgom pa ni 'dus pa ste yang spyi'i don to //
translated: The meditation on emptiness is the gathering, which is also the general meaning.

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'dus pa ste sbas pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'dus pa ste sbas pa'o //
translated: The union of method and wisdom is the gathering, which is the hidden meaning.

original: yi ge gsum nye bar 'dus pa ni 'dus pa ste yang sbas pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge gsum nye bar 'dus pa ni 'dus pa ste yang sbas pa'o //
translated: The union of the three syllables is the gathering, which is also the hidden meaning.

original: snang ba nye par thob pa la sogs pa 'dus pa ni 'dus pa ste yang sbas pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba nye par thob pa la sogs pa 'dus pa ni 'dus pa ste yang sbas pa'o //
translated: The gathering of the attainment of light and so on is the gathering, which is also the hidden meaning.

original: byang chub kyi sems 'dzin pa ni 'dus pa ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'dzin pa ni 'dus pa ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The retention of bodhicitta is the gathering, which is the ultimate meaning.

original: bden pa gnyis 'dus pa ni 'dus pa ste yang mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis 'dus pa ni 'dus pa ste yang mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The union of the two truths is the gathering, which is also the ultimate meaning.

original: le'u bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid kyi rgyud ni 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: le'u bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid kyi rgyud ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: The tantra with eighteen chapters is the gathering,

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: which is the literal meaning.

original: sa ni srog gi rlung ngo //
analyzed: sa ni srog gi rlung ngo //
translated: The syllable sa is the life-force wind.

original: ma ni thur du sel ba'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: ma ni thur du sel ba'i rlung ngo //
translated: The syllable ma is the downward-voiding wind.

original: dza ni me dang mnyam pa'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: dza ni me dang mnyam pa'i rlung ngo //
translated: The syllable ja is the fire-accompanying wind.

original: sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not the literal meaning.

original: yi ge gsum nye bar bsdus pa ni 'dus pa ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge gsum nye bar bsdus pa ni 'dus pa ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: The union of the three syllables is the gathering, which is the interpretable meaning.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur ba'i dus su tshangs pa'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa ni 'dus pa ste @12a * //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur ba'i dus su tshangs pa'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa ni 'dus pa ste @12a * //
translated: At the time of the initiation of irreversibility, the entry of all the Tathagatas through the Brahma aperture is the gathering.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not the intended meaning.

original: sku rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa dkyil 'khor bsgom pa ni 'dus pa ste drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: sku rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa dkyil 'khor bsgom pa ni 'dus pa ste drang ba'i don to //
translated: The meditation on the mandala of Vajradhara and so forth is the gathering, which is the interpretable meaning.

original: lus la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa nye bar bsdus pa ni 'dus pa ste nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa nye bar bsdus pa ni 'dus pa ste nges pa'i don to //
translated: The gathering of the conceptualizations of body and so forth is the gathering, which is the definitive meaning.

original: yang na sku'i dkyil 'khor 'dus pa ni 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: yang na sku'i dkyil 'khor 'dus pa ni 'di lta ste ;
translated: Or else, the gathering of the mandala of body is as follows:

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The form aggregate is Vairochana.

original: tshor ba'i phung po ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The feeling aggregate is Ratnasambhava.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The perception aggregate is Amitabha.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po ni don yod par grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po ni don yod par grub pa'o //
translated: The compositional factor aggregate is Amoghasiddhi.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The consciousness aggregate is Akshobhya.

original: sa'i khams ni sangs rgyas spyan no //
analyzed: sa'i khams ni sangs rgyas spyan no //
translated: The earth element is Buddhalocana.

original: chu'i khams ni m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams ni m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: The water element is Mamaki.

original: me'i khams ni gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: me'i khams ni gos dkar mo'o //
translated: The fire element is Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: rlung gi khams ni dam tshig sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni dam tshig sgrol ma'o //
translated: The wind element is Samayatārā.

original: mig gi dbang po ni sa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po ni sa'i snying po'o //
translated: The eye faculty is Kṣitigarbha.

original: rna ba'i dbang po ni lag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po ni lag na rdo rje'o //
translated: The ear faculty is Vajrapāṇi.

original: sna'i dbang po ni nam mkha'i snying po'o //
analyzed: sna'i dbang po ni nam mkha'i snying po'o //
translated: The nose faculty is Ākāśagarbha.

original: lce'i dbang po ni 'jig rten dbang phyug go ;
analyzed: lce'i dbang po ni 'jig rten dbang phyug go ;
translated: The tongue faculty is Lokeśvara.

original: / lus kyi dbang po ni sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'o //
analyzed: / lus kyi dbang po ni sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'o //
translated: The body faculty is Sarva­nīvaraṇa­viṣkambhin.

original: yid kyi dbang po ni 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po ni 'jam dpal lo //
translated: The mind faculty is Mañjuśrī.

original: tshigs kun ni kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: tshigs kun ni kun du bzang po'o //
translated: All the joints are Samantabhadra.

original: rtsa rgyud thams cad dang rtsa bdun khri nyis stong ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa rgyud thams cad dang rtsa bdun khri nyis stong ni byams pa'o //
translated: The entire network of channels and the seventy-two thousand channels are Maitreya.

original: gzugs ni gzugs rdo rje ma'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs rdo rje ma'o //
translated: Form is Rūpavajrā.

original: sgra ni sgra rdo rje ma'o //🔽dri ni dri rdo rje ma'o //
analyzed: sgra ni sgra rdo rje ma'o // dri ni dri rdo rje ma'o //
translated: Sound is Śabdavajrā.🔽Smell is Gandhavajrā.

original: ro ni ro rdo rje ma'o //🔽reg bya ni reg bya rdo rje ma'o //
analyzed: ro ni ro rdo rje ma'o // reg bya ni reg bya rdo rje ma'o //
translated: Taste is Rasavajrā.🔽Touch is Sparśavajrā.

original: dpung ba g-yas pa'i rtsa bar ni gshin rje mthar byed do //
analyzed: dpung ba g-yas pa'i rtsa bar ni gshin rje mthar byed do //
translated: Yama is at the base of the right arm.

original: dpung pa g-yon par ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa'o //
analyzed: dpung pa g-yon par ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa'o //
translated: Aparājita is at the base of the left arm.

original: kha'i padmar ni rta mgrin no //
analyzed: kha'i padmar ni rta mgrin no //
translated: Hayagrīva is in the lotus of the mouth.

original: gsang bar ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'o //
analyzed: gsang bar ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'o //
translated: Amṛtakuṇḍali is in the secret place.

original: lag ngar g-yas par ni mi g-yo ba'o //🔽lag dar g-yon par ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: lag ngar g-yas par ni mi g-yo ba'o // lag dar g-yon par ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po'o //
translated: Acala is in the right forearm.🔽Padmanartṛrāja is in the left forearm.

original: pus mo g-yas par ni dbyig sngon no //
analyzed: pus mo g-yas par ni dbyig sngon no //
translated: Nīlāmbaradhara is in the right knee.

original: pus mo g-yon par ni stobs po che'o //🔽tshangs pa'i sgor ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: pus mo g-yon par ni stobs po che'o // tshangs pa'i sgor ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: Mahābala is in the left knee.🔽Uṣṇīṣacakravartin is in the aperture of Brahmā.

original: rkang pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po ste /
analyzed: rkang pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po ste /
translated: Sumbharāja is in the circle of the feet.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'i dkyil 'khor ni 'dus pa ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'i dkyil 'khor ni 'dus pa ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: The maṇḍala of the nature body of all tathāgatas is the assembly, as it is.

original: yang na gsung gi dkyil 'khor 'dus pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang na gsung gi dkyil 'khor 'dus pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Or else, the assembly of the maṇḍala of speech is as follows:

original: aa a'a ni mi bskyod pa dang m'a ma k'i'o //🔽ai a'i ni rnam par snang mdzad dang spyan no //🔽au a'u ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang gzhan m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: aa a'a ni mi bskyod pa dang m'a ma k'i'o // ai a'i ni rnam par snang mdzad dang spyan no // au a'u ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang gzhan m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: A and ā are Akṣobhya and Māmakī.🔽I and ī are Vairocana and Locanā.🔽U and ū are Ratnasaṃbhava and Māmakī.

original: ri r'i ni 'od dpag tu med @12b ba dang gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: ri r'i ni 'od dpag tu med @12b ba dang gos dkar mo'o //
translated: E and ai are Amitābha and Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: li l'i ni don yod grub pa dang sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: li l'i ni don yod grub pa dang sgrol ma'o //
translated: LI and LI are Amoghasiddhi and Tara.

original: ae ni gshin rje mthar byed do //
analyzed: ae ni gshin rje mthar byed do //
translated: E is Yamantaka.

original: aee ni shes rab mthar byed do //
analyzed: aee ni shes rab mthar byed do //
translated: AI is Prajnantaka.

original: ao ni padma mthar byed do //
analyzed: ao ni padma mthar byed do //
translated: O is Padmantaka.

original: aoo ni bgegs mthar byed do //
analyzed: aoo ni bgegs mthar byed do //
translated: AU is Vighnantaka.

original: ka kha ga gha da ni mi bskyod pa dang spyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ka kha ga gha da ni mi bskyod pa dang spyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: KA, KHA, GA, GHA, DA are Akshobhya, Locana, etc.

original: tsa tsha dza dznya nya ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor ro //🔽ta tha da dha na ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: tsa tsha dza dznya nya ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor ro // ta tha da dha na ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: CA, CHa, JA, JHA, ÑA are the mandala of Vairochana.🔽TA, THA, DA, DHA, NA are the mandala of Ratnasambhava.

original: ta tha da dha na ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: ta tha da dha na ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: TA, THA, DA, DHA, NA are the mandala of Amitabha.

original: pa pa ba bha ma ni don yod grub pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //🔽ya ra la wa sha sha sa ha aom a'a:/
analyzed: pa pa ba bha ma ni don yod grub pa'i dkyil 'khor ro // ya ra la wa sha sha sa ha aom a'a:/
translated: PA, PHA, BA, BHA, MA are the mandala of Amoghasiddhi.

original: ni khro bo bcu'i dkyil 'khor ro ;
analyzed: ni khro bo bcu'i dkyil 'khor ro ;
translated: YA, RA, LA, VA, SHA, SA, HA, KSHAM, OM, AH, and A are the mandala of the ten wrathful ones.

original: / yang na a'a li ni lha mo'i rang bzhin dang / k'a li ni thabs kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: / yang na a'a li ni lha mo'i rang bzhin dang / k'a li ni thabs kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: Alternatively, the vowels are the nature of the goddesses, and the consonants are the nature of the methods.

original: gsung gi dkyil 'khor ni 'dus pa ste spyi'i don to //
analyzed: gsung gi dkyil 'khor ni 'dus pa ste spyi'i don to //
translated: The mandala of speech is the gathering, which is the general meaning.

original: yang na thugs kyi dkyil 'khor 'dus pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang na thugs kyi dkyil 'khor 'dus pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Or else, the gathering of the mandala of mind is as follows:

original: zhe sdang ni mi bskyod pa'o //🔽gti mug ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: zhe sdang ni mi bskyod pa'o // gti mug ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: Hatred is Akṣobhya.🔽Ignorance is Vairocana.

original: 'dod chags ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Desire is Amitābha.

original: nga rgyal ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: Pride is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: phrag dog ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: phrag dog ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: Jealousy is Amoghasiddhi.

original: bdag tu lta ba ni spyan no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni spyan no //
translated: The view of a self is Locanā.

original: bdag tu rmongs pa ni m'a ma k'i'o //🔽bdag tu nga rgyal ba ni gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: bdag tu rmongs pa ni m'a ma k'i'o // bdag tu nga rgyal ba ni gos dkar mo'o //
translated: Delusion about a self is Māmakī.🔽Pride about a self is Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: bdag la chags pa ni sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa ni sgrol ma'o //
translated: Attachment to a self is Tārā.

original: khro ba ni sa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: khro ba ni sa'i snying po'o //
translated: Anger is Kṣitigarbha.

original: khon du 'dzin pa ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa ni byams pa'o //
translated: Bearing grudges is Maitreya.

original: 'tshig pa ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'tshig pa ni rdo rje'o //
translated: Reproach is Vajrapāṇi.

original: 'chab pa ni m'a ma k'i'i snying po'o //
analyzed: 'chab pa ni m'a ma k'i'i snying po'o //
translated: Concealment is Māmakī’s essence.

original: rgyags pa ni 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: rgyags pa ni 'jam dpal lo //
translated: Arrogance is Mañjuśrī.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba ni 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba ni 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
translated: Violence is Lokeśvara.

original: sgyu ni sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'o //
analyzed: sgyu ni sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'o //
translated: Deception is Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin.

original: g-yo ni kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: g-yo ni kun du bzang po'o //
translated: Guile is Samantabhadra.

original: ngo tsha med pa ni gshin rje mthar byed do //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa ni gshin rje mthar byed do //
translated: Shamelessness is Yamāntaka.

original: khrel med pa ni shes rab mthar byed do //
analyzed: khrel med pa ni shes rab mthar byed do //
translated: Shamelessness is Kṛtāntakṛt.

original: phrag dog ni padma mthar byed do //🔽ser sna ni bgegs mthar byed do //
analyzed: phrag dog ni padma mthar byed do // ser sna ni bgegs mthar byed do //
translated: Jealousy is Padma-Udbhava.🔽Avarice is Vighnāntaka.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Distraction is Acalā.

original: 'gyod pa ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po'o //
translated: Regret is Kāmarāja.

original: bying ba ni dbyug sngon no //
analyzed: bying ba ni dbyug sngon no //
translated: Drowsiness is Nīladaṇḍa.

original: rgod pa ni stobs po che'o //
analyzed: rgod pa ni stobs po che'o //
translated: Excitement is Mahābala.

original: rtog pa ni gnod mdzes so //
analyzed: rtog pa ni gnod mdzes so //
translated: Conceptualization is Sumbha.

original: dpyod pa ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba ste /
translated: Analysis is Uṣṇīṣa Cakravartin.

original: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ste nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ste nges pa'i don to //
translated: This is called the mind maṇḍala, and it is of definitive meaning.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i dpal ldan 'dus pa ni //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i dpal ldan 'dus pa ni //
translated: The glorious Saṃvara is similar to that.

original: rgyud kyi ngo bo yin pas na rgyud do //
analyzed: rgyud kyi ngo bo yin pas na rgyud do //
translated: Since it is the nature of the tantra, it is a tantra.

original: de ni rnam pa gsum ste rgyu'i rgyud dang / 'bras bu'i rgyud dang / thabs @13a * //🔽kyi rgyud do //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum ste rgyu'i rgyud dang / 'bras bu'i rgyud dang / thabs @13a * // kyi rgyud do //
translated: It is threefold: the causal tantra, the resultant tantra, and the method tantra.

original: de la rgyu'i rgyud ni rim pa gnyis bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rgyud ni rim pa gnyis bsgom pa'o //
translated: The causal tantra is the cultivation of the two stages.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyud ni rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyud ni rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The resultant tantra is the attainment of the stage of Vajradhara.

original: thabs kyi rgyud ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thabs kyi rgyud ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The method tantra is characterized by the generation of the mind of enlightenment and so forth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje 'chang yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje 'chang yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: For that very reason, Vajradhara is also threefold:

original: rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang dang / 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'chang dang / thabs kyi rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang dang / 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'chang dang / thabs kyi rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: the causal Vajradhara, the resultant Vajradhara, and the method Vajradhara.

original: de la rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang ni rdo rje'i 'chang chen po ste drug pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang ni rdo rje'i 'chang chen po ste drug pa'o //
translated: Therein, the causal Vajradhara is the great Vajradhara, the sixth.

original: 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'chang ni snying ga las mi bskyod pa spro zhing de dang rjes su 'jug pas byung ba ni thugs rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'chang ni snying ga las mi bskyod pa spro zhing de dang rjes su 'jug pas byung ba ni thugs rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The resultant Vajradhara is the mind vajra-holder, who emanates Akshobhya from the heart and arises in accordance with him.

original: thabs kyi rdo rje 'chang ni 'khor los sgyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: thabs kyi rdo rje 'chang ni 'khor los sgyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The method Vajradhara is the nature of the chakravartin mandala.

original: de ni rgyud la gtan la dbab pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyud la gtan la dbab pa'o //
translated: That is the ascertainment of the tantra.

original: de nas las 'dzin pas te dpal ldan yang yin la 'dus pa yang yin pas na dpal ldan 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de nas las 'dzin pas te dpal ldan yang yin la 'dus pa yang yin pas na dpal ldan 'dus pa'o //
translated: Then, the one who holds the action is glorious and also a gathering, thus he is glorious and gathered.

original: dpal ldan 'dus pa yang yin la rgyud kyang yin pas na dpal ldan 'dus pa'i rgyud de gzhi mthun pa gnyis so //
analyzed: dpal ldan 'dus pa yang yin la rgyud kyang yin pas na dpal ldan 'dus pa'i rgyud de gzhi mthun pa gnyis so //
translated: The glorious Guhyasamaja is both glorious and a tantra, thus it is the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra.

original: de'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa don bsdus pa ni brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo sgra dang don gyi rgyan gyi rang bzhin mtha' drug ste dgongs pas bshad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa don bsdus pa ni brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo sgra dang don gyi rgyan gyi rang bzhin mtha' drug ste dgongs pas bshad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The summary of its related meaning is the nature of the ornament of words and meanings, which is to be expressed, and the six parameters, which are the interpretable meaning explanations and so forth.

original: de nyid brjod par bya ba yin pas na don to //
analyzed: de nyid brjod par bya ba yin pas na don to //
translated: Since that is what is to be expressed, it is the meaning.

original: de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir na de nyid khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir na de nyid khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to realize that, in order to understand that.🔽Benefiting all sentient beings

original: sems can kun la phan skyed pa //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan skyed pa //
translated: And to benefit all sentient beings.🔽

original: zhes bya ba ni de la sems can kun ni gang zag lnga ste tsandan dang / autpala la dang / padma dkar po dang / padma dang / rin po che'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de la sems can kun ni gang zag lnga ste tsandan dang / autpala la dang / padma dkar po dang / padma dang / rin po che'o //
translated: Therein, all sentient beings are the five persons: sandalwood, blue lotus, white lotus, lotus, and jewel.

original: de la tsandan ni bems po lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la tsandan ni bems po lta bu'o //
translated: Therein, the sandalwood person is like a block of wood.

original: autpala ni dbang po dman pa'o//🔽padma dkar po ni dbang po bar pa'o //
analyzed: autpala ni dbang po dman pa'o// padma dkar po ni dbang po bar pa'o //
translated: The blue lotus person has inferior faculties.🔽The white lotus person has middling faculties.

original: padma ni dbang po rab po //
analyzed: padma ni dbang po rab po //
translated: The lotus person has superior faculties.🔽The jewel person has the most superior faculties.

original: rin po che lta bu ni dbang po rab kyi rab bo //
analyzed: rin po che lta bu ni dbang po rab kyi rab bo //
translated: The jewel-like one is the best of the best.

original: de la dang po bzhi po la bskyed pa'i rim pa bshad pa rigs dang / lnga pa la ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa bshad pa'i rigs so zhes 'dir gang gzung bar 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de la dang po bzhi po la bskyed pa'i rim pa bshad pa rigs dang / lnga pa la ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa bshad pa'i rigs so zhes 'dir gang gzung bar 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
translated: Here, one might ask, which of these five should be taken as the one for whom the creation stage is explained, and which as the one for whom the completion stage is explained?

original: 'dir re zhig rab tu byed pa 'dis tsandan gyi bems po nyid bsal nas /
analyzed: 'dir re zhig rab tu byed pa 'dis tsandan gyi bems po nyid bsal nas /
translated: Here, first, by this chapter, having cleared away the state of being an inanimate piece of sandalwood,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'jug go //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'jug go //
translated: one enters into the correct view.

original: autpala gyi dbang po dman pa nyid bsal nas bar pa nyid du bskyed do //
analyzed: autpala gyi dbang po dman pa nyid bsal nas bar pa nyid du bskyed do //
translated: Having cleared away the state of being an inferior lotus, one generates the middling state.

original: padma dkar po'i bde ba rtogs pas 'khrul pa zlog cing dbang po rno ba nyid du byed do //
analyzed: padma dkar po'i bde ba rtogs pas 'khrul pa zlog cing dbang po rno ba nyid du byed do //
translated: By the realization of the bliss of the white lotus, one reverses error and makes one's faculties sharp.🔽Having generated the wisdom of the nature of meditation in the sharp lotus, the jewel-like one merely delights in and recollects one's own reality.

original: dbang po rno @13b ba'i padma la bsgom pa'i rang bzhin shes rab bskyed de rin po che lta bu ni rang gi de kho na nyid khong du chud pa la yang yid dga' ba dang rjes su dran pa tsam byed do zhes gang zag lnga ni sems can
analyzed: dbang po rno @13b ba'i padma la bsgom pa'i rang bzhin shes rab bskyed de rin po che lta bu ni rang gi de kho na nyid khong du chud pa la yang yid dga' ba dang rjes su dran pa tsam byed do zhes gang zag lnga ni sems can
translated: Thus, the five persons are the sentient beings who are the vessels for the five chapters.

original: kun gyi sgras bstan to //
analyzed: kun gyi sgras bstan to //
translated: The word all is used.

original: de rnams la phan skyed pa na sngar bshad pa'i rim pas phan 'dogs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams la phan skyed pa na sngar bshad pa'i rim pas phan 'dogs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one benefits them, one benefits them in the manner previously explained. This is the meaning of the phrase one who benefits them.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: mdor byas pa ni mdor bsdus pa zhes bya ba sgrub pa'i thabs te /
analyzed: mdor byas pa ni mdor bsdus pa zhes bya ba sgrub pa'i thabs te /
translated: The abridged means the summary. The means of achievement is the means of accomplishing the goal.

original: bdag gis bshad pa ni so sor bstan pa yin gyi rang bzor brtsams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis bshad pa ni so sor bstan pa yin gyi rang bzor brtsams pa ma yin no //
translated: What I have explained is the teaching, and not a composition of my own invention.

original: de ni lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ston pa'i gsung gi rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ston pa'i gsung gi rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
translated: It is in accord with the scriptures and the teachings of the Master.

original: ston pa'i dam chos rnam gnyis te lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid do zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa'i dam chos rnam gnyis te lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid do zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has been said that the true Dharma of the Master is twofold, having the nature of scripture and realization.

original: des ni brjod pa la sogs pa lnga po bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni brjod pa la sogs pa lnga po bstan pa yin te /
translated: By this, the five topics beginning with statement are indicated.

original: de la mdor byas zhes bya ba ni rjod pa'o //
analyzed: de la mdor byas zhes bya ba ni rjod pa'o //
translated: Among them, abridged is the statement.

original: don bsdus zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: don bsdus zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The summary is the content.

original: brjod bya rjod byed 'brel ba ni //
analyzed: brjod bya rjod byed 'brel ba ni //
translated: The connection between the content and the statement is

original: ma bstan par yang don gyis rtogs //
analyzed: ma bstan par yang don gyis rtogs //
translated: understood by implication, even without being taught.

original: 'jig rten 'brel pa'i sgra dag ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'brel pa'i sgra dag ni //
translated: The sounds of mundane convention

original: gnyis la gnas te ring thung bzhin //
analyzed: gnyis la gnas te ring thung bzhin //
translated: are based on duality, like long and short.

original: sems can kun la phan skyed pa //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan skyed pa //
translated: It generates benefit for all sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'i dgos pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'i dgos pa ste /
translated: This is the purpose of the intention.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of the welfare of others.

original: dgos pa ni don gyis rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: dgos pa ni don gyis rtogs pa ste /
translated: The purpose is understood by implication.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ma thob pa'i skyes bus gzhan gyi don ji ltar byed nus zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ma thob pa'i skyes bus gzhan gyi don ji ltar byed nus zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that a person who has not attained the perfection of one's own welfare cannot perform the welfare of others.

original: kha cig  na re /
analyzed: kha cig  na re /
translated: Some explain

original: don bsdus rtogs par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: don bsdus rtogs par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to realize the summary meaning

original: zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa'i tshig gis dgos pa 'chad par byed de de la don bsdus pa ni mngon du rtogs la bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis bsgom zhing rdo rje 'chang gi sku thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa'i tshig gis dgos pa 'chad par byed de de la don bsdus pa ni mngon du rtogs la bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis bsgom zhing rdo rje 'chang gi sku thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: with the words of realization, explaining the purpose. There, the summary meaning is to realize, and by cultivating with the wisdom of meditation, one will attain the body of Vajradhara.

original: de ltar brjod pa la sogs pa lnga po bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa la sogs pa lnga po bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the five, beginning with the statement,

original: sgrub pa'i thabs 'di gang las bsdus pa de nyid nyon mongs pa rnams las grol ba'i rgyu dang thar pa thob pa'i rgyu yin no zhes rgyud kyi phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i thabs 'di gang las bsdus pa de nyid nyon mongs pa rnams las grol ba'i rgyu dang thar pa thob pa'i rgyu yin no zhes rgyud kyi phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
translated: In order to teach the benefits of the tantra, it is said:🔽The faults of beginningless latent tendencies🔽are the cause of liberation from the afflictions

original: thog med bag chags nyes pa rnams //🔽'gro gsum rnam par rmongs byed pa //
analyzed: thog med bag chags nyes pa rnams // 'gro gsum rnam par rmongs byed pa //
translated: and the cause of attaining liberation.

original: blo dang ldan pas de bstan te //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas de bstan te //
translated: The wise should teach that

original: rnal 'byor rgyud kyis sbyang bar bya //🔽zhes smos pa la /🔽gang la thog ma med @14a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rgyud kyis sbyang bar bya // zhes smos pa la / gang la thog ma med @14a * //
translated: is purified by the Yoga Tantra.🔽As for beginningless,

original: pa de ni thog ma med pa'o //
analyzed: pa de ni thog ma med pa'o //
translated: that which has no beginning is beginningless.

original: des ni dngos po thams cad rten cing 'brel pa las byung ba yin gyis /
analyzed: des ni dngos po thams cad rten cing 'brel pa las byung ba yin gyis /
translated: This teaches that all things arise from dependent origination,

original: dbang phyug la sogs pas sprul pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pas sprul pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: and are not emanations of Īśvara and so forth,

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams dpyad na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams dpyad na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when Īśvara and so forth are analyzed, they do not exist.

original: de la dbang phyug ces bya ba ni rtag pa yin nam mi rtag pa yin /
analyzed: de la dbang phyug ces bya ba ni rtag pa yin nam mi rtag pa yin /
translated: In this regard, is Īśvara permanent or impermanent?

original: gal te rtag pa yin na dngos po rnams ji ltar skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa yin na dngos po rnams ji ltar skyed par byed de /
translated: If he is permanent, how can he generate things?

original: skyed pa po ni rim dang cig car gyi don gyi bya ba byung na rtag pa nyid dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyed pa po ni rim dang cig car gyi don gyi bya ba byung na rtag pa nyid dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For if he generates things, either successively or simultaneously, he would be devoid of permanence.

original: de bas na de ni byed pa po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ni byed pa po nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is not a creator.

original: byed pa yin na rtag pa nyams //
analyzed: byed pa yin na rtag pa nyams //
translated: If he is a creator, his permanence is undermined.

original: rtag pa yin na byed pa min //🔽phan tshun rnam par 'gal ba nyid //
analyzed: rtag pa yin na byed pa min // phan tshun rnam par 'gal ba nyid //
translated: If he is permanent, he is not a creator.

original: ji ltar gcig la rigs par 'gyur //🔽'dir sbyor ba ni gang dang gang //
analyzed: ji ltar gcig la rigs par 'gyur // 'dir sbyor ba ni gang dang gang //
translated: How can it be logical for something to be both?🔽Here is the syllogism:

original: don gyi bya byed pa de ni //
analyzed: don gyi bya byed pa de ni //
translated: Whatever is a creator of things

original: mi rtag pa ste bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ste bum pa bzhin no //
translated: is impermanent, like a pot.

original: rim pa dang cig car gyis 'gro ba dbang phyug gis byed do zhes rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rim pa dang cig car gyis 'gro ba dbang phyug gis byed do zhes rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is an inference based on the nature of things.

original: gzhan yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga las zlog pa'i dbang phyug gzhan ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga las zlog pa'i dbang phyug gzhan ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: Moreover, we do not see any other creator of the world, apart from the five aggregates that are taken up.

original: de bas ma mthong ba de ni ji ltar stobs kyis 'jog par byed //
analyzed: de bas ma mthong ba de ni ji ltar stobs kyis 'jog par byed //
translated: So how can you posit him as the creator by mere assertion?

original: chos can med pa de la rtag pa dang byed pa nyid mi rigs te chos can med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can med pa de la rtag pa dang byed pa nyid mi rigs te chos can med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not logical that what does not exist as a basis is permanent and an agent, because it does not exist as a basis.

original: bdag ces bya ba dngos po med ;
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba dngos po med ;
translated: The so-called self is a nonentity.

original: / byed pa po zhes ji ltar brjod //
analyzed: / byed pa po zhes ji ltar brjod //
translated: How can it be called an agent?

original: chos can yod na chos rnams ni //
analyzed: chos can yod na chos rnams ni //
translated: When there is a basis, phenomena

original: 'jig rten pa ni rtogs par byed //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni rtogs par byed //
translated: are understood by the world.

original: ces byang chub sems kyi rnam 'grel las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces byang chub sems kyi rnam 'grel las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated in the Bodhicittavivaraṇa.

original: 'dir sbyor ba ni gang dang gang chos can de dang de mi rtag pa'i chos dang 'brel pa yod de bum pa'i byas pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba ni gang dang gang chos can de dang de mi rtag pa'i chos dang 'brel pa yod de bum pa'i byas pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no //
translated: Here the syllogism is: Whatever is a basis is related to impermanent phenomena, like the impermanence of a pot’s being produced.

original: phung po lnga la sogs pa'i dbang phyug ni mi dmigs pas de'i rtag pa dang byed pa nyid kyang med do zhes rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga la sogs pa'i dbang phyug ni mi dmigs pas de'i rtag pa dang byed pa nyid kyang med do zhes rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Since the Īśvara of the five aggregates and so on is not observed, his permanence and agency also do not exist. This is a syllogism of the nonobservation of a nature.

original: rigs pa po dang bye brag pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i bdag nyid kyang logs par brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa po dang bye brag pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i bdag nyid kyang logs par brtags pa yin no //
translated: The self that is asserted by the Naiyāyika and Vaiśeṣika is also a false imputation.

original: de la de rnams ni 'di skad smra ste /
analyzed: de la de rnams ni 'di skad smra ste /
translated: In this regard, they say the following.

original: bdag nyid phung po dang bdag la phung po dang / phung po bdag dang / me dang bud shing bzhin du phung po dang bdag tha mi dad pa ste rtog pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid phung po dang bdag la phung po dang / phung po bdag dang / me dang bud shing bzhin du phung po dang bdag tha mi dad pa ste rtog pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four theories are: the self is the aggregates, the aggregates are the self, the self possesses the aggregates, and the self and the aggregates are different, like fire and fuel.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa nyi shu 'jig tshogs la lta ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa nyi shu 'jig tshogs la lta ba mi rigs te /
translated: The view of the transitory collection is not reasonable in twenty ways, because of the divisions of the aggregates of form and so on.

original: rigs pas 'di mi @14b 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pas 'di mi @14b 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not established by reasoning.

original: gal te phyogs dang bo yin na de'i tshe phung po rnams mi rtag pas bdag kyang mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te phyogs dang bo yin na de'i tshe phung po rnams mi rtag pas bdag kyang mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the first position is correct, then it follows that the self would be impermanent because the aggregates are impermanent.

original: bar pa phyogs gnyis po'ang mi rigs te /
analyzed: bar pa phyogs gnyis po'ang mi rigs te /
translated: The second position is also unreasonable.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la rten dang / brten pa'i 'brel pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la rten dang / brten pa'i 'brel pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unreasonable for the permanent and the impermanent to be related as support and supported.

original: gal te shing bcad pas bya rog ma bcad pa dang / bya rog shi bas shing mi 'jig go zhes /
analyzed: gal te shing bcad pas bya rog ma bcad pa dang / bya rog shi bas shing mi 'jig go zhes /
translated: If you say that when a tree is cut down the crow is not cut down and when the crow dies the tree does not perish,

original: ji ltar rten dang rten pa'i 'brel pa mi 'grub ces zer na /
analyzed: ji ltar rten dang rten pa'i 'brel pa mi 'grub ces zer na /
