translated: how can you say that the relation of support and supported is not established?

original: de ni mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dra ste /
translated: That is not similar.

original: bya rog dang shing dag mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya rog dang shing dag mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the crow and the tree are impermanent.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams la sngar bshad pa'i tshad mas mi rtag pa mi nyid grub po //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams la sngar bshad pa'i tshad mas mi rtag pa mi nyid grub po //
translated: External things are established as impermanent by the previously explained valid cognitions.

original: me dang bud shing bzhin yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: me dang bud shing bzhin yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also not tenable that they are like fire and fuel.

original: bud shing 'jig na me 'byung bas tha dad pas mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bud shing 'jig na me 'byung bas tha dad pas mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established that they are different, since the fire arises when the fuel is destroyed.

original: de bzhin du bdag 'jigs pas phung po 'byung ba dang / phung po 'jig pas bdag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag 'jigs pas phung po 'byung ba dang / phung po 'jig pas bdag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, because the aggregates arise when the self is destroyed, and the self arises when the aggregates are destroyed.

original: dpyod pa bas brtags pa'i zhi ba'i tshangs pa dang / sna tshogs kyi tshangs pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: dpyod pa bas brtags pa'i zhi ba'i tshangs pa dang / sna tshogs kyi tshangs pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: The peace of Brahman that is imagined by the Mīmāṃsakas and the Brahman of variety are not tenable.

original: byas pa yin pas mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa yin pas mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that they would be impermanent since they are produced.

original: grangs can gyis brtags pa'i de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi skyes bu rtag par bshad pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: grangs can gyis brtags pa'i de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi skyes bu rtag par bshad pa mi rigs te /
translated: The permanent person that is the essence of the twenty-five principles imagined by the Sāṃkhyas is not tenable.

original: rang bzhin nyid la de kho na nyid thams cad byung na de'i dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid la de kho na nyid thams cad byung na de'i dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if all principles arise from their nature, they would have no purpose.

original: de'i rtogs pa nyid dgos pa yin no zhes zer na de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rtogs pa nyid dgos pa yin no zhes zer na de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so, because the function of the self is to apprehend by means of the intellect.

original: de'i bya ba ni blos gzung ba yin na ji ltar gzhan gyi bya ba byed pa'i skyes bu yin /
analyzed: de'i bya ba ni blos gzung ba yin na ji ltar gzhan gyi bya ba byed pa'i skyes bu yin /
translated: How can it be a person who performs the function of another?

original: de'i lta ba po nyid gtso bo yin no zhes zer na de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de'i lta ba po nyid gtso bo yin no zhes zer na de ni mi rigs te /
translated: If you say that the seer itself is the primary principle, that is illogical.

original: lta ba po nyid ni mig la sogs pa'i bya ba yin no zhes de byed na de dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur bas mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta ba po nyid ni mig la sogs pa'i bya ba yin no zhes de byed na de dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur bas mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the seer is the function of the eyes, etc., then it would be similar to them and would be impermanent.

original: btang snyoms yin na skyes bu nyid med par rigs kyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms yin na skyes bu nyid med par rigs kyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is indifferent, it would be logical that the person does not exist, but it does exist.

original: 'byung ba sems su smra ba rnams la yang bems po'i ngo bor thal bar 'gyur bas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba sems su smra ba rnams la yang bems po'i ngo bor thal bar 'gyur bas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, for those who say that the elements are mind, it would follow that they are insentient, and so there would be no coming or going, etc.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ma yin no zhes tshad ma gang gis sun 'byin pa de nyid rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes 'jig rten rgyang pan pa ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ma yin no zhes tshad ma gang gis sun 'byin pa de nyid rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes 'jig rten rgyang pan pa ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: The Lokayatas themselves are contradicting their own words when they say, “It is not an inference, but a valid cognition.”

original: phyogs kyi gos can ngo tsha med pas kyang zho yang rnga mo yin la /
analyzed: phyogs kyi gos can ngo tsha med pas kyang zho yang rnga mo yin la /
translated: Even the shameless Vaise~ika says, “Milk is a camel,

original: rnga mo yang zho yin no //🔽zhes dngos @15a * //
analyzed: rnga mo yang zho yin no // zhes dngos @15a * //
translated: and a camel is milk.”

original: po thams cad yongs su 'gyur na mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gang zag ji ltar yin /
analyzed: po thams cad yongs su 'gyur na mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gang zag ji ltar yin /
translated: If all things are transformed, how can a person be a phenomenon that is not transformed?

original: de dang 'dra ba gzhan dag du ma yang mi rigs par smra ba mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba gzhan dag du ma yang mi rigs par smra ba mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not reasonable to say that there are many other things that are similar to it.

original: de ltar bdag la sogs pa bkag nas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag la sogs pa bkag nas /
translated: Thus, having refuted the self and so on,

original: dngos po thams cad rten cing 'brel pa las byung zhes sgrub po de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rten cing 'brel pa las byung zhes sgrub po de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: it is established that all things are dependently arisen.

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i nyes pa ni /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i nyes pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the faults that arise from beginningless latent propensities

original: sems kyi rgyud rnyog par byed pas na 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud rnyog par byed pas na 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: are the afflictions such as attachment, which disturb the mindstream.

original: 'o na thog ma med pa'i bag chags nyid ni bdag la sogs pa yin no zhes zer na de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na thog ma med pa'i bag chags nyid ni bdag la sogs pa yin no zhes zer na de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that the beginningless habitual propensities are the self, etc., that is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir bag chags zhes bya ba rten cing 'brel pa las byung ba'i dngos po'i 'khrul pas med par yang byis pa rnams kyis brtags so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bag chags zhes bya ba rten cing 'brel pa las byung ba'i dngos po'i 'khrul pas med par yang byis pa rnams kyis brtags so //
translated: Because the so-called habitual propensities are unreal things that arise interdependently, and are imagined by the childish to be nonexistent.

original: don dam par ni de nyid stong pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni de nyid stong pa'o //
translated: In the ultimate, they are empty.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po stong pa la chos rnams stong par 'byung ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu ni brdzun pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po stong pa la chos rnams stong par 'byung ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu ni brdzun pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, in empty things, phenomena arise as empty, and cause and effect have a false nature.

original: de la brten nas gang skye ba //
analyzed: de la brten nas gang skye ba //
translated: That which arises in dependence on that

original: de ni nyid skye ba min //🔽gang zhig rang bzhin ma skyes pa //
analyzed: de ni nyid skye ba min // gang zhig rang bzhin ma skyes pa //
translated: does not arise in reality.🔽How can that which is essentially non-arisen

original: de ni ji ltar skyed pa yin //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar skyed pa yin //
translated: be produced?

original: zhes bshad pa dang / de bzhin du /🔽stong pa yi ni chos rnams la //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa dang / de bzhin du / stong pa yi ni chos rnams la //
translated: And similarly:🔽In empty phenomena

original: chos rnams stong pa nyid 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos rnams stong pa nyid 'byung ngo //
translated: phenomena arise as emptiness.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro//
translated: And:

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gyur pa'i dngos po rnams las stong pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa tha snyad du byas te /🔽kha thon mar me me long brgya //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gyur pa'i dngos po rnams las stong pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa tha snyad du byas te / kha thon mar me me long brgya //
translated: Because of that, the world beyond, which is empty of those things, is conventionally designated.🔽Recitation, lamp, mirror,

original: brag ca me shel sa bon rgyur //🔽phung po so sor chags pa dang // mi 'pho mkhas pa des gzung bya //
analyzed: brag ca me shel sa bon rgyur // phung po so sor chags pa dang // mi 'pho mkhas pa des gzung bya //
translated: echo, magnifying glass, seed, cause,🔽aggregates, individual, attachment,

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: non-transference, and the wise should apprehend.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gyur pa'i dngos po rnams de ltar thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi nyes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad de nyin dang mtshan mo rang bzhin drug cu'i ngo bo sems can gyi khams thams cad
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gyur pa'i dngos po rnams de ltar thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi nyes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad de nyin dang mtshan mo rang bzhin drug cu'i ngo bo sems can gyi khams thams cad
translated: Because of that, those things are like that. The faults of beginningless latent tendencies are the ninety-eight afflictions such as attachment. Day and night, the essence of the sixty natures

original: la 'gro drug gi srid pa'i 'khor lor 'khor ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: la 'gro drug gi srid pa'i 'khor lor 'khor ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: is the cause for all sentient beings to revolve in the wheel of existence of the six migrations.

original: de rnams rnam par dpyad na phyi la sogs pa'i dbye bas rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: de rnams rnam par dpyad na phyi la sogs pa'i dbye bas rang bzhin med de /
translated: When those are analyzed, they are essenceless due to the categories of external and so on.

original: de la nyon mongs pa rnams ni yul na mi gnas te /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa rnams ni yul na mi gnas te /
translated: The afflictions do not abide in objects.

original: yul ni bems po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul ni bems po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is inanimate.

original: dbang po la mi gnas te /
analyzed: dbang po la mi gnas te /
translated: It does not reside in the sense faculties,

original: dbang po rnams sems @15b las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams sems @15b las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sense faculties are not mental factors.

original: sems la mi gnas te /
analyzed: sems la mi gnas te /
translated: It does not reside in the mind,

original: rten dang brten pa dag la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa dag la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist in the support and the supported.

original: rgyu dang rkyen med na 'bras bu gang las byung /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen med na 'bras bu gang las byung /
translated: If there is no cause and no condition, from what does the result arise?

original: de ltar rang bzhin pa'i thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung pa'i nyes pas 'gro ba gsum rnam par rmongs pa ste rmugs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin pa'i thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung pa'i nyes pas 'gro ba gsum rnam par rmongs pa ste rmugs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, due to the faults arising from beginningless habitual tendencies, the three realms are deluded, that is, they are stupefied.

original: de rnams thabs gang gis spang bar bya zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de rnams thabs gang gis spang bar bya zhe na smras pa /
translated: By what method are they abandoned? It is said:

original: blo dang ldan pas de bltas te /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas de bltas te /
translated: The wise one should observe that.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar yang bshad pa'i rigs pa'i khyad par gyis nyes pa de rnams yang dag par bltas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar yang bshad pa'i rigs pa'i khyad par gyis nyes pa de rnams yang dag par bltas te /
translated: Thus, by the special reasoning explained, those faults should be correctly observed.

original: thos pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis phyin ci ma logs par brtags la /
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis phyin ci ma logs par brtags la /
translated: Having been examined without error by the wisdom that has the nature of hearing and so forth,

original: rnal 'byor rgyud kyis sbyang bar bya //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rgyud kyis sbyang bar bya //
translated: one should purify with the yoga tantra.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud kyis sbyang bar bya'i nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud kyis sbyang bar bya'i nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is purified by the Mahayoga Tantra, not by the vehicles of the Sravakas, etc.

original: gang gi phyir nyan thos pa ni mi sdug pa bsgoms pa tsam gyis rus pa'i keng rus tsam de kho na nyid sgom par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyan thos pa ni mi sdug pa bsgoms pa tsam gyis rus pa'i keng rus tsam de kho na nyid sgom par byed de /
translated: For, the Sravakas, by mere meditation on the foul, meditate on the reality of just the skeleton of bones.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct,

original: bag chags byung na yang 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor ltung ba'i phyir srin bu bzhin no //
analyzed: bag chags byung na yang 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor ltung ba'i phyir srin bu bzhin no //
translated: because when the latent impressions arise, one falls into the ocean of cyclic existence, like a worm.

original: de ni dgun gyi dus su mi 'gul bar 'gyur zhing dpyid kyi dus su 'gul ba de bzhin du nyan thos pa ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la zhugs te /
analyzed: de ni dgun gyi dus su mi 'gul bar 'gyur zhing dpyid kyi dus su 'gul ba de bzhin du nyan thos pa ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la zhugs te /
translated: Just as in winter it does not move, and in spring it moves, so the Sravakas enter the meditative absorption of cessation,

original: yang nyon mongs pa 'byung bas 'khor ba par 'gyur ro zhes de rnams kyi de kho na nyid dang de thob pa'i rgyu yang yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa 'byung bas 'khor ba par 'gyur ro zhes de rnams kyi de kho na nyid dang de thob pa'i rgyu yang yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: and again, because the afflictions arise, they become wanderers in cyclic existence. Thus, their reality and the cause of attaining it are not correct.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyang rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam rig tsam chos kyi skur 'dod pa de rnams kyi ye shes ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyang rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam rig tsam chos kyi skur 'dod pa de rnams kyi ye shes ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Yogacarins assert that mere consciousness with aspects and without aspects is the dharmakaya. Their wisdom is not authentic.🔽

original: gang gi phyir gcig dang du ma dang bral bas phyi rol gyi don med na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig dang du ma dang bral bas phyi rol gyi don med na /
translated: The Yogacarins also have two kinds of consciousness-only, with aspects and without aspects. Their wisdom is not correct, because if external objects do not exist, being free from being one or many,

original: 'dzin par byed pa rnam rig ni ji ltar rigs /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa rnam rig ni ji ltar rigs /
translated: how can the apprehending consciousness be tenable?

original: gal te rnam pa dang bcas pa yin na ji ltar don med ;
analyzed: gal te rnam pa dang bcas pa yin na ji ltar don med ;
translated: If it has aspects, how can it be without objects?

original: gal te rnam pa med pa yin na stong pa nyid rigs kyi rnam rig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa med pa yin na stong pa nyid rigs kyi rnam rig ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is without aspects, it is emptiness, not consciousness.

original: ji srid dmigs pa so sor snang ba de srid rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo yin pas na 'khor ba'i phyogs so //
analyzed: ji srid dmigs pa so sor snang ba de srid rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo yin pas na 'khor ba'i phyogs so //
translated: As long as there is the appearance of individual objects, there is the nature of conceptualization, and so it is the side of samsara.

original: spros pa thams cad rab tu zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad rab tu zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: The complete pacification of all fabrication is nirvana.

original: ji skad du /🔽rkyen gzhan @16a * //🔽med pa zhi ba ste //
analyzed: ji skad du / rkyen gzhan @16a * // med pa zhi ba ste //
translated: As it is said:🔽The pacification of all fabrications

original: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
analyzed: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
translated: Is the pacification of all conceptualization.🔽The pacification of all conceptualization🔽Is the pacification of all objects of cognition.

original: tha dad don min rnam mi rtog / de ni yang dag mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: tha dad don min rnam mi rtog / de ni yang dag mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is not a different object, and is non-conceptual. That is the characteristic of reality.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a different object, it is non-conceptual, that is the characteristic of reality.

original: de bas na rnal 'byor spyod pa'i phyogs kyis thar pa ni ma dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rnal 'byor spyod pa'i phyogs kyis thar pa ni ma dag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, liberation is impure from the point of view of the Yogacaras.

original: dbu ma pa rnams kyang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid du khas blangs pas chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad pa yang tha mal pa'i lus ma spangs pas yun ring pos byang chub thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbu ma pa rnams kyang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid du khas blangs pas chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad pa yang tha mal pa'i lus ma spangs pas yun ring pos byang chub thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The Madhyamikas also accept that all things are empty because they are free from being one or many. Since the realm of phenomena is undifferentiated, enlightenment will not be attained in a long time without abandoning the ordinary body,

original: thabs la mi mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs la mi mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not skilled in means.

original: de la de rnams ni sems can gcig gi phyir gos la sogs pa sbyin pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par 'dod pa de rnams kyi sbyin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la de rnams ni sems can gcig gi phyir gos la sogs pa sbyin pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par 'dod pa de rnams kyi sbyin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin te /
translated: In that regard, those who wish to complete the perfection of generosity by giving cloth, etc. for the sake of a single sentient being, their generosity is not a perfection,

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad la yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad la yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not encompass the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: de bas na bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byar chub thob pa yin no zhes nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir theg pa chen po ni myur ba'i thabs ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byar chub thob pa yin no zhes nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir theg pa chen po ni myur ba'i thabs ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the afflictions are purified, the Great Vehicle is not a method for the swift attainment of enlightenment in three incalculable aeons.

original: bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang spros pa mang bas pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang spros pa mang bas pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Also, the yogis of Action and Performance Tantras, because of their many elaborations, should be understood to be like the yogis of the Perfection Vehicle.

original: de bas na rnal 'byor pa chen po'i rgyud nyid ni nyes pa de rnams spyod ba'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rnal 'byor pa chen po'i rgyud nyid ni nyes pa de rnams spyod ba'i thabs yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Great Yoga Tantra is the method for eliminating those faults.

original: de la 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bsgoms pas de yongs su gyur cing de'i ye shes thob nas tshe 'di nyid du rdo rje 'chang nyid 'thob par
analyzed: de la 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bsgoms pas de yongs su gyur cing de'i ye shes thob nas tshe 'di nyid du rdo rje 'chang nyid 'thob par
translated: By meditating that the afflictions such as desire are the nature of the Tathagatas Akshobhya and so forth, they are transformed, the gnosis of that is attained, and in this very life the state of Vajradhara is attained.

original: 'gyur ro // de bzhin du zhe sdang ni zhe sdang chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dang / 'dod chags ni 'dod chags chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dang / gti mug ni gti mug chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zlog ste 'gal ba'i chos kyi nyon mongs pa rnams sbyang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de bzhin du zhe sdang ni zhe sdang chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dang / 'dod chags ni 'dod chags chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dang / gti mug ni gti mug chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zlog ste 'gal ba'i chos kyi nyon mongs pa rnams sbyang bar bya ste /
translated: desire is averted by the meditative stabilization of great desire, and delusion is averted by the meditative stabilization of great delusion.

original: rna ba la zhugs pa'i chu ni chu gzhan gyis dgug pa bzhin dang yan lag tshig pa ni mes bsros pa bzhin no zhes rnal 'byor pa chen po'i rgyud ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i thabs dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rna ba la zhugs pa'i chu ni chu gzhan gyis dgug pa bzhin dang yan lag tshig pa ni mes bsros pa bzhin no zhes rnal 'byor pa chen po'i rgyud ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i thabs dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The Great Yoga Tantra is endowed with various methods, like water entering water, or a burned limb being warmed by fire.

original: de la rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug pas 'dod chags la sogs pa spong bar 'gyur ba dang khro bo'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zhe sdang @16b spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug pas 'dod chags la sogs pa spong bar 'gyur ba dang khro bo'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zhe sdang @16b spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therein, desire and so on are abandoned by the union of vajra and lotus, and hatred is abandoned by the meditative stabilization of wrath.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because their nature is thoroughly known.

original: rang bzhin mi shes pa rnams la spong ba rnams kyis dgos pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi shes pa rnams la spong ba rnams kyis dgos pa med do //
translated: For those who do not know the nature of things, the perfections are useless.

original: 'o na rnal 'byor gyi rgyud ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud ji ltar yin zhe na snga ma'i tshig mi mngon pas bden par khros pa la khros pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'o na rnal 'byor gyi rgyud ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud ji ltar yin zhe na snga ma'i tshig mi mngon pas bden par khros pa la khros pa bzhin no //
translated: Well then, how is the Yoga Tantra the Great Yoga Tantra? It is so, because the words of the former are not manifest, like anger in one who is angry with a friend.

original: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba don gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba don gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the word yoga?

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa ni rnal 'byor te yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa ni rnal 'byor te yi ge'i don to //
translated: The inseparability of emptiness and compassion is yoga, the literal meaning.

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor te spyi'i don to //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor te spyi'i don to //
translated: The union of method and wisdom is yoga, the general meaning.

original: rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor te sbas ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor te sbas ba'o //
translated: The union of the vajra and lotus is yoga, the hidden meaning.

original: 'od gsal ba dang gnyis su med pa'i rtogs pa ni rnal 'byor te mthar thug pa'o //🔽so sor sdud dang bsam gtan dang // srog dang rtsol ba 'dzin pa dang // rjes su dran dang ting 'dzin ni //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba dang gnyis su med pa'i rtogs pa ni rnal 'byor te mthar thug pa'o // so sor sdud dang bsam gtan dang // srog dang rtsol ba 'dzin pa dang // rjes su dran dang ting 'dzin ni //
translated: The realization of clear light and nonduality is yoga, the ultimate meaning.

original: yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor bshad //
analyzed: yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor bshad //
translated: The six-branched yoga is taught:🔽withdrawal, meditative concentration,🔽vital energy control, retention, recollection, and meditative stabilization.

original: ces pa dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not the intended meaning.

original: dkyil 'khor bzhi 'byung ba ni rnal 'byor te dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhi 'byung ba ni rnal 'byor te dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: The arising of the four mandalas is yoga, explained by the intended meaning.

original: le'u bcu bdun gyi rgyud ni rnal 'byor te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: le'u bcu bdun gyi rgyud ni rnal 'byor te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: The tantra of seventeen chapters is yoga, just as the words are.

original: sems kyi rtog pa 'gog pa ni rnal 'byor te nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: sems kyi rtog pa 'gog pa ni rnal 'byor te nges pa'i don to //
translated: The cessation of mental concepts is yoga, of definitive meaning.

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa //
translated: The union of method and wisdom

original: rnal 'byor zhes ni bshad pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes ni bshad pa yin // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is explained to be yoga.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor gyi rgyud ni nyon mongs pa thams cad sbyang ba'i phyir thabs yin no zhes rab tu bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor gyi rgyud ni nyon mongs pa thams cad sbyang ba'i phyir thabs yin no zhes rab tu bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, since yoga tantra is the method for purifying all afflictions, it is well established.

original: da ni de'i rjes su 'brang bas lus kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni de'i rjes su 'brang bas lus kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, following that, in order to abandon all physical afflictions, it should be explained.

original: 'dod pa lnga ni yongs spangs nas //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga ni yongs spangs nas //
translated: Having abandoned the five desires,

original: dka' thub kyis ni ma gdungs par //
analyzed: dka' thub kyis ni ma gdungs par //
translated: without being tormented by austerities,

original: rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs la //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs la //
translated: following the yoga tantras,

original: bde bas byang chub bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: bde bas byang chub bsgrub par bya //
translated: attain enlightenment through bliss.

original: zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes smos pa la /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs la //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs la //
translated: Following the Yoga Tantra

original: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud la brten nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud la brten nas so //
translated: means based on the Yoga Tantra.

original: bde bas ni 'dod pa'i yon tan dang longs spyod kyi sgo nas so ;
analyzed: bde bas ni 'dod pa'i yon tan dang longs spyod kyi sgo nas so ;
translated: By bliss means by the sense objects and enjoyments.

original: / byang chub ni rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang ste /
analyzed: / byang chub ni rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang ste /
translated: Enlightenment is the state of Vajradhara.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: What is to be accomplished is to be perfected.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa yongs su spangs te bral nas dka' thub kyis ni lus ngal ba'i rgyur gyur pa brtul zhugs dang sbyangs ba'i yon tan la sogs @17a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa yongs su spangs te bral nas dka' thub kyis ni lus ngal ba'i rgyur gyur pa brtul zhugs dang sbyangs ba'i yon tan la sogs @17a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: pas ma lus gdung par bya'o //🔽bde ba dang ldan pa'i sems ni mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pas ma lus gdung par bya'o // bde ba dang ldan pa'i sems ni mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The five sense objects such as form and so on are to be completely abandoned, separated from, and the body is to be tormented by austerities, by the virtues of asceticism and so on.🔽The mind endowed with bliss will become equipoised, because it is said that the mind endowed with bliss will become equipoised.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis yang dag par gyur pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis yang dag par gyur pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind that is equipoised will know reality.

original: 'on 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ni sems rnam par g-yeng pa'i rgyu yin pas na de rnams kyis ji ltar byang chub thob par 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: 'on 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ni sems rnam par g-yeng pa'i rgyu yin pas na de rnams kyis ji ltar byang chub thob par 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
translated: But since the five sense pleasures are the cause of distraction of mind, how can one attain enlightenment through them?🔽It is said:

original: thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rnams ni phan 'dogs par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rnams ni phan 'dogs par gyur pa yin te /
translated: The afflictions of bodhisattvas who possess skill in means are helpful.

original: dper na ke ta ke'i me tog spos kyi glang pos zos na gla rtsi'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na ke ta ke'i me tog spos kyi glang pos zos na gla rtsi'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, when the fragrant elephant eats the ketaka flower, it becomes the essence of camphor.

original: de nyid tha mal pa'i glang pos zos na mi gtsang bar yongs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid tha mal pa'i glang pos zos na mi gtsang bar yongs su 'gyur ro //
translated: But when an ordinary elephant eats it, it becomes excrement.

original: de bzhin du dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: And the Ratnakuta says,

original: 'od srungs bu ram shing dang 'bras s'a lu'i zhing la lud kyis phan 'dogs pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la nyon mongs pa rnams phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od srungs bu ram shing dang 'bras s'a lu'i zhing la lud kyis phan 'dogs pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la nyon mongs pa rnams phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, Kasyapa, just as manure is helpful to sugarcane and rice fields, so are the afflictions helpful to the bodhisattva-mahasattva.

original: de bzhin du dug gi de kho na nyid mi shes pa'i skyes bus dug zos na 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dug gi de kho na nyid mi shes pa'i skyes bus dug zos na 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, a person who does not know the reality of poison will die if he eats it.

original: de nyid dug gi de nyid shes pas zos na bdud rtsi nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid dug gi de nyid shes pas zos na bdud rtsi nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he knows the reality of poison, by eating it he will be transformed into nectar.

original: rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyud las /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyud las /
translated: The Tantra of Vairocana’s Enlightenment says:

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ni //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ni //
translated: Desire, anger, and ignorance

original: 'jig rten la ni dug chen gsum //🔽dug nyid rnam par bcom pa yis //
analyzed: 'jig rten la ni dug chen gsum // dug nyid rnam par bcom pa yis //
translated: are the three great poisons in the world.🔽By conquering the poisons themselves,

original: dug ni dug nyid med par byas //🔽zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dug ni dug nyid med par byas // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: poisons are made to be without poison.

original: don yod grub pa'i rgyud las kyang //
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i rgyud las kyang //
translated: The Amogha Siddhi Tantra says:

original: gang gis rmongs pa 'ching 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang gis rmongs pa 'ching 'gyur ba //
translated: That which binds the ignorant

original: des ni mkhas pa grol bar 'gyur ;
analyzed: des ni mkhas pa grol bar 'gyur ;
translated: liberates the wise.

original: / de ltar byang chub bsgom pa yi //
analyzed: / de ltar byang chub bsgom pa yi //
translated: Thus, through the cultivation of enlightenment

original: thams cad rnam par ldog pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad rnam par ldog pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: everything is reversed.

original: 'dir man ngag ni re zhig las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pa spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa la gnas par gyur pas lha khang sum brtsegs kyi 'og khang du bza' ba la sogs pa gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'dir man ngag ni re zhig las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pa spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa la gnas par gyur pas lha khang sum brtsegs kyi 'og khang du bza' ba la sogs pa gzhag ste /
translated: Having placed food, etc. in the lower story of the three-storied temple,

original: bar khang du rol mo la sogs pa bzhag la /
analyzed: bar khang du rol mo la sogs pa bzhag la /
translated: having placed music, etc. in the middle story,

original: khang tog tu rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gdan la 'dug ste /
analyzed: khang tog tu rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gdan la 'dug ste /
translated: sitting on a seat with various forms in the upper story,

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya bzhi lo bcu gnyis pa'am /
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya bzhi lo bcu gnyis pa'am /
translated: the pledge seal is a twelve-year-old girl,

original: bcu drug pa'am nyi shu lon pa gzugs bzang ba legs par brgyan pa dkyil 'khor du rim gyis @17b bzhag la /
analyzed: bcu drug pa'am nyi shu lon pa gzugs bzang ba legs par brgyan pa dkyil 'khor du rim gyis @17b bzhag la /
translated: or a sixteen-year-old, or a twenty-year-old, beautiful, well-adorned, gradually placed in the maṇḍala.

original: dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis lha'i rnam pa thams cad byas la bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa dang bdud rtsi myong bas tshim par byas la /
analyzed: dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis lha'i rnam pa thams cad byas la bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa dang bdud rtsi myong bas tshim par byas la /
translated: Having made all the forms of the deity with the process of the first union, etc., having satisfied her with food, drink, etc., and tasting the elixir,

original: bud pa'i dra ba la sogs pas bde ba nyams su myong zhing bde ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'od gsal ba mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: bud pa'i dra ba la sogs pas bde ba nyams su myong zhing bde ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'od gsal ba mngon du bya'o //
translated: having experienced bliss with the net of the vagina, etc., one should manifest clear light with the process of bliss, etc.

original: de bas na rgyud 'di nyid las bde bas byang chub bsgrub par bya'i /
analyzed: de bas na rgyud 'di nyid las bde bas byang chub bsgrub par bya'i /
translated: Enlightenment is to be achieved through bliss,

original: lus gdungs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus gdungs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: not through tormenting the body.

original: zhes so // da ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dbang bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes so // da ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dbang bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to teach the consecration of the yogis, it is said:

original: de na 'di ni sngom gnas 'di //
analyzed: de na 'di ni sngom gnas 'di //
translated: This is the vow-abiding,

original: rtag tu mi phyed brtul zhugs gang //
analyzed: rtag tu mi phyed brtul zhugs gang //
translated: always the indivisible observances,

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje yi //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje yi //
translated: the practice of the vajra of body, speech, and mind,

original: bsgrub pa dag kyang brtsam par bya //
analyzed: bsgrub pa dag kyang brtsam par bya //
translated: and the undertaking of the observances.

original: zhes smos pa la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes smos pa la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows:

original: des na ni sngar bshad pa'i bde ba'i thabs kyi rgyu yis so //
analyzed: des na ni sngar bshad pa'i bde ba'i thabs kyi rgyu yis so //
translated: By the means of bliss explained above,

original: 'dir dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud las sngom pa bsrungs pa gang yin pa de rnams la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de ni brtul zhugs so //
analyzed: 'dir dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud las sngom pa bsrungs pa gang yin pa de rnams la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de ni brtul zhugs so //
translated: here, in the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra, the vow-abiding is the observances of the yogis.

original: rtag tu ni dus gsum du yang mi phyed pa ste phyir mi ldog pas bcom ldan 'das sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sgrub pa ste mngon du byed pa'i thabs brtsam pa ni brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ni dus gsum du yang mi phyed pa ste phyir mi ldog pas bcom ldan 'das sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sgrub pa ste mngon du byed pa'i thabs brtsam pa ni brtsam par bya'o //
translated: Always means that one should not be divided, that is, one should not turn away, at any time.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: re zhig dang po sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi spyod pa bsgrub pa'i don du snying rje chen po'i dbang gis byang chub kyi sems bskyed cing gtong ba la sogs pa la 'jug pa zab pa dang rgya che ba'i bdag nyid kyi
analyzed: re zhig dang po sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi spyod pa bsgrub pa'i don du snying rje chen po'i dbang gis byang chub kyi sems bskyed cing gtong ba la sogs pa la 'jug pa zab pa dang rgya che ba'i bdag nyid kyi
translated: First, in order to accomplish the practice of the six perfections such as generosity, one should generate the mind of enlightenment through the power of great compassion and engage in giving and so forth.

original: sngags kyi theg pa chen po la mos pa dang ldan pas rdo rje slob dpon gyi spyan sngar phyin te /
analyzed: sngags kyi theg pa chen po la mos pa dang ldan pas rdo rje slob dpon gyi spyan sngar phyin te /
translated: One who has faith in the Great Vehicle of Mantra should go before a vajra master.

original: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bar mandala byas nas mchod cing gsol ba gdab pa mang por byas nas /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bar mandala byas nas mchod cing gsol ba gdab pa mang por byas nas /
translated: Having gone for refuge to the Three Jewels and so forth, one should make a maṇḍala, make offerings, and make many supplications.

original: mgu bar gyur pa'i slob dpon des dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor bri ba sngon du 'gro bas slob dpon dang / gsang ba dang / shes rab dang / bzhi pa'i dbang bskur dang / bza' bar bya ba dang / bsrung ba'i dam tshig dang /
analyzed: mgu bar gyur pa'i slob dpon des dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor bri ba sngon du 'gro bas slob dpon dang / gsang ba dang / shes rab dang / bzhi pa'i dbang bskur dang / bza' bar bya ba dang / bsrung ba'i dam tshig dang /
translated: The master who is pleased with that should confer the empowerment, having first drawn the maṇḍala of Śrī Guhyasamāja.🔽Having conferred the secret, gnosis, and fourth empowerments, the master should confer the pledges of what should be eaten and what should be guarded,

original: sngom pa sbyin pa'i sngon du 'gro bas dbang bskur ba'i rdo rje brtul zhugs dang / spyod pa'i brtul zhugs dang / rig pa'i brtul zhugs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sngom pa sbyin pa'i sngon du 'gro bas dbang bskur ba'i rdo rje brtul zhugs dang / spyod pa'i brtul zhugs dang / rig pa'i brtul zhugs dang ldan pa /
translated: and having conferred the vows, the vajra conduct, the conduct of practice, and the conduct of knowledge,

original: @18a * // pha rol rgol ba rnams kyis mi zlogs pa /
analyzed: @18a * // pha rol rgol ba rnams kyis mi zlogs pa /
translated: the master should confer the empowerment, having first conferred the vajra conduct that cannot be overcome by opponents.🔽Having understood from the guru’s instruction the four kinds of unerring explanations of the Śrī Guhyasamāja Tantra, and so on, one should contemplate the four kinds of knowledge.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud phyin ci ma log par bshad pa rnam pa bzhi la sogs pa'i rim gyis bla ma'i zhal nas khong du chud de rig pa bzhi'i rim gyis bsams la bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i phyir slob dpon gyi spyan sngar phyin te /
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud phyin ci ma log par bshad pa rnam pa bzhi la sogs pa'i rim gyis bla ma'i zhal nas khong du chud de rig pa bzhi'i rim gyis bsams la bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i phyir slob dpon gyi spyan sngar phyin te /
translated: In order to benefit oneself and others, one should go into the presence of the master,

original: mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod cing thal mo sbyar te /
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod cing thal mo sbyar te /
translated: make offerings with the five offerings, and join one’s palms together.

original: bcom ldan 'das slob dpon dam pa 'khor ba'i sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal las dgrol ba'i don du thugs rje bskyed pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das slob dpon dam pa 'khor ba'i sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal las dgrol ba'i don du thugs rje bskyed pa /
translated: Bhagavat, excellent master, generate compassion for the sake of liberating all sentient beings of cyclic existence from suffering.

original: bdag ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ba bsgrub par 'dod de /
analyzed: bdag ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ba bsgrub par 'dod de /
translated: I wish to accomplish the Bhagavat Vajradhara.

original: de bas na slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas byis dben par bsgom par bya ba'i phyir bdag la rjes su gnang bar mdzod cig ces gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas byis dben par bsgom par bya ba'i phyir bdag la rjes su gnang bar mdzod cig ces gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, master, please grant me permission to meditate in solitude.

original: de'i rjes la slob ma 'di skal ba dang ldan pa yin no zhes nges par byas la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la slob ma 'di skal ba dang ldan pa yin no zhes nges par byas la /
translated: After that, having ascertained, This disciple is fortunate,

original: rdo rje slob dpon gyis de la smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon gyis de la smra bar bya ste /
translated: the vajra master should say to him:

original: rigs kyi bu rang dang gzhan la phan par bya ba'i phyir dben pa la 'dug ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rang dang gzhan la phan par bya ba'i phyir dben pa la 'dug ste /
translated: Son of good family, in order to benefit yourself and others, stay in solitude

original: ji ltar thos pa de bzhin du bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis rdo rje 'chang gi dkyil 'khor bsgrub par gyis shig ces des rjes su gnang bas de'i zhabs la gtugs te /
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa de bzhin du bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis rdo rje 'chang gi dkyil 'khor bsgrub par gyis shig ces des rjes su gnang bas de'i zhabs la gtugs te /
translated: and, just as you have heard, accomplish the Vajradhara maṇḍala with the wisdom of the nature of meditation.

original: khyed kyi bkas rdo rje 'chang gi dkyil 'khor bdag la myur du sgrubs shig ces smras la dben par song ste /
analyzed: khyed kyi bkas rdo rje 'chang gi dkyil 'khor bdag la myur du sgrubs shig ces smras la dben par song ste /
translated: You should quickly accomplish the maṇḍala of Vajradhara for me. Having said that, one should go to a solitary place.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa la brtson par bya'o zhes ngag gi don to //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa la brtson par bya'o zhes ngag gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the words is: One should strive in the meditation in order to accomplish the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: de ltar rjes su gnang ba byang chub bsgrub pa'i phyir snod du rung ba yin gyis gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su gnang ba byang chub bsgrub pa'i phyir snod du rung ba yin gyis gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the one who is suitable for the consecration is the one who is suitable for the attainment of enlightenment, not the other.

original: 'dir sngom pa'i sgra ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'dir sngom pa'i sgra ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don te /
translated: Here, the term 'vow' has the meaning of indication.

original: dam tshig la gnas pa yang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig la gnas pa yang bshad par bya'o //
translated: One who abides in the commitments should also be explained.

original: de la rig pa'i dbang bskur la //
analyzed: de la rig pa'i dbang bskur la //
translated: There, the consecration of knowledge

original: rigs lnga'i dam tshig ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / rdo rje dang / dril bu dang / slob dpon 'dzin pa dang / sbyin pa bzhi dang / dam pa'i chos rnam pa gsum po 'dzin pa dang / ci nus pas mchod pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i dam tshig ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / rdo rje dang / dril bu dang / slob dpon 'dzin pa dang / sbyin pa bzhi dang / dam pa'i chos rnam pa gsum po 'dzin pa dang / ci nus pas mchod pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: The commitments of the five families are: going for refuge to the Three Jewels, the vajra, the bell, holding the master, the four gifts, upholding the three kinds of Dharma, and the rite of worship to the best of one's ability.

original: sngom pa ni lnga ste /
analyzed: sngom pa ni lnga ste /
translated: The vows are five:

original: mi dge ba bcu spang ba dang / theg pa dman pa la 'dod pa mi byed pa dang / chang spong ba dang / sems can gyi don la rgyab kyis phyogs pa spong ba dang / lha la sogs pa'i mtshan ma la @18b sogs mi 'gom pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu spang ba dang / theg pa dman pa la 'dod pa mi byed pa dang / chang spong ba dang / sems can gyi don la rgyab kyis phyogs pa spong ba dang / lha la sogs pa'i mtshan ma la @18b sogs mi 'gom pa'o //
translated: (1) to avoid the ten nonvirtuous actions, (2) to not desire the Hinayana, (3) to avoid alcohol, (4) to avoid turning one's back on the welfare of sentient beings, and (5) to avoid stepping over things such as images of deities.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur ba la dam tshig ni bcu bzhi ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur ba la dam tshig ni bcu bzhi ste /
translated: The fourteen pledges of the five families are to renounce the ten unvirtuous deeds, to have no interest in the Lesser Vehicle, to abstain from alcohol, to never turn one’s back on the welfare of others, and to not step over the implements used in the practice of mantra.

original: slob dpon la smod pa dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' las 'das pa dang / rdo rje spun la smod pa dang / byams pa chen po spong ba dang / byang chub kyi sems gtong ba dang / theg pa gsum la smod pa dang /
analyzed: slob dpon la smod pa dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' las 'das pa dang / rdo rje spun la smod pa dang / byams pa chen po spong ba dang / byang chub kyi sems gtong ba dang / theg pa gsum la smod pa dang /
translated: The fourteen pledges of the empowerment of the irreversible wheel are to renounce disparaging the master, transgressing the Sugata’s words, disparaging vajra siblings, abandoning great love, forsaking the awakening mind, disparaging the three vehicles,

original: skal ba med pa la gsang ba'i chos ston pa dang / rang gi phung po smod pa dang / chos rang bzhin med pa la som nyi za ba dang / gdug pa can la byams pa dang / chags pa dang bral ba dang / chos rnams la mtha' gnyis gzhag pa dang /🔽dad pa'i sems smod pa dang / ji snyed pa'i dam tshig la mi brten pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin bud med la smod pa'o zhes rtsa ba'i ltung ba bcu bzhi spong ba ni dam tshig go //
analyzed: skal ba med pa la gsang ba'i chos ston pa dang / rang gi phung po smod pa dang / chos rang bzhin med pa la som nyi za ba dang / gdug pa can la byams pa dang / chags pa dang bral ba dang / chos rnams la mtha' gnyis gzhag pa dang / dad pa'i sems smod pa dang / ji snyed pa'i dam tshig la mi brten pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin bud med la smod pa'o zhes rtsa ba'i ltung ba bcu bzhi spong ba ni dam tshig go //
translated: The fourteen root downfalls are: to teach the secret doctrine to those who are not fit vessels; to disparage one’s own aggregates; to doubt the absence of intrinsic existence of phenomena; to be loving toward the wicked; to be free from attachment; to posit the two extremes with regard to phenomena;🔽to disparage the mind of faith; not to rely on the commitments to the extent that one has; and to disparage women, who are the nature of the perfection of sublime insight.

original: mi dga' ba'i rigs bsten pa dang / dam tshig rnams mi sbyor ba dang / tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor la rtsod pa dang / dad pa'i sems smod pa dang / zhag bdun gyi bar du nyan thos pa'i nang na gnas pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i nga rgyal dang /
analyzed: mi dga' ba'i rigs bsten pa dang / dam tshig rnams mi sbyor ba dang / tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor la rtsod pa dang / dad pa'i sems smod pa dang / zhag bdun gyi bar du nyan thos pa'i nang na gnas pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i nga rgyal dang /
translated: The twenty-five secondary downfalls are: to rely on a family that is not suitable; not to apply the commitments; to dispute in the mandala of the assembly; to disparage the mind of faith; to remain among pious attendants for more than seven days; to have the pride of a yogin;

original: dad pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la log pa'i chos ston pa dang / ma nges pa la chos ston pa dang / ma sbyor ba la gsang ba ston pa dang / snod ma yin pa la zab mo'i chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la log pa'i chos ston pa dang / ma nges pa la chos ston pa dang / ma sbyor ba la gsang ba ston pa dang / snod ma yin pa la zab mo'i chos ston pa ste /
translated: Teaching the wrong Dharma to sentient beings who have faith, teaching the Dharma to those who are not receptive, teaching the secret to those who are not ready, and teaching the profound Dharma to those who are not suitable vessels.

original: kha na ma tho ba bcu mi byed pa ni sngom pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba bcu mi byed pa ni sngom pa'o //
translated: Not committing these ten misdeeds is the vow.

original: gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba la dam tshig gsum ste /
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba la dam tshig gsum ste /
translated: There are three samayas for the secret empowerment:

original: rdo rje'i de kho na nyid dang / dril bu'i de kho na nyid dang / phyag rgya'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje'i de kho na nyid dang / dril bu'i de kho na nyid dang / phyag rgya'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: the suchness of the vajra, the suchness of the bell, and the suchness of the mudra.

original: sngom pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sngom pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three vows:

original: sgron ma myang ba dang / lcags kyu myang ba dang / bha ga la tsumba na'o ;
analyzed: sgron ma myang ba dang / lcags kyu myang ba dang / bha ga la tsumba na'o ;
translated: licking the lamp, licking the hook, and kissing the bhaga.

original: / shes rab kyi dbang bskur ba la dam tshig lnga ste /
analyzed: / shes rab kyi dbang bskur ba la dam tshig lnga ste /
translated: There are five samayas for the wisdom empowerment:

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma sbyin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang phra ma'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma sbyin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang phra ma'o //

original: sngom pa ni lnga ste /
analyzed: sngom pa ni lnga ste /

original: de rnams la gnas par gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de rnams la gnas par gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: 'dod pa'i gzugs la gnas pa ni dgongs pas bshad pa'o //

analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la dga' ba ni dgongs pas ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa la brtson pa ni spyi'i don to //

analyzed: padma can dang dung can dang // autpala can dang / sbyor ba'i dbye bas 'dod ma la dga' ba ste mthar thug pa'o //

translated: The one endowed with the vajra conduct, the conduct of practice, and the conduct of knowledge is the conduct, which is the interpretable meaning.

original: 'od gsal ba rtogs pas brtul zhugs te nges ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba rtogs pas brtul zhugs te nges ba'i don to //

analyzed: ral can gcer bu mgo reg dang // gtsug pud can dang 'du 'dzi bral // rtags ni de de sna tshogs pas //

analyzed: mngon par byang chub 'dod pa yin //

analyzed: thugs rdo rje ni mi bskyod pa ste /

analyzed: sku rdo rje ni yi ge aom mo //

analyzed: gsung rdo rje ni yi ge a'a: 'o //

original: spyi'i don to //
analyzed: spyi'i don to //

analyzed: sku rdo rje ni rus sbal kyi  rtsa dang / gsung rdo rje ni zla ba'i rtsa dang / thugs rdo rje ni 'dod pa'i gdugs kyi rtsa ste sbas pa'o //
translated: The vajra of body is the tortoise channel, the vajra of speech is the moon channel, and the vajra of mind is the desire parasol channel. This is the hidden meaning.

analyzed: sku rdo rje ni chags pa dang / gsung rdo rje ni chags pa dang bral ba dang / thugs rdo rje ni chags pa bar ma ste /

original: mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'o //
translated: This is the ultimate meaning.

analyzed: sku rdo rje ni khrag dang / gsung rdo rje ni shu kra dang ; thugs rdo rje ni dri chab ste /

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //

original: sku rdo rje ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje ni snang ba'o //

analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: sku rdo rje ni tshangs pa'o //

analyzed: man ngag ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom pa ni bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: da ni snying rje chen po mngon spyod du gyur pa sngon du 'gro bas khyad par gyi gnas la brten pa bshad par bya ste //

translated: The mountain is the mahamudra.

original: de rnams la sgrub pa ste yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams la sgrub pa ste yi ge'i don to //
translated: One should practice on those, as it is said. This is the word meaning.

original: dgon pa chen po ni snying gar yi ge h'um do //
analyzed: dgon pa chen po ni snying gar yi ge h'um do //
translated: The great forest is the letter hūṃ in the heart.

original: me tog 'bras bu sogs kyis brgyan pa ni lkog mar yi ge a'a:'o //
analyzed: me tog 'bras bu sogs kyis brgyan pa ni lkog mar yi ge a'a:'o //
translated: The place adorned with flowers, fruits, and so on is the letter āḥ in the throat.

original: ri bo dben pa ni spyi bor yi ge aom mo //
analyzed: ri bo dben pa ni spyi bor yi ge aom mo //
translated: The solitary mountain is the letter oṃ in the head.

original: de la bsgrub pa ste spyi'i don to //
analyzed: de la bsgrub pa ste spyi'i don to //
translated: The practice is the general meaning.

original: dgon pa chen po ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: dgon pa chen po ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The great forest is the dharmakāya.

original: me tog 'bras bu sogs kyis brgyan pa ni ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: me tog 'bras bu sogs kyis brgyan pa ni ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: The place adorned with flowers, fruits, and so on is the jñānakāya.

original: ri bo dben pa ni de dang tha mi dang pa rdo rje'i sku'o //
analyzed: ri bo dben pa ni de dang tha mi dang pa rdo rje'i sku'o //
translated: The solitary mountain is the vajrakāya, which is not different from that.

original: de @20b la bsgrub par bya ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: de @20b la bsgrub par bya ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The practice is the ultimate.

original: de la bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The concise meaning is as follows:

original: re zhig dang por skye bos dben pa'i sa phyogs su bdud rtsi lngas gru bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor byugs la /
analyzed: re zhig dang por skye bos dben pa'i sa phyogs su bdud rtsi lngas gru bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor byugs la /
translated: First, in a place free of people, one should anoint a square maṇḍala with the five elixirs.

original: der bya 'gan la sogs pa'i 'jam pa'i stan la 'dug ste /
analyzed: der bya 'gan la sogs pa'i 'jam pa'i stan la 'dug ste /
translated: There, one should sit on a soft seat, such as a bird’s nest, and so on.

original: sdug bsngal du mas mnan pa'i khams gsum pa mngon du byas la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal du mas mnan pa'i khams gsum pa mngon du byas la /
translated: One should visualize the three realms oppressed by many sufferings.

original: sems can thams cad bde ba dang / sbyor bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa byams pa dang / sems can thams cad sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i snying rje dang 'phags pa dang so so skye bo'i bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam pa'am /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bde ba dang / sbyor bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa byams pa dang / sems can thams cad sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i snying rje dang 'phags pa dang so so skye bo'i bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam pa'am /
translated: Love is the aspect of wishing to join all sentient beings with happiness.🔽Compassion is the aspect of wishing that all sentient beings be free from all suffering.

original: sems can thams cad byang chub la gzhug par bgyi zhes de'i rnam pa dga' ba dang / sems can thams cad lan cig snod min pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad byang chub la gzhug par bgyi zhes de'i rnam pa dga' ba dang / sems can thams cad lan cig snod min pa ste /
translated: Joy is the aspect of rejoicing in the merit of both āryas and ordinary beings, or the aspect of thinking, “I will cause all sentient beings to enter enlightenment.”

original: smin pa'i dus gdul bar bgyi zhes btang snyoms te /
analyzed: smin pa'i dus gdul bar bgyi zhes btang snyoms te /
translated: Equanimity is the aspect of thinking, “All sentient beings are not vessels for the teachings at present, but I will ripen them and guide them at the appropriate time.”

original: rnam par sdang ba dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / rnam par mi dga' ba dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams la dmigs pa tshad med pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam par sdang ba dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / rnam par mi dga' ba dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams la dmigs pa tshad med pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four immeasurables are the antidotes to the four attitudes of hostility, violence, unhappiness, and attachment.

original: rnal 'byor bsrung ba'i don du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bsrung ba'i don du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: They should be cultivated in order to protect the yogi.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms ni bde ba dang ; sdug bsngal ba dang bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa'i yul la bsgoms pas sems dang bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms ni bde ba dang ; sdug bsngal ba dang bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa'i yul la bsgoms pas sems dang bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Love, compassion, joy, and equanimity are cultivated with respect to the objects of happiness, suffering, and merit, and non-merit.

original: da ni gnas bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gnas bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to protect the site, the cultivation is explained.

original: 'jam pa'i stan la 'dug nas ni //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i stan la 'dug nas ni //
translated: Having sat on a soft seat,

original: sems dpa'i skyil krung legs gnas te //
analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil krung legs gnas te //
translated: well-placed in the bodhisattva cross-legged posture,🔽one should contemplate the protection of the site

original: zhe sdang rdo rje'i ting 'dzin gnas //🔽gnas bsrung ba ni bsam par bya //🔽zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: zhe sdang rdo rje'i ting 'dzin gnas // gnas bsrung ba ni bsam par bya // zhes smos pa la /
translated: in the concentration of Hatred Vajra.

original: rnal 'byor bsrung ba'i 'og tu rnal 'byor pas cig car du bcom ldan 'das zhal gcig pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor bsrung ba'i 'og tu rnal 'byor pas cig car du bcom ldan 'das zhal gcig pa /
translated: After protecting the yoga, the yogī should simultaneously visualize the Blessed One with one face,

original: phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa /
translated: two arms,

original: rdo rje dang dril bu 'chang ba dkar zhing zhi ba rdo rje 'chang chen pos sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang dril bu 'chang ba dkar zhing zhi ba rdo rje 'chang chen pos sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: holding a vajra and a bell, white and peaceful, Great Vajradhara, abiding in the bodhisattva cross-legged posture.

original: de nas bgegs bskrad par mngon pa dgongs nas /
analyzed: de nas bgegs bskrad par mngon pa dgongs nas /
translated: Then, intending to expel the obstructors,

original: thugs ka nas spros pa'i cung zad khros pa'i aindra n'i la'i kha dog 'dra ba'i zhe sdang rdo rje dang dbyer med par byas la bcom ldan 'das de nyid du bdag nyid bsgom @21a * //🔽par bya ste /
analyzed: thugs ka nas spros pa'i cung zad khros pa'i aindra n'i la'i kha dog 'dra ba'i zhe sdang rdo rje dang dbyer med par byas la bcom ldan 'das de nyid du bdag nyid bsgom @21a * // par bya ste /
translated: Having made oneself inseparable from Hatred Vajra, who is emitted from the heart, who is slightly wrathful, and who is the color of sapphire, one should meditate on oneself as that very Bhagavat.

original: gang gi phyir khro bo'i dkyil 'khor ni zhe sdang rdo rje las byung ngo zhes de nyid bsgom par bya bar rigs kyi mi bskyong  pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khro bo'i dkyil 'khor ni zhe sdang rdo rje las byung ngo zhes de nyid bsgom par bya bar rigs kyi mi bskyong  pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For what reason? The mandala of the wrathful ones arises from Hatred Vajra, so it is proper to meditate on him, not on Akshobhya.

original: thugs rdo rje'i dbye bas gnyis te /
analyzed: thugs rdo rje'i dbye bas gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of Cittavajra:

original: zhe sdang rdo rje dang mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang rdo rje dang mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Hatred Vajra and Akshobhya.

original: de la zhe sdang rdo rje ni mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa kha dog mthing nag go //
analyzed: de la zhe sdang rdo rje ni mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa kha dog mthing nag go //
translated: Hatred Vajra has a dark blue color and bared fangs.

original: mi bskyod pa ni sgeg cing zhi ba aindra n'i la'i kha dog go //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa ni sgeg cing zhi ba aindra n'i la'i kha dog go //
translated: Akshobhya is graceful and peaceful and the color of sapphire.

original: gnas bsrung ba ni phyogs bcu'i bgegs rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid bsam par bya zhes drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas bsrung ba ni phyogs bcu'i bgegs rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid bsam par bya zhes drang ba'i don to //
translated: Protecting the site should be understood to have the characteristic of pacifying the obstructors in the ten directions. This is the interpretable meaning explanation.

original: 'jam pa'i stan ni shes rab kyi mtsho skyes kyi ze 'bru ste /
analyzed: 'jam pa'i stan ni shes rab kyi mtsho skyes kyi ze 'bru ste /
translated: The lotus seat is the pericarp of the lake-born one, i.e., wisdom.

original: 'dod pa'i gdugs kyi rtsa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gdugs kyi rtsa'o //
translated: The stalk of the lotus is the stalk of the parasol of desire.

original: de la 'dug nas ni de'i reg pa tsam la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'dug nas ni de'i reg pa tsam la dga' ba'o //
translated: Sitting on that, one should delight in the mere touch of it.

original: sems dpa'i skyil mo krung ni rdo rje padma snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil mo krung ni rdo rje padma snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The sattva posture is the union of the vajra and lotus.

original: des legs gnas te bde bar gnas par gyur nas so //
analyzed: des legs gnas te bde bar gnas par gyur nas so //
translated: Having well-abided by that, i.e., having become well-situated,

original: zhe sdang rdo rje ni nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom pa'i mtshan nyid 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang rdo rje ni nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom pa'i mtshan nyid 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: one should meditate on the vajra of hatred, which is the clear light characterized by the destruction of all afflictions.

original: de nyid ting 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ting 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the samadhi, because it generates the one-pointed mind.

original: der gnas pa ni 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: der gnas pa ni 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Abiding in that, one should enter,

original: gnas bsrung pa ni sgo bcu'i gnas las srog la sogs pa rlung bcu 'gog pa bsam par bya zhes nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnas bsrung pa ni sgo bcu'i gnas las srog la sogs pa rlung bcu 'gog pa bsam par bya zhes nges pa'i don to //
translated: and protect the place, i.e., one should imagine the cessation of the ten winds, such as life, from the ten doors of the body. This is the definitive meaning.

original: da ni de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /🔽'bar ba'i 'od 'phro 'jigs par byed//
analyzed: da ni de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste / 'bar ba'i 'od 'phro 'jigs par byed//
translated: Now, in order to teach that, it is explained:🔽The blazing light is terrifying,

original: nyi ma la gnas h'um las byung //
analyzed: nyi ma la gnas h'um las byung //
translated: arising from the sun and hum.

original: g-yon brkyang ba yis gnas la gnas //
analyzed: g-yon brkyang ba yis gnas la gnas //
translated: He stands in the posture of left leg extended.

original: khro bo bcu ni spro bar bya //
analyzed: khro bo bcu ni spro bar bya //
translated: Emanate the ten wrathful ones.

original: zhes smos pa la sngar bshad pa'i zhe sdang rdo rje'i ting nges 'dzin la dmigs te /🔽thugs ka nas rang dang 'dra ba'i reg bya rdo rje ma spros la des bha gar h'um yongs su gyur pa las sna tshogs rdo rje'i steng du ram yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su snying ga'i padma la gnas pa'i ting
analyzed: zhes smos pa la sngar bshad pa'i zhe sdang rdo rje'i ting nges 'dzin la dmigs te / thugs ka nas rang dang 'dra ba'i reg bya rdo rje ma spros la des bha gar h'um yongs su gyur pa las sna tshogs rdo rje'i steng du ram yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su snying ga'i padma la gnas pa'i ting
translated: Here, one focuses on the concentration being of wrathful Vajra­dharma as previously explained.🔽From one's heart center emanate a touch-vajra goddess similar to oneself. She enters the bhaga and transforms into a hūṃ, which in turn transforms into a crossed vajra. Upon that, a ram syllable transforms into a sun mandala in the center of which is a lotus at the heart center.

original: nge 'dzin sems dpa'i yig 'bru las 'od zer gyi 'khor lo ba spu'i bu ga thams cad las spros pa lcags kyu'i rnam pa des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i khro bo'i rgyal po rnams bkug cing ngag gi lam nas zhugs te rtsa dbu ma'i
analyzed: nge 'dzin sems dpa'i yig 'bru las 'od zer gyi 'khor lo ba spu'i bu ga thams cad las spros pa lcags kyu'i rnam pa des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i khro bo'i rgyal po rnams bkug cing ngag gi lam nas zhugs te rtsa dbu ma'i
translated: From the seed syllable of the concentration being on the lotus, a circle of light rays emanates from all the pores of the body.

original: lam nas byang chub kyi sems kyi rnam par spros la thig le yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i yi ge h'um bcu bsgoms te /🔽de yongs su gyur pa las gtsigs pa'i rdo rje bcu 'bar ba'i 'od 'phro ba h'um gis mtshan pa bsams te /
analyzed: lam nas byang chub kyi sems kyi rnam par spros la thig le yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i yi ge h'um bcu bsgoms te / de yongs su gyur pa las gtsigs pa'i rdo rje bcu 'bar ba'i 'od 'phro ba h'um gis mtshan pa bsams te /
translated: Then, having emanated the ten wrathful ones from the path in the aspect of the spirit of enlightenment, meditate on the ten syllables hūṃ arising from the complete transformation of the drop.

original: spro @21b ba dang bsdu ba sngon du 'gro bar yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa khro bo bcu ji ltar bshad pa'i dbyibs dang kha dog dang phyag mtshan dang ldan pa bskyed la /
analyzed: spro @21b ba dang bsdu ba sngon du 'gro bar yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa khro bo bcu ji ltar bshad pa'i dbyibs dang kha dog dang phyag mtshan dang ldan pa bskyed la /
translated: Then, having imagined the ten blazing vajra hooks marked with hūṃ, having emanated and withdrawn them, they arise from the complete transformation and one should generate the ten wrathful ones such as Yamāntaka, possessing the shape, color, and hand implements as explained.

original: de rnams bskyed pa'i sngon du h'um las byung ba gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po zhal gsum phyag drug pa kha dog sngon po nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gnas par bsams te /
analyzed: de rnams bskyed pa'i sngon du h'um las byung ba gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po zhal gsum phyag drug pa kha dog sngon po nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gnas par bsams te /
translated: Prior to generating them, one should imagine that from hūṃ arises Sumbharāja, with three faces and six arms, blue in color, standing on a sun maṇḍala.

original: de nas lha mo'i ba spu'i bu ga thams cad kyi sgo nas khro bo bcu gcig spros te /
analyzed: de nas lha mo'i ba spu'i bu ga thams cad kyi sgo nas khro bo bcu gcig spros te /
translated: Then, having emanated the eleven wrathful ones from the doors of all the pores of the goddess,

original: bdag nyid kyi phyogs bcu dang mdun du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi phyogs bcu dang mdun du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine them in the ten directions and in front of oneself, standing in the sun-maṇḍala.

original: de la gshin rje mthar byed ni sngon po /
analyzed: de la gshin rje mthar byed ni sngon po /
translated: Yama-māra is blue,

original: sngon po dang / dkar po dang / dmar po'i zhal mnga' ba /
analyzed: sngon po dang / dkar po dang / dmar po'i zhal mnga' ba /
translated: with blue, white, and red faces.

original: dbyug to dang / 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang / sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang dril bu 'chad ba /
analyzed: dbyug to dang / 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang / sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang dril bu 'chad ba /
translated: He holds a club, wheel, vajra, lotus, and threatening gesture, and a noose and bell.

original: ma he'i steng du gshin rje mnan nas g-yas brkyang gis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ma he'i steng du gshin rje mnan nas g-yas brkyang gis gnas pa'o //
translated: He stands with his right leg extended on a buffalo, pressing on Yama.

original: shes rab mthar byed dkar po /
analyzed: shes rab mthar byed dkar po /
translated: Prajñā-māra is white,

original: dkar po dang / sngon po dang / dmar po'i zhal mnga' ba /
analyzed: dkar po dang / sngon po dang / dmar po'i zhal mnga' ba /
translated: with white, blue, and red faces.

original: dbyig pa dang / ral gri dang / rdo rje dang / nor bu dang / sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang dril bu 'dzin pa /
analyzed: dbyig pa dang / ral gri dang / rdo rje dang / nor bu dang / sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang dril bu 'dzin pa /
translated: He holds a mace, sword, vajra, jewel, and threatening gesture, and a noose and bell.

original: khyab 'jug gi steng du g-yon brkyang bas gnas ba'o //
analyzed: khyab 'jug gi steng du g-yon brkyang bas gnas ba'o //
translated: He stands with his left leg extended on Viṣṇu.

original: padma mthar byed dmar po /
analyzed: padma mthar byed dmar po /
translated: Padma-māra is red,

original: dmar po dang ; sngon po dang / dkar po'i zhal mnga' ba /
analyzed: dmar po dang ; sngon po dang / dkar po'i zhal mnga' ba /
translated: with red, blue, and white faces.

original: padma dang / ral gri dang / rdo rje dang / nor bu dang / sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang / dril bu 'chang ba /
analyzed: padma dang / ral gri dang / rdo rje dang / nor bu dang / sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang / dril bu 'chang ba /
translated: He holds a lotus, sword, vajra, jewel, threatening forefinger, lasso, and a bell.

original: lha chen bo'i steng du rkang pa mnyam pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lha chen bo'i steng du rkang pa mnyam pas gnas pa'o //
translated: He stands with his feet evenly placed upon Mahêśvara.

original: bgegs mthar byed ni ljang gu /
analyzed: bgegs mthar byed ni ljang gu /
translated: Vighnāntaka is green.

original: ljang gu dang ; sngon po dang / dmar po'i zhal mnga' ba rdo rje dang / ral gri dang / padma dang / nor bu dang / sdigs mdzub zhags pa dang / dril bu 'chang ba log 'dren gyi steng du mi mnyam pa'i rkang pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ljang gu dang ; sngon po dang / dmar po'i zhal mnga' ba rdo rje dang / ral gri dang / padma dang / nor bu dang / sdigs mdzub zhags pa dang / dril bu 'chang ba log 'dren gyi steng du mi mnyam pa'i rkang pas gnas pa'o //
translated: He has green, blue, and red faces. He holds a vajra, sword, lotus, jewel, threatening forefinger, lasso, and a bell. He stands with his left leg extended upon Bala.

original: mi g-yo ba dang / 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang / dbyig sngon dang / stobs po che dang / gnod mdzes dang gtsug tor 'khor lo ste zhal gsum phyag drug pa /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba dang / 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang / dbyig sngon dang / stobs po che dang / gnod mdzes dang gtsug tor 'khor lo ste zhal gsum phyag drug pa /
translated: Acala, Trailokyavijaya, Nīlāmbaradhara, Mahābala, Sumbha, and Uṣṇīṣa-cakravartin have three faces and six arms.

original: kha dog nag po /
analyzed: kha dog nag po /
translated: They are black.

original: g-yon brkyang bas nyi ma la gnas pa /
analyzed: g-yon brkyang bas nyi ma la gnas pa /
translated: They stand on the sun with their left legs extended.

original: gtso bo'i phyag gis lcags kyu dang / rtse gsum dang / dbyig pa dang / ral gri dang / 'khor lo dang / rdo rje 'chang ba dang / @22a * //🔽lhag ma rnams kyis gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa bzhin du phyag mtshan 'dzin pa bsgom par bya'o //🔽khro bo de dag kyang mi'u thung lto 'phyang ba /🔽sku rgyas pa /
analyzed: gtso bo'i phyag gis lcags kyu dang / rtse gsum dang / dbyig pa dang / ral gri dang / 'khor lo dang / rdo rje 'chang ba dang / @22a * // lhag ma rnams kyis gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa bzhin du phyag mtshan 'dzin pa bsgom par bya'o // khro bo de dag kyang mi'u thung lto 'phyang ba / sku rgyas pa /
translated: The principal one holds a hook, a trident, a club, a sword, a wheel, a vajra, and a skull filled with blood in his right hands,

original: mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa ha har sgrogs pa /🔽skra 'bar ba gyen du brdzes pa /🔽nyi ma dang zla ba dang me'i rang bzhin spyan gsum pa /🔽smin ma dang / sma ra dang / dbu skra kham pa /🔽ral pa'i thor tshugs 'jog pos bcings pa /
analyzed: mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa ha har sgrogs pa / skra 'bar ba gyen du brdzes pa / nyi ma dang zla ba dang me'i rang bzhin spyan gsum pa / smin ma dang / sma ra dang / dbu skra kham pa / ral pa'i thor tshugs 'jog pos bcings pa /

translated: One should imagine that the hammer, which is of the nature of Hayagrīva, is striking and splitting open the heads of Indra and the others.🔽At the time of striking with the kīla, one should imagine the ten wrathful ones, who are similar to the Blessed Amṛtakuṇḍali,

original: autpala sngon po lta bu bsam par bya ste /

analyzed: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa ni las thams cad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de nas khro bo'i rgyal po de rnams kyis bgegs de dag sa 'og bdun gyi bar du son par bsam par bya'o //
