translated: The retinue of wrathful ones that arises from that, surrounding the iron fence, are the retinue of those, yakṣas, rākṣasas, bhūtas, piśācas, pretas, ḍākinīs, and pūtanās, and so on, who are burned and reduced to ashes by the wrathful ones, and are carried away by the wind of the breath of the syllable hūṃ that arises from the mouths of the wrathful ones, and are made invisible.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to explain that,

original: rdo rje bdud rtsi rgyal po che //
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi rgyal po che //

analyzed: de nyid rgyal po che ste khro bo thams cad kyi nang na gtso bor gyur pa las thams cad kyi rigs las byung ba'i phyir ro //

original: autpala sngon po'i 'dab ma'i mdog ni ljang gu'o //
analyzed: autpala sngon po'i 'dab ma'i mdog ni ljang gu'o //

analyzed: 'bar phreng 'khrigs pa'i 'od ldan pa //

analyzed: rtse mo lta bur rnam bsam zhing //

analyzed: bur bsgom // zhes smos pa la /

analyzed: khro bo bcu po de dag steng du ni lte ba'i bar du zhal gsum phyag drug pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: de'i lte ba man chad ni rdo rje rtse gcig pa lta bu bsam par bya'o //

analyzed: gang gis bgegs rnams phur bus btab par gyur te drang ba'i don to //

analyzed: 'dod pa'i gdugs dang / rus sbal ma dang / zla ba ma ste rtsa gsum lte ba yan chad cha gnyis kyis gnas pas phyag drug pa lta bu'o //

translated: At the time of union, they become of one taste, and become like a single-pointed vajra. At that time, the obstructors of appearance and so forth are staked with the dagger, is the definitive meaning.

analyzed: de nyid spro bar bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste // de yi gsang sngags legs brjod la //

analyzed: rdo rje'i phur bus nges btab na //

analyzed: bgegs kyi lus la mi g-yo 'gyur //

original: zhes smos pa la ;
analyzed: zhes smos pa la ;

analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i gzugs kyis gnod mdzes kyi rgyal pos mgo bo nas brtsams te /

analyzed: rkang pa'i mthil gyi bar du phur bus btab nas sa 'og bdun gyi bar du son par bltas te /

analyzed: de byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: sngags 'di brjod par bya ste drang ba'i don to ;

original: sngags de nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sngags de nyid bshad par bya ste /

analyzed: aom gha gha gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya sarba du sht'am h'um phat phat /

analyzed: k'i la ya k'i la ya sarba p'a pam phat phat h'um h'um badzra k'i la ya badzra dha ro a'adzny'a pa ya ti /

analyzed: sarba bi ghan'am k'a ya b'a ka tsittam k'i la ya h'um h'um phat phat / ces smos pa la /

analyzed: aom ni bshad za ni to //

analyzed: badzra k'i la ya zhes bya ba ni khro bo bcu bod pa'o //

analyzed: sarba bigha nam zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa rnams kyi'o //

analyzed: k'a ya b'a ka tsittam ni lus la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: rdo rje tho ba phyag bsnams pa'i // gnod mdzes rgyal po rnam par bsam //

analyzed: rdo rje me ni sngags bcas pas // rnam par 'phro ba nges par bsgom //

analyzed: de yang rta mgrin gyi rang bzhin zhes man ngag go //

analyzed: rdo rje tho ba des de dag brdung zhing sa 'og bdun du son par bsam ste /

analyzed: khro bo'i sku las byung ba'i 'bar ba'i tshogs kyis bsregs la dbugs kyi rlung gis thal bar 'gyur bar bya'o zhes drang ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the interpretable meaning is that they are burned by a mass of flames arising from the body of the wrathful one, and are reduced to ashes by the wind of his breath.

original: gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po ni rtsa dbu ma ste /
analyzed: gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po ni rtsa dbu ma ste /

analyzed: de nyid kyi rdo rje'i tho ba'i dbyibs can 'od gsal ba'i me 'phro ba bsam pa ni nges pa'i don to //

analyzed: de nyid bshad pa / gdug pa tshig pas phan tshun du //

analyzed: 'bros par gyur par rnam par bsam //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phan tshun te /

analyzed: bdag po rnams phur bus btab na 'khor rnams kyang 'jigs pa dang ldan par 'gyur zhing 'bros par gyur par bltas te /

analyzed: snga ma'i rim gyis bsreg bar bya ste drang ba'i don to //

original: snang ba gsum spangs par gyur na /
analyzed: snang ba gsum spangs par gyur na /
translated: If one abandons the three appearances,

analyzed: de'i 'khor du gyur pa'i rang bzhin brgya drug cu khros par gyur ba ni mi snang bar gyur par bsam par bya ste nges pa'i don to //

analyzed: ces bya ba ni de ltar sngar bshad pa'i rim gyis phyogs bcur phur bus btab par bstan to//

analyzed: thabs dang shes rab 'ba' zhig tu gnas par blta bar bya'o//

analyzed: dngos po med par bsgom par bya //

analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral bas na stong pa /
translated: Since they are free from one and many, they are empty.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyu med pas na mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyu med pas na mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: It is signless because it is not caused by Īśvara, etc.

original: rtog pa dang bral bas smon pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral bas smon pa med pa ste /
translated: It is wishless because it is free from conceptualization.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is non-existent.

original: 'di nyid kyi ngo bo zhes brjod du mi nus pa thams cad stong ba'i rang bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi ngo bo zhes brjod du mi nus pa thams cad stong ba'i rang bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on it as the nature of emptiness of all that cannot be expressed as “this very essence.”

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzugs ni dbu ba lta bur bshad ;
analyzed: gzugs ni dbu ba lta bur bshad ;
translated: Form is explained to be like foam,

original: / tshor ba chu bur dang mtshungs pa //
analyzed: / tshor ba chu bur dang mtshungs pa //
translated: Feeling is similar to bubbles,

original: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bur te //
analyzed: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bur te //
translated: Perception is like a mirage,

original: 'du byed chu shing dang 'dra ba //
analyzed: 'du byed chu shing dang 'dra ba //
translated: Formations are like a plantain tree,

original: sgyu ma lta bur rnam par shes //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur rnam par shes //
translated: Consciousness is like an illusion.

original: de ltar phung po rnams bstan pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar phung po rnams bstan pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus the aggregates are taught.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: rang bzhin bral ba stong pa nyid yin te //🔽rgyu dang bral bas de bzhin mtshan ma med //
analyzed: rang bzhin bral ba stong pa nyid yin te // rgyu dang bral bas de bzhin mtshan ma med //
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic nature,🔽The wishlessness of being free from causes,

original: rtog pa med pas dngos po ma lus ni //
analyzed: rtog pa med pas dngos po ma lus ni //
translated: The signlessness of the non-existence of all things,

original: smon pa las ni nges par grol ba yin //
analyzed: smon pa las ni nges par grol ba yin //
translated: The freedom from desire of being definitely liberated.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: rang las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: rang las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from itself, not from another,

original: gnyi ga las min rgyu med min //🔽dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: gnyi ga las min rgyu med min // dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: not from both, not without cause,🔽at no time and in no place

original: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin//
analyzed: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin//
translated: do things have any origination whatsoever.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: And also from other scriptures:

original: dngos po 'di dag rang bzhin med //
analyzed: dngos po 'di dag rang bzhin med //
translated: These things have no intrinsic reality,

original: gcig dang du ma dang bral phyir //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral phyir //
translated: because they are devoid of singularity and plurality,

original: gzugs brnyan bzhin zhes gzhan las kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan bzhin zhes gzhan las kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: like a reflection.

original: 'dir man ngag ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pas yab yum zhu ste stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du bdag nyid @25b bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir man ngag ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pas yab yum zhu ste stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du bdag nyid @25b bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The instruction here is that by the union of method and wisdom, the father and mother melt, and one should imagine oneself as the nature of emptiness.

original: de nyid spros te bshad par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid spros te bshad par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to elaborate and explain just that,🔽he says:

original: dngos po med pas sgom pa med //
analyzed: dngos po med pas sgom pa med //
translated: Because of the nonexistence of things, there is no meditation.

original: bsgom par bya ba sgom pa min //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba sgom pa min //
translated: The meditation is not the object of meditation.

original: de bas dngos po dngos med pas //
analyzed: de bas dngos po dngos med pas //
translated: Therefore, because of the nonexistence of things,

original: sgom pa dmigs su med pa'o //🔽zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: sgom pa dmigs su med pa'o // zhes smos pa la /
translated: meditation is not perceived.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad med na sgom pa ni med de /
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad med na sgom pa ni med de /
translated: Here, if all things, both animate and inanimate, do not exist, then meditation does not exist.

original: bsgom par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is nothing to be cultivated.

original: bsgom par bya ba sgom pa min //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba sgom pa min //
translated: Cultivation is not the cultivation of what is to be cultivated.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because

original: gang yod pa'i sgom pa de yang sgom pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yod pa'i sgom pa de yang sgom pa ma yin te /
translated: cultivation, even though it exists, is not cultivation,

original: sgom pa med pas kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgom pa med pas kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not cultivation.

original: de bas na dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang ldan pa ni dngos po ma yin no ;
analyzed: de bas na dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang ldan pa ni dngos po ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, that which possesses entity and non-entity is not an entity.

original: / de bas na bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa po dang sgom pa ni mi dmigs te yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: / de bas na bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa po dang sgom pa ni mi dmigs te yi ge'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the object of cultivation, the cultivator, and cultivation are not apprehended. This is the meaning of the syllables.

original: steng la sogs pa'i dbye bas chos thams cad sel cing 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams stong pa zhes bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni med pa ste /
analyzed: steng la sogs pa'i dbye bas chos thams cad sel cing 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams stong pa zhes bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni med pa ste /
translated: That cultivation which is the emptiness of all phenomena, which is the elimination of the distinctions of above and so on, and which is the emptiness of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, does not exist.

original: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a view that is attached to emptiness.

original: mtshan ma sel bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: mtshan ma sel bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to eliminate signs,

original: bsgom par bya ba bsgom pa min //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba bsgom pa min //
translated: cultivation is not the cultivation of what is to be cultivated.

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: This is because

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam pa la mngon par zhen pa'i sgom pa gang yin pa de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam pa la mngon par zhen pa'i sgom pa gang yin pa de yang mi rigs te /
translated: That meditation which is the adherence to the aspects of cause and effect is also not tenable,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because cause and effect are nondual.

original: smon pa sel bar bya ba'i phyir de bas dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: smon pa sel bar bya ba'i phyir de bas dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to eliminate the wish, he says, Therefore, entity, etc.

original: de ltar phyi'i rnam pa'i smon pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar phyi'i rnam pa'i smon pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, that result of the wish for the aspect of external things does not exist,

original: smon pa la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon pa la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the wish, etc., are not objects.

original: de bas na phyi'i dngos po'i rnam pa'i bsgom pa dmigs su med pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na phyi'i dngos po'i rnam pa'i bsgom pa dmigs su med pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meditation on the aspect of external things is not an object,

original: sems kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of mind.

original: spyi'i don to //
analyzed: spyi'i don to //
translated: The general meaning.

original: dngos po med pa ni phung pho la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams med pas bsgom par gyur pa sems tsam gang yin pa de ni med de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni phung pho la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams med pas bsgom par gyur pa sems tsam gang yin pa de ni med de /
translated: Since those aggregates, etc., which are nonentities do not exist, that meditation which is mind-only does not exist,

original: ma dag pa dang rtag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma dag pa dang rtag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impure and never exists.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa sel bar bya ba'i phyir /🔽bsgom par bya ba sgom pa min //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa sel bar bya ba'i phyir / bsgom par bya ba sgom pa min //
translated: he says:

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: “One should not cultivate what is to be cultivated.”

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid kyi lha'i sku bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid kyi lha'i sku bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That cultivation of the deity’s body which has the nature of the conventional truth is not reasonable,

original: 'od gsal bas rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od gsal bas rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be purified by clear light.

original: de bas na kun rdzob kyi bden pa tsam gyi dngos po ni dngos po ma yin te @26a * //
analyzed: de bas na kun rdzob kyi bden pa tsam gyi dngos po ni dngos po ma yin te @26a * //
translated: Therefore, a thing which is merely the conventional truth is not a thing,

original: bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two truths are inseparable.

original: des na sgom pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i sgom pa dmigs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: des na sgom pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i sgom pa dmigs pa med pa ste /
translated: Thus, cultivation is the cultivation of the aspect of the two truths, which is without objective support.

original: dka' bas dmigs pa zhes bya ba ste sbas pa'o //
analyzed: dka' bas dmigs pa zhes bya ba ste sbas pa'o //
translated: This is the hidden meaning of “the objective support is difficult.”

original: dngos po med pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa bsgom pa med de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa bsgom pa med de /
translated: The cultivation of the ultimate truth is not non-existence,

original: thog ma nas dag pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: thog ma nas dag pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is pure from the beginning.

original: / kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid sgom pa gang yin pa de ni bsgom par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: / kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid sgom pa gang yin pa de ni bsgom par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: That cultivation which has the nature of the conventional truth is not what is to be cultivated,

original: bden pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not true.

original: de bas na bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po ni bsgom par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po ni bsgom par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the entity that is the nature of the two truths is not to be cultivated.

original: bden pa gnyis su med par bya ba mthong ba tsam gyis thar pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis su med par bya ba mthong ba tsam gyis thar pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Liberation is by the mere seeing of the non-duality of the two truths.

original: des na sgom pa po dang / bsgom pa dang bsgom par bya bar mngon par zhen pa 'di zung 'jug gi rim pa khong du chud pas mi dmigs so zhes mthar thug pa'o //🔽dngos po med pa ni lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis med na de la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sgom pa med de /
analyzed: des na sgom pa po dang / bsgom pa dang bsgom par bya bar mngon par zhen pa 'di zung 'jug gi rim pa khong du chud pas mi dmigs so zhes mthar thug pa'o // dngos po med pa ni lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis med na de la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sgom pa med de /
translated: Therefore, the meditator, the meditation, and the object of meditation are not apprehended by the one who has understood the stage of union.

original: de'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-entity is not the meditation that has the characteristic of being fixated on the sixty-two views because its nature is not apprehended.

original: phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad ni yod do zhes nyan thos pa rnams kyi sgom pa gang yin pa de ni sgom pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad ni yod do zhes nyan thos pa rnams kyi sgom pa gang yin pa de ni sgom pa ma yin te /
translated: The meditation of the śrāvakas, “The five aggregates, the twelve sense spheres, and the eighteen elements exist,” is not meditation.

original: gcig dang du ma dang bral bas de rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral bas de rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are devoid of one and many.

original: de bas na rnam pa 'dis dngos po ni phung po lnga la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po med pa ste /🔽rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /🔽de bas na bsgom pa ni de las ldog pa'i phyir mi sdug pa la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa 'dis dngos po ni phung po lnga la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po med pa ste / rdzas su yod pa ma yin te / de bas na bsgom pa ni de las ldog pa'i phyir mi sdug pa la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this aspect is the non-existence of things, i.e., the non-existence of substantial reality in the characteristics of the five aggregates, etc.

original: dngos po med pa ni chos thams cad med pas chos la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sgom pa med do zhes stong pa'o /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni chos thams cad med pas chos la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sgom pa med do zhes stong pa'o /
translated: Therefore, meditation is the non-existence of that, i.e., it is the non-existence of the meditation that has the characteristic of attachment to dharmas, since all dharmas are non-existent.

original: bsgom par bya ba ni kun brtags kyi bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba ni kun brtags kyi bsgom pa ste /
translated: The object of meditation is the imagined meditation, but it is not meditation.

original: sgom pa ma yin no zhes shin tu stong pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa ma yin no zhes shin tu stong pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the emptiness of emptiness.

original: de bas na dngos po ni gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po ni gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the thing that is the characteristic of the relative is not a thing,🔽it is not a substance.

original: rdzas ma yin no zhes stong pa chen po'o //
analyzed: rdzas ma yin no zhes stong pa chen po'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the great emptiness.

original: bsgom pa dmigs su med pa ni yongs su grub pa'i bsgom pa brtags pa ma yin no zhes thams cad stong pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa dmigs su med pa ni yongs su grub pa'i bsgom pa brtags pa ma yin no zhes thams cad stong pa ste /
translated: The non-apprehension of the object of meditation is the perfected meditation, which is not imagined.🔽Therefore, it is the emptiness of all dharmas.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not literal.

original: dngos po med pa ni rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni rnyed pa'o //
translated: The non-existent is the attainment.

original: sgom pa min pa ni ma rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa min pa ni ma rnyed pa'o //
translated: The non-meditative is the non-attainment.

original: bsgom par bya ba ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba ni bde ba'o //
translated: The object of meditation is happiness.

original: sgom pa min @26b pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sgom pa min @26b pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The non-meditative is suffering.

original: de ltar dngos po ni grags pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po ni grags pa'o //
translated: Thus, the existent is fame.

original: dngos po med pa ni ma grags pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni ma grags pa'o //
translated: The non-existent is disrepute.

original: bsgom pa ni bstod pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni bstod pa'o //
translated: Meditation is praise.

original: dmigs su med pa ni smod pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa ni smod pa ste /
translated: The non-apprehensible is blame.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the intention.

original: dngos po med pa ni las kyi phyag rgyas spangs nas sgom pa med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni las kyi phyag rgyas spangs nas sgom pa med pa ste /
translated: The non-existent is the abandonment by the karma-mudra, the non-meditation.

original: de'i spros pa ni sgom pa rigs te /
analyzed: de'i spros pa ni sgom pa rigs te /
translated: Its elaboration is the meditation that is appropriate,

original: bskyed pa'i rim par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it is the stage of generation.

original: bsgom par bya ba sgom pa min ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i sgom pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba sgom pa min ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i sgom pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ma yin te /
translated: The non-meditation of the object of meditation is the meditation of the samaya-mudra, which is not supramundane,

original: sngags la sogs pas sbyor ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngags la sogs pas sbyor ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it depends on the application of mantra, etc.

original: de bas na dngos po ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i bsgom pa yang dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i bsgom pa yang dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meditation on the seal of pristine awareness is not a thing,

original: don dam pa yin gyi brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa yin gyi brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the ultimate, and because it is imagined.

original: de bas na sgom pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i sgom pa dmigs su med pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na sgom pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i sgom pa dmigs su med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, meditation is the meditation on the great seal, which is not an object.

original: phyag rgya gsum gyi rnam par rtog pa de la mi dmigs so zhes dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya gsum gyi rnam par rtog pa de la mi dmigs so zhes dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the intention that the three seals are not objects of that conceptualization.

original: 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dngos po med na mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba'i sgom pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dngos po med na mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba'i sgom pa med do //
translated: If the view of the transitory collection is not a thing, then the meditation on the view grasping extremes does not exist.

original: bsgom par bya ba ni log pa'i lta ba'i rtog pa ni mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba ni log pa'i lta ba'i rtog pa ni mi dmigs te /
translated: The meditation on what is to be meditated on is not the conceptualization of a false view,

original: brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bas na lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i dngos po de ni dngos po ma yin pas med de /
analyzed: brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir ro // de bas na lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i dngos po de ni dngos po ma yin pas med de /
translated: because it is false.🔽Therefore, that thing which is the view grasping at false views is not a thing, and so does not exist.

original: de bas tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sgom pa ni dmigs pa med pa ste drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sgom pa ni dmigs pa med pa ste drang ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meditation on the characteristics of the view grasping at false views and rituals is not an object, and is of provisional meaning.

original: dngos po med pa ni rnam rig tsam med pas sgom pa med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni rnam rig tsam med pas sgom pa med pa ste /
translated: Non-entity is not meditation, because of the absence of mere awareness.

original: de thob par byed pa'i lam gyi sgom pa med do //
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i lam gyi sgom pa med do //
translated: There is no meditation of the path that causes its attainment.

original: bsgom par bya ba sgom pa min ni stong pa nyid kyi sgom pa yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba sgom pa min ni stong pa nyid kyi sgom pa yang mi rigs te /
translated: Not meditation of what is to be meditated upon is not reasonable as meditation on emptiness,

original: bco brgyad la ltos pa'i phyir dang chad pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bco brgyad la ltos pa'i phyir dang chad pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would depend on the eighteen, and because it would be a nihilistic position.

original: de bas dngos po dngos med pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa'i bdag nyid don dam pa ma yin te brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas dngos po dngos med pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa'i bdag nyid don dam pa ma yin te brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, non-entity, which is the entity, is not the ultimate nature of the meditation of the creation stage, because it is imagined.

original: de bas na rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pa ni dmigs pa med pa ste ;
analyzed: de bas na rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pa ni dmigs pa med pa ste ;
translated: Therefore, the meditation of the completion stage is without reference,

original: spros pa med pa'i phyir dang / ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir ro zhes nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i phyir dang / ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir ro zhes nges pa'i don to //
translated: because of the absence of conceptual elaboration and because of the establishment of the essence.🔽This is the definitive meaning.

original: de nyid bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to summarize that,

original: tshigs bcad 'di yis rgyu mi rgya'o //🔽bdag nyid can rnams stong par bsgom //
analyzed: tshigs bcad 'di yis rgyu mi rgya'o // bdag nyid can rnams stong par bsgom //
translated: this verse with its cause and result.

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: Those who have the nature of self meditate on emptiness.

original: tshigs bcad 'di yis ni sngar bshad pas so//
analyzed: tshigs bcad 'di yis ni sngar bshad pas so//
translated: This verse is as previously explained.

original: @27a * // rgyu dang mi rgyu'i bdag nyid can brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can gyi khams gsum pa stong pa nyid du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: @27a * // rgyu dang mi rgyu'i bdag nyid can brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can gyi khams gsum pa stong pa nyid du bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should contemplate the emptiness of the three realms, which have the nature of both the animate and inanimate, both the moving and unmoving.

original: de'i rim pa ni rang gi thugs ka nas 'od zer gyi 'khor lo spros la des snod dang bcud kyi 'jig rten gnyis dgug cing der bcug la thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pas bdag nyid stong pa nyid du bsgom mo //
analyzed: de'i rim pa ni rang gi thugs ka nas 'od zer gyi 'khor lo spros la des snod dang bcud kyi 'jig rten gnyis dgug cing der bcug la thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pas bdag nyid stong pa nyid du bsgom mo //
translated: The process is as follows: One radiates a circle of light rays from one's heart, and with that one summons the two worlds, the animate and inanimate, and having brought them in, one contemplates oneself as emptiness through the meditative concentration of the union of means and insight.

original: de bas na 'od gsal ba'i sems la bgegs 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin gyi klags skabs kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'od gsal ba'i sems la bgegs 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin gyi klags skabs kyang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, any hindrance to the clear light mind is neither a place nor an occasion.

original: de ni bgegs rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i thabs dam pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bgegs rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i thabs dam pa yin no //
translated: That is the excellent means of completely pacifying hindrances.

original: thig le tsam lus par gyur tam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: thig le tsam lus par gyur tam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If one asks, Is it the case that only a drop remains? , the answer is no.

original: thig le yang sgra la thim pa dang / sgra ni sgra tsam la /
analyzed: thig le yang sgra la thim pa dang / sgra ni sgra tsam la /
translated: The drop dissolves into sound, and sound into mere sound, and mere sound into clear light.

original: sgra tsam ni 'od gsal ba la zhes rnam rig tsam du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra tsam ni 'od gsal ba la zhes rnam rig tsam du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, it does not follow that there is mere awareness.

original: gzhung mkhan ni dbu ma pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhung mkhan ni dbu ma pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the author of the treatise is a Mādhyamika.

original: de ni yan lag gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de ni yan lag gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third part.

original: da ni 'chad pa'i lta ba sel ba'i phyir dang / 'gro ba'i don bya ba'i phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'chad pa'i lta ba sel ba'i phyir dang / 'gro ba'i don bya ba'i phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to remove the view of the expounders, and in order to benefit migrating beings, the creation stage should be explained.

original: de'i dang po'i ye shes kyi sa gzhi bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: de'i dang po'i ye shes kyi sa gzhi bsgom pa ni /
translated: The meditation on the ground of the pristine awareness of that🔽is stated:

original: cho ga'i sbyor ba 'di yis ni //
analyzed: cho ga'i sbyor ba 'di yis ni //
translated: By this method of ritual,

original: ye shes sa gzhi byin gyis brlab //🔽ces smos te /🔽'dir dang po'i rten gyi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya ba dang / phyi nas brten pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: ye shes sa gzhi byin gyis brlab // ces smos te / 'dir dang po'i rten gyi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya ba dang / phyi nas brten pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: the ground of pristine awareness is blessed.🔽Here, the creation of the mandala of the first support should be done, and then the creation of the supported mandala.

original: rten gyi 'khor gang yin pa //
analyzed: rten gyi 'khor gang yin pa //
translated: The mandala of the support

original: de ni ye shes sa gzi ste //
analyzed: de ni ye shes sa gzi ste //
translated: is the ground of pristine awareness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo nam mkha' dang / rlung dang / me dang / chu dang / sa'i dkyil 'khor ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo nam mkha' dang / rlung dang / me dang / chu dang / sa'i dkyil 'khor ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The spheres of space, wind, fire, water, and earth, which are the nature of the five tathāgatas, are the nature of the pristine awareness of the realm of reality and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir snod kyi 'jig rten ni gling gzhi dang / ri rab kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes de'i rnam par dag pa yin pas ye shes kyi sa gzhi bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snod kyi 'jig rten ni gling gzhi dang / ri rab kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes de'i rnam par dag pa yin pas ye shes kyi sa gzhi bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Since the world-vessel is of the nature of the continents and Mount Meru, the ground of wisdom should be cultivated, since it is of that nature.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: That is taught:

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi dbus gnas par //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi dbus gnas par //
translated: In the middle of the realm of space,

original: h'um / gnyis sa bon yam las byung //
analyzed: h'um / gnyis sa bon yam las byung //
translated: the two seed syllables y and r,

original: rdo rje gnyis dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: rdo rje gnyis dang yang dag ldan //
translated: endowed with two vajras,

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya //🔽zhes smos te /
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya // zhes smos te /
translated: one should meditate on the wind mandala.

original: dang po h'um las byung ba'i chos 'byung gi phyag rgya'i steng du h'um gnyis kyis mtshan pa'i yi ge yam sngon po yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje gnyis kyis mtshan pa'i @27b rlung gi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po h'um las byung ba'i chos 'byung gi phyag rgya'i steng du h'um gnyis kyis mtshan pa'i yi ge yam sngon po yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje gnyis kyis mtshan pa'i @27b rlung gi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: First, above the dharma source mudra arisen from the syllable hūṃ, one should meditate on the wind mandala marked with two vajras and two seed syllables y and r, which arise from the blue syllable y.🔽Then:

original: de nas / h'um gnyis sa bon ram las byung //
analyzed: de nas / h'um gnyis sa bon ram las byung //
translated: The two seed syllables r and a,

original: rdo rje gnyis kyis yang dag mtshan //
analyzed: rdo rje gnyis kyis yang dag mtshan //
translated: perfectly marked with two vajras,

original: me yi dkyil 'khor nyid kyang ni //
analyzed: me yi dkyil 'khor nyid kyang ni //
translated: the fire mandala itself

original: de yi steng du rnam par bsam //🔽zhes smos te /
analyzed: de yi steng du rnam par bsam //🔽zhes smos te /
translated: is imagined above that.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um gnyis kyis mtshan pa yi ge ram dmar po yongs su gyur pa rdo rje gnyis kyis mtshan pa me'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um gnyis kyis mtshan pa yi ge ram dmar po yongs su gyur pa rdo rje gnyis kyis mtshan pa me'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: On top of the wind mandala, one should visualize a red raṃ syllable marked with two hūṃs, which transforms into a vajra marked with two hūṃs, and a fire mandala.🔽Then:

original: de nas / h'um gnyis sa bon bam las byung //
analyzed: de nas / h'um gnyis sa bon bam las byung //
translated: The two hūṃs arise from the seed vaṃ.

original: rdo rje gnyis dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: rdo rje gnyis dang yang dag ldan //
translated: They are endowed with two vajras.

original: chu yi dkyil 'khor nyid kyang ni //
analyzed: chu yi dkyil 'khor nyid kyang ni //
translated: The water mandala itself

original: de yi steng du rnam par bsam //🔽zhes smos te /
analyzed: de yi steng du rnam par bsam // zhes smos te /
translated: is visualized on top of that.

original: me yi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um gnyis kyis mtshan pa bam dkar po las skyes pa'i rdo rje gnyis kyis mtshan pa'i chu'i dkyil 'khor bsgom mo //
analyzed: me yi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um gnyis kyis mtshan pa bam dkar po las skyes pa'i rdo rje gnyis kyis mtshan pa'i chu'i dkyil 'khor bsgom mo //
translated: On top of the fire mandala, one should visualize a white vaṃ syllable marked with two hūṃs, which transforms into a water mandala marked with two vajras.🔽Then:

original: de nas / h'um gnyis sa bon lam las byung //
analyzed: de nas / h'um gnyis sa bon lam las byung //
translated: The two hūṃs arise from the seed laṃ.

original: rdo rje gnyis dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: rdo rje gnyis dang yang dag ldan //
translated: They are endowed with two vajras.

original: sa yi dkyil 'khor nyid kyang ni //
analyzed: sa yi dkyil 'khor nyid kyang ni //
translated: The earth mandala itself

original: de yi steng du yang dag bsam //🔽zhes smos te ;
analyzed: de yi steng du yang dag bsam //🔽zhes smos te ;
translated: is visualized on top of that.

original: h'um gnyis kyis mtshan pa'i lam ser po las byung ba chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du sa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: h'um gnyis kyis mtshan pa'i lam ser po las byung ba chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du sa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the mandala of earth on top of the mandala of water, arisen from the yellow path marked by two hūṃs.🔽Then,

original: de nas / dkyil 'khor bzhi po yang dag bsdu //
analyzed: de nas / dkyil 'khor bzhi po yang dag bsdu //
translated: the four mandalas are gathered together,

original: rdo rje'i sa gzhi dkyil 'khor la //🔽zhes smos te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i sa gzhi dkyil 'khor la // zhes smos te /
translated: on the mandala of the vajra ground.

original: chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya spangs nas lhag ma rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bzhi gcig tu gyur pas ye shes kyis gzhir gyur par bsam mo //🔽'dir zhal gyi man ngag ni dang po thams cad stong pa'i rang bzhin 'od gsal ba las cig car du sprin med pa'i nam mkha'i dbus nas sprin gyi dum bu bzhin du yi ge h'um bsgoms nas de yongs su gyur pas khams gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi phyag
analyzed: chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya spangs nas lhag ma rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bzhi gcig tu gyur pas ye shes kyis gzhir gyur par bsam mo // 'dir zhal gyi man ngag ni dang po thams cad stong pa'i rang bzhin 'od gsal ba las cig car du sprin med pa'i nam mkha'i dbus nas sprin gyi dum bu bzhin du yi ge h'um bsgoms nas de yongs su gyur pas khams gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi phyag
translated: Having abandoned the mudrā of the source of phenomena, one should imagine the four mandalas, beginning with the wind mandala, as one, the basis of gnosis.🔽Here, the oral instruction is that, from the very beginning, one should meditate on the syllable hūṃ in the center of the cloudless sky, like a piece of cloud, from the nature of the clear light of emptiness.

original: rgya chos 'byung dkar po nang khong stong nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin bsams te /
analyzed: rgya chos 'byung dkar po nang khong stong nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin bsams te /
translated: From that, one should imagine a white source of phenomena, the nature of the three realms, with an empty interior, the nature of the realm of space.

original: de'i steng du kha dog dkar po dbyangs dang po las byung ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de nyid la khyab nas gnas pa bltas te /
analyzed: de'i steng du kha dog dkar po dbyangs dang po las byung ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de nyid la khyab nas gnas pa bltas te /
translated: On top of that, the white color, the moon maṇḍala arisen from the first vowel, pervades and exists in that.

original: de'i dbus su h'um sngon po bkod la /
analyzed: de'i dbus su h'um sngon po bkod la /
translated: In the center of that, visualize a blue hūṃ.

original: de las 'phros pa'i dbyangs dang gsal byed phreng ba dkar po dang / dmar po shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin bsams te /
analyzed: de las 'phros pa'i dbyangs dang gsal byed phreng ba dkar po dang / dmar po shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin bsams te /
translated: The white and red garlands of vowels and consonants, the nature of wisdom and method, emanate from that.

original: h'um spangs nas dbyangs dang gsal byed yongs su gyur cing /🔽lha mo dang @28a * //
analyzed: h'um spangs nas dbyangs dang gsal byed yongs su gyur cing / lha mo dang @28a * //
translated: Except for the hūṃ, the vowels and consonants transform completely.

original: thabs sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid lha sum cu rtsa gsum gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo zhal gsum phyag drug pa zhi ba snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid bsam mo //
analyzed: thabs sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid lha sum cu rtsa gsum gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo zhal gsum phyag drug pa zhi ba snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid bsam mo //
translated: The thirty-two goddesses and the thirty-three deities of the maṇḍala wheel, the nature of the three sattvas, experience the bliss of union of the peaceful three faces and six arms.

original: de nas chags pa chen po las byung ba'i sgras nam mkha'i khams na gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs dgug cing ngag gi lam nas zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas chags pa chen po las byung ba'i sgras nam mkha'i khams na gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs dgug cing ngag gi lam nas zhugs te /
translated: Then, the assembly of tathāgatas in the realm of space is summoned by the sound of great passion and enters the path of the mouth.

original: de ma thag tu zhu zhing zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du ro gcig par bsam mo //
analyzed: de ma thag tu zhu zhing zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du ro gcig par bsam mo //
translated: Immediately after that, one should offer it, and imagine that it is of one taste on the moon mandala.

original: h'um dang bcas pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yang chos 'byung la thim mo //
analyzed: h'um dang bcas pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yang chos 'byung la thim mo //
translated: The moon mandala with the hūṃ dissolves into the source of phenomena.

original: chos 'byung ni dbus su sngon po dang / g-yon dang g-yas phyogs su dkar po dang dmar po ste /
analyzed: chos 'byung ni dbus su sngon po dang / g-yon dang g-yas phyogs su dkar po dang dmar po ste /
translated: The source of phenomena is blue in the middle, and white and red on the left and right sides,

original: nam mkha'i khams zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de'i steng du h'um gnyis kyis mtshan pa'i yi ge yam sngon po bkod de /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams zhes bya ba'i don to // de'i steng du h'um gnyis kyis mtshan pa'i yi ge yam sngon po bkod de /
translated: meaning the element of space.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las ba dan gyis mtshan pa gzhu'i dbyibs can rdo rje gnyis dang ldan pa sa 'og nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las ba dan gyis mtshan pa gzhu'i dbyibs can rdo rje gnyis dang ldan pa sa 'og nas brtsams te /
translated: On top of that, one should arrange the syllable yaṃ, marked with two hūṃs, which turns into a banner-shaped bow marked with a banner, with two vajras, starting from below the ground,

original: mtha' yas par rlung gi dkyil 'khor sngon po bsam mo //
analyzed: mtha' yas par rlung gi dkyil 'khor sngon po bsam mo //
translated: and imagine the wind maṇḍala, which is blue and infinite.

original: de'i steng du bcom ldan 'das don yod par grub pa'i sa bon yi ge kham bkod la de yongs su gyur pa las kham dang bcas pa'i ral gri bsams la ;
analyzed: de'i steng du bcom ldan 'das don yod par grub pa'i sa bon yi ge kham bkod la de yongs su gyur pa las kham dang bcas pa'i ral gri bsams la ;
translated: On top of that, one should arrange the seed syllable of Bhagavān Amoghasiddhi, the syllable kṣaṃ, which turns into a sword marked with a kṣaṃ,

original: de'i 'od zer gyis me tog can gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing na gnas pa'i don yod grub pa'i dkyil 'khor bkug cing bcug la /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis me tog can gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing na gnas pa'i don yod grub pa'i dkyil 'khor bkug cing bcug la /
translated: The light rays from that draw in the Amoghasiddhi mandala that resides in the buddhafield of the Flower.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las don yod grub pa zhal gsum phyag drug pa ljang gu sgrol ma dang snyoms par 'jug pa sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid blta ste /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las don yod grub pa zhal gsum phyag drug pa ljang gu sgrol ma dang snyoms par 'jug pa sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid blta ste /
translated: It dissolves into the Amoghasiddhi, who has three faces and six arms, who is green, and who is in union with Tārā.

original: dga' ba'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bar zhu ste /
analyzed: dga' ba'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bar zhu ste /
translated: The sound of joy causes all tathāgatas to enter.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang tha mi dad par bsgom mo //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang tha mi dad par bsgom mo //
translated: The wind mandala is visualized as inseparable from that.

original: de nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor nyid yongs su gyur pa las h'um gnyis dang ldan pa'i yi ge ram las byung zhing de las skyes pa dmar po gru gsum la 'bar ba'i phreng bas mtshan pa me'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms te /
analyzed: de nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor nyid yongs su gyur pa las h'um gnyis dang ldan pa'i yi ge ram las byung zhing de las skyes pa dmar po gru gsum la 'bar ba'i phreng bas mtshan pa me'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms te /
translated: Then the wind mandala itself transforms into the syllable raṃ, which possesses two hūṃs. From that arises a red, triangular fire mandala, which is marked with a garland of flames.

original: de'i steng du yi ge a'a:yongs su gyur pa las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dmar po de nyid kyis mtshan pa bsams la /
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge a'a:yongs su gyur pa las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dmar po de nyid kyis mtshan pa bsams la /
translated: On top of that, one should imagine an eight-petaled lotus, red and marked with the syllable A, which is transformed into a red A.🔽By the light of that, one should summon and absorb Amitābha from the buddhafield of Sukhāvatī.

original: de'i 'od zer gyis bde ba can gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing las 'od @28b dpag tu med pa bkug cing bcug la de yongs su gyur pa las 'od dpag tu med pa zhal gsum phyag drug pa dmar po gos dkar mo dang snyoms par 'jug par bsams te
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis bde ba can gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing las 'od @28b dpag tu med pa bkug cing bcug la de yongs su gyur pa las 'od dpag tu med pa zhal gsum phyag drug pa dmar po gos dkar mo dang snyoms par 'jug par bsams te
translated: One should imagine that transformed into Amitābha, red with three faces and six arms, in union with Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: / dga' ba'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug par sngon du 'gro bar zhu zhing yang me'i dkyil 'khor bsam mo //
analyzed: / dga' ba'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug par sngon du 'gro bar zhu zhing yang me'i dkyil 'khor bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine the fire maṇḍala as before, with the invocation of all tathāgatas with the sound of joy.

original: de nas me'i dkyil 'khor nyid h'um gnyis kyis mtshan pa pam dkar por gyur cing de las byung ba'i chu'i dkyil 'khor dkar po zlum po rdo rje gnyis kyis mtshan pa /
analyzed: de nas me'i dkyil 'khor nyid h'um gnyis kyis mtshan pa pam dkar por gyur cing de las byung ba'i chu'i dkyil 'khor dkar po zlum po rdo rje gnyis kyis mtshan pa /
translated: Then, the fire maṇḍala itself, marked with two hūṃs, becomes a white paṃ, from which arises a white, round water maṇḍala, marked with two vajras,

original: 'o ma'i rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba dpa' rlabs 'phro ba bsams te /
analyzed: 'o ma'i rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba dpa' rlabs 'phro ba bsams te /
translated: like a sea of milk, with waves spreading out.

original: de'i dbus su h'um sngon po las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsams te /
analyzed: de'i dbus su h'um sngon po las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsams te /
translated: In the middle of that, one should imagine a five-pronged blue vajra arisen from a blue hūṃ.

original: de'i 'od zer gyis mngon par dga' ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na bzhugs pa'i mi bskyod pa bkug cing bcug la /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis mngon par dga' ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na bzhugs pa'i mi bskyod pa bkug cing bcug la /
translated: The light rays of that draw in Akṣobhya residing in the buddhafield Abhirati, and he is caused to enter.

original: de las byung ba zhal gsum phyag drug pa sngon po mi bskyod pa m'a ma k'i dang bcas par bsgoms te /
analyzed: de las byung ba zhal gsum phyag drug pa sngon po mi bskyod pa m'a ma k'i dang bcas par bsgoms te /
translated: One should meditate on the arising of that as blue with three faces and six arms, together with Māmakī, as Akṣobhya.

original: dga' ba'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bar zhu zhing yang chu'i dkyil 'khor bsam mo //
analyzed: dga' ba'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bar zhu zhing yang chu'i dkyil 'khor bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine that all tathāgatas enter through the sound of joy, and again imagine the water maṇḍala.

original: de nas chu'i dkyil 'khor nyid h'um gnyis kyis mtshan pa lam ser por gyur cing de las byung ba dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa bsams te /
analyzed: de nas chu'i dkyil 'khor nyid h'um gnyis kyis mtshan pa lam ser por gyur cing de las byung ba dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa bsams te /
translated: Then, the two hūṃs that are the signs of the water maṇḍala become a yellow raṃ, which becomes a square great vajra maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du aom dkar po las rtsibs brgyad pa'i 'khor lo de nyid kyis mtshan pa bsams te /
analyzed: de'i steng du aom dkar po las rtsibs brgyad pa'i 'khor lo de nyid kyis mtshan pa bsams te /
translated: Upon that, from a white oṃ, one should imagine an eight-petaled lotus marked by that.

original: de'i 'od zer gyis 'og min dang rnam par snang mdzad spyan ma dang bcas pa bkug cing bcug la de yongs su gyur pa las zhal gsum phyag drug pa dkar po rnam par snang mdzad spyan ma dang snyoms par 'jug pa bsgoms la dga' ba'i sgras de bzhin
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis 'og min dang rnam par snang mdzad spyan ma dang bcas pa bkug cing bcug la de yongs su gyur pa las zhal gsum phyag drug pa dkar po rnam par snang mdzad spyan ma dang snyoms par 'jug pa bsgoms la dga' ba'i sgras de bzhin
translated: Light from that draws in and absorbs the Akaniṣṭha realm and Vairocana with Locanā. Meditate on that transforming into white three-faced, six-handed Vairocana in union with Locanā.

original: gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bar zhu zhing yang dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor bsam mo //
analyzed: gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bar zhu zhing yang dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor bsam mo //
translated: The sound of joy causes all tathāgatas to enter, and again imagine the great empowerment maṇḍala.

original: de'i ster du tr'am las zung drug pa'i rin po che'i 'od zer gyis rin chen 'byung gnas na gnas pa'i rin chen 'byung ldan m'a ma k'i dang bcas pa bkug cing bcug la /
analyzed: de'i ster du tr'am las zung drug pa'i rin po che'i 'od zer gyis rin chen 'byung gnas na gnas pa'i rin chen 'byung ldan m'a ma k'i dang bcas pa bkug cing bcug la /
translated: In its center, from taṃ or karma, imagine six pairs of jewel light rays that draw in and absorb Ratnasaṃbhava with Māmakī abiding in Ratnasaṃbhava’s realm.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las rin chen 'byung ldan snyoms par 'jug pa bsams te /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las rin chen 'byung ldan snyoms par 'jug pa bsams te /
translated: Meditate on that transforming into Ratnasaṃbhava in union.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bar zhu zhing dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor nyid nam mkha' bzhin du rgya che bar bsgom @29a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bar zhu zhing dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor nyid nam mkha' bzhin du rgya che bar bsgom @29a * //
translated: The mandala of the great lord is meditated as extensive like the sky, preceded by the entry of the Tathagata.

original: ste drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: ste drang ba'i don to //
translated: This is the interpretable meaning.

original: tshangs pa'i bu ga ni mchod sbyin gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i bu ga ni mchod sbyin gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The aperture of Brahma is the mudra of sacrifice.

original: lte bar rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang // lkog mar me'i dkyil 'khor dang // snying gar chu'i dkyil 'khor dang // gsang bar dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: lte bar rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang // lkog mar me'i dkyil 'khor dang // snying gar chu'i dkyil 'khor dang // gsang bar dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The mandala of wind is at the navel, the mandala of fire is at the throat, the mandala of water is at the heart, and the mandala of the great lord is at the secret place.🔽The light-ray that arises from the right is the mandala of fire.

original: g-yas pa las byung ba'i 'od zer ni me'i dkyil 'khor nyid do zhes bshad pa'i phyir te nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: g-yas pa las byung ba'i 'od zer ni me'i dkyil 'khor nyid do zhes bshad pa'i phyir te nges pa'i don to //
translated: This is the definitive meaning.

original: de nyid bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa /
translated: This is explained:

original: dkyil 'khor bzhi po yang dag bsdu //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhi po yang dag bsdu //
translated: The four mandalas are gathered

original: rdo rje sa gzhi'i dkyil 'khor la //
analyzed: rdo rje sa gzhi'i dkyil 'khor la //
translated: in the mandala of the vajra ground.

original: steng du dbang chen dkyil 'khor nyid //
analyzed: steng du dbang chen dkyil 'khor nyid //
translated: Above, the mandala of the great lord

original: 'byung ba bzhi yi rang bzhin te //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi yi rang bzhin te //
translated: is the nature of the four elements.

original: drang ba'i don to//
analyzed: drang ba'i don to//
translated: This is the interpretable meaning.

original: lkog ma la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi nye bar sdud par byed pa rdo rje sa gzhi'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: lkog ma la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi nye bar sdud par byed pa rdo rje sa gzhi'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The vajra ground mandala is the gathering of the four mandalas of the throat and so forth.

original: rdo rje sa gzhi'i dkyil 'khor ni 'od gsal ba ste nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje sa gzhi'i dkyil 'khor ni 'od gsal ba ste nges pa'i don to //
translated: The vajra ground mandala is clear light, the definitive meaning.

original: da ni ye shes sems dpa' bsgom pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de la bhr'um las byung ba yi //
analyzed: da ni ye shes sems dpa' bsgom pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de la bhr'um las byung ba yi //
translated: Now, in order to teach the meditation on the gnosis being,🔽it is said:🔽From bhrūṃ one should visualize

original: gzhal yang khang pa rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: gzhal yang khang pa rnam par bsgom //
translated: the celestial mansion.🔽It has four corners and four doors,

original: zur bzhi dang ni sgo bzhi dang // rta ba bas bzhi yis mdzes byas la //
analyzed: zur bzhi dang ni sgo bzhi dang // rta ba bas bzhi yis mdzes byas la //
translated: is beautified by four porticos,

original: thig bzhi dang ni yang dag ldan //
analyzed: thig bzhi dang ni yang dag ldan //
translated: is endowed with four lines,

original: ka ba brgyad kyis nye bar mdzes //
analyzed: ka ba brgyad kyis nye bar mdzes //
translated: and is beautified by eight pillars.🔽It is adorned with nets and half-nets,

original: dra ba dra ba phyed pa dang // rdo rje nor bu zla phyed brgyan //
analyzed: dra ba dra ba phyed pa dang // rdo rje nor bu zla phyed brgyan //
translated: vajras, jewels, and half-moons.

original: grva yi mtshams ni thams cad ni //
analyzed: grva yi mtshams ni thams cad ni //
translated: In all the corners

original: sgo dang sgo khyud mtshams rnams su //
analyzed: sgo dang sgo khyud mtshams rnams su //
translated: at the doors and door surrounds

original: rdo rje rin chen rnams kyis spras //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen rnams kyis spras //
translated: it is ornamented with vajras and jewels.

original: phyi yi dkyil 'khor thig gdab bya //
analyzed: phyi yi dkyil 'khor thig gdab bya //
translated: One should lay out the outer mandala.

original: bum pa ka ba rdo rje che //
analyzed: bum pa ka ba rdo rje che //
translated: The vases, pillars, and great vajras

original: bre yi phreng ba bya rnams gnas //
analyzed: bre yi phreng ba bya rnams gnas //
translated: are the abode of the rows of birds.

original: ba dan dril bu mdzes byas la //
analyzed: ba dan dril bu mdzes byas la //
translated: Adorned with banners, bells, and beauty,

original: rnga yab sogs kyis rnam par brgyan //🔽zhes smos te /
analyzed: rnga yab sogs kyis rnam par brgyan // zhes smos te /
translated: Ornamented with yak-tail fans, and so forth.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pos gzhal yas khang sgom pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pos gzhal yas khang sgom pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The four verses should be explained as the meditation on the celestial palace.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du kha dog ser po'i yi ge gsum bkod la /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du kha dog ser po'i yi ge gsum bkod la /
translated: There means that on top of the vajra mandala, one should arrange the three syllables in yellow color.

original: de las ri'i rgyal po ri rab rtse mo brgyad kyis mdzes pa /
analyzed: de las ri'i rgyal po ri rab rtse mo brgyad kyis mdzes pa /
translated: From that, one should imagine Mount Meru, king of mountains, beautified by eight peaks,

original: rin po che sna bzhi'i rang bzhin rgyal po chen po la sogs pa lha'i ris drug gis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rin po che sna bzhi'i rang bzhin rgyal po chen po la sogs pa lha'i ris drug gis brgyan pa /
translated: the nature of the four kinds of jewels, adorned by the six classes of gods such as Mahārāja,

original: dga' bo la sogs pa nags tshal chen po'i tshogs dang ldan pa bsams te /
analyzed: dga' bo la sogs pa nags tshal chen po'i tshogs dang ldan pa bsams te /
translated: and endowed with the great forest groves such as Nandana.

original: de'i steng du sprin sgra las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i chang gzungs la bam las byung ba'i sna tshogs padma'i ze 'brur bhr'um yongs su gyur pa las rin po che sna bdun gyi rang bzhin @29b gyis mchod rten gyi bum pa'i nang du bhr'um bkod la spro
analyzed: de'i steng du sprin sgra las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i chang gzungs la bam las byung ba'i sna tshogs padma'i ze 'brur bhr'um yongs su gyur pa las rin po che sna bdun gyi rang bzhin @29b gyis mchod rten gyi bum pa'i nang du bhr'um bkod la spro
translated: On top of that, from the syllable bhrūṃ in the center of a multicolored lotus that arises from a vaṃ in the center of a multicolored vajra cross that arises from the sound of clouds, there is a multicolored jeweled stupa that arises from bhrūṃ.

original: ba dang bsdu ba sngon du 'gro bar yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i rtsibs brgyad pa'i 'khor lo'i ste bar sa bon de nyid las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi phreng bas rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs bkug cing bcug la /
analyzed: ba dang bsdu ba sngon du 'gro bar yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i rtsibs brgyad pa'i 'khor lo'i ste bar sa bon de nyid las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi phreng bas rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs bkug cing bcug la /
translated: Light rays radiate and retract from the seed syllable in the center of the eight-spoked wheel that arises from the complete transformation of the syllable bhrūṃ.🔽The family of Vairocana is summoned and dissolves into the light rays.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las sku rdo rje dkar po kun du zhal dkar po spyan dang bcas pa'i sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid 'khor lo dang / dril bu 'chang ba bsams te /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las sku rdo rje dkar po kun du zhal dkar po spyan dang bcas pa'i sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid 'khor lo dang / dril bu 'chang ba bsams te /
translated: From that complete transformation, imagine that you are white Vajra Body with three faces—white, black, and red—and six arms, holding a wheel, a bell, and so on.

original: thugs ka'i sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor los bkug pa'i sangs rgyas bzhugs pa zhu ste /🔽thig le nyid du gyur pa bltas te /
analyzed: thugs ka'i sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor los bkug pa'i sangs rgyas bzhugs pa zhu ste / thig le nyid du gyur pa bltas te /
translated: The wheel of light rays arising from the seed syllable at the heart draws in the resident buddhas.🔽Looking at the drop, it becomes the stupa, the variegated lotus, the variegated vajra, Mount Meru, and the mandala of great power.

original: thig le'i drod kyis mchod rten dang / sna tshogs padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rje dang / ri rab dang dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gcig tu gyur pa las byung ba'i gzhal yas khang pa 'og tu h'um ha las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i steng na gnas par bsam par bya'o zhes tshig gi don to //
analyzed: thig le'i drod kyis mchod rten dang / sna tshogs padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rje dang / ri rab dang dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gcig tu gyur pa las byung ba'i gzhal yas khang pa 'og tu h'um ha las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i steng na gnas par bsam par bya'o zhes tshig gi don to //
translated: From that arises the celestial mansion, which is imagined to be below the variegated vajra arising from hūṃ ha.

original: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: zur bzhi pa'i nang du khyud mo lcags ri'i mthar khyab pa sor bzhi dang ldan pa ste /🔽mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zur bzhi pa'i nang du khyud mo lcags ri'i mthar khyab pa sor bzhi dang ldan pa ste / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has four corners, and is four finger-widths in size, extending to the edge of the iron mountain.

original: sgo bzhi pa ni phyogs re rer sgo dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: sgo bzhi pa ni phyogs re rer sgo dang bcas pa ste /
translated: It has four doors, with doors in each direction.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four doors of liberation and the four establishments of mindfulness are pure.

original: rtab bas bzhi ni sgo'i steng du dbyibs kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: rtab bas bzhi ni sgo'i steng du dbyibs kyi khyad par te /
translated: The four arches are above the doors and are special shapes.

original: des mdzes pa ni spras pa ste /
analyzed: des mdzes pa ni spras pa ste /
translated: The temple is beautiful with them.

original: bsam gtan bzhi rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four meditative stabilizations are pure.

original: de bzhin du thig bzhi tshangs pa'i thig gnyis las byung ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du thig bzhi tshangs pa'i thig gnyis las byung ba'am /
translated: Similarly, the four lines are from the two lines of Brahmā or🔽from the four lines of the directions.

original: phyogs kyi thig bzhi las byung ba ni de dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs kyi thig bzhi las byung ba ni de dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The temple has them.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four pure abodes are pure.🔽The eight pillars are in the east, etc., of the cakravartin’s checkerboard.

original: ka ba brgyad ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i re'u mig gi shar la sogs pa rnams la gnas pa de rnams kyis mdzes pa ni /
analyzed: ka ba brgyad ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i re'u mig gi shar la sogs pa rnams la gnas pa de rnams kyis mdzes pa ni /
translated: The temple is beautiful with them.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rin po che dang ldan pa dang / rdo rje me long la sogs pas mtshan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rin po che dang ldan pa dang / rdo rje me long la sogs pas mtshan pa'i phyir te /
translated: It has various jewels and is marked with vajra mirrors, etc.

original: bsam gtan gyi rnam par thar pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi rnam par thar pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The liberations of meditative stabilization are pure.

original: de bzhin du dra ba ni gtso bo dang bcas pa dang / dra ba phyed pa ni gtso bo med pa dang / zla ba phyed pa dang / rdo rje rin po che ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dra ba ni gtso bo dang bcas pa dang / dra ba phyed pa ni gtso bo med pa dang / zla ba phyed pa dang / rdo rje rin po che ste /
translated: The half-moon and the vajra jewel

original: de rnams kyis brgyan pa ni brgyan @30a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyis brgyan pa ni brgyan @30a * //
translated: are adorned with those.

original: pa ste ; byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa ste ; byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Adorned means adorned with the seven limbs of enlightenment.

original: de bzhin du grva bzhi'i mtshams thams cad ni phyogs bzhi'i mtshams dang / de bzhin du sgo khyud ni phyi'i cha dang / mtshams ni nang gi cha ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du grva bzhi'i mtshams thams cad ni phyogs bzhi'i mtshams dang / de bzhin du sgo khyud ni phyi'i cha dang / mtshams ni nang gi cha ste /
translated: Likewise, all the corners of the four directions are the four corners, and likewise, the archways are the outer part, and the intermediate spaces are the inner part.🔽The vajra jewels are slightly hanging

original: de rnams la rdo rje rin chen ni cung zad 'phyang ba /
analyzed: de rnams la rdo rje rin chen ni cung zad 'phyang ba /
translated: in those places.

original: rin po ches mtshan pa rdo rjes spras pa ni 'od 'phro ba ste /
analyzed: rin po ches mtshan pa rdo rjes spras pa ni 'od 'phro ba ste /
translated: The jewel-marked vajra is radiant.

original: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: de bzhin du bum pa ni sgo re rer logs gnyis gnyis la gnas pa gser gyi bum pa brgyad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pa ni sgo re rer logs gnyis gnyis la gnas pa gser gyi bum pa brgyad de /
translated: Likewise, the vases are located on each of the two sides of each door, the eight golden vases.

original: de la shar gyi sgor rgyal ba dang bkra shis /
analyzed: de la shar gyi sgor rgyal ba dang bkra shis /
translated: On the eastern door, there is the Victorious One and the Auspicious One.

original: lhor cho 'phrul dang dngos grub po //
analyzed: lhor cho 'phrul dang dngos grub po //
translated: In the south, miracles and powers.

original: nub tu rgyal ba dang zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nub tu rgyal ba dang zhi ba'o //
translated: In the west, victory and peace.

original: byang du grub pa dang sprul pa ste /
analyzed: byang du grub pa dang sprul pa ste /
translated: In the north, accomplishment and emanation.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub brgyad kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub brgyad kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of the eight accomplishments, such as peace and so forth.

original: ka ba ni sgo re re la gnyis gnyis yin pas na brgyad de /
analyzed: ka ba ni sgo re re la gnyis gnyis yin pas na brgyad de /
translated: The pillars are two for each door, thus eight.

original: de rnams kyis brgyan pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyis brgyan pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Adorned by them, as before.

original: rdo rje chen po ni rdo rje bcu gcig ste sa rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje chen po ni rdo rje bcu gcig ste sa rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great vajra is the eleven vajras, because of the purity of the stages.

original: bre yi phreng la bya rnams gnas //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bre yi phreng la bya rnams gnas // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Birds dwell in the garland of eaves.

original: rta babs kyi rtse mor shar phyogs su rma bya gnyis dang / lho phyogs su ngang pa gnyis dang / nub phyogs su dur pa gnyis dang / byang phyogs su shang shang te'u gnyis gnas te /
analyzed: rta babs kyi rtse mor shar phyogs su rma bya gnyis dang / lho phyogs su ngang pa gnyis dang / nub phyogs su dur pa gnyis dang / byang phyogs su shang shang te'u gnyis gnas te /
translated: Two peacocks in the east, two geese in the south, two ducks in the west, and two sparrows in the north dwell on the peak of the archways.

original: 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the purity of passion.

original: de bzhin du dril bu dang bcas pa'i ba dan ni dril bu ba dan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dril bu dang bcas pa'i ba dan ni dril bu ba dan te /
translated: Similarly, the banner with a bell is a banner with a bell.

original: rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mor 'dzugs pa'i dar dpyangs dang / pa dan dang g-yer kha'i dra ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mor 'dzugs pa'i dar dpyangs dang / pa dan dang g-yer kha'i dra ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The pennants hoisted on the top of the victory banner, the banners, and the nets of little bells.

original: de bzhin rnga yab la sogs pa ni rnga yab dang / me tog gi phreng ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin rnga yab la sogs pa ni rnga yab dang / me tog gi phreng ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Likewise, the yak-tail fans, etc., are the yak-tail fans, garlands of flowers, etc.

original: de rnams kyis rnam par brgyan pa ni brgyan pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis rnam par brgyan pa ni brgyan pa ste /
translated: Adorned with those is the ornament.

original: gsung rab yan lag dgu rnam par dag pa ste drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag dgu rnam par dag pa ste drang ba'i don to //
translated: The nine branches of scripture are pure. This is the interpretable meaning explanation.

original: de la ri rab ni lus te /
analyzed: de la ri rab ni lus te /
translated: There, the body is the supreme mountain.

original: sgo brgyad ni rtse mo brgyad do //🔽sna tshogs rdo rje dang sna tshogs padma ni dbang po gnyis te /
analyzed: sgo brgyad ni rtse mo brgyad do // sna tshogs rdo rje dang sna tshogs padma ni dbang po gnyis te /
translated: The eight gates are the eight peaks.

original: bud med dang skyes pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: The vajra cross and the variegated lotus are the two organs, by the division of female and male.

original: gzhal yas khang ni lus nyid do //
analyzed: gzhal yas khang ni lus nyid do //
translated: The celestial mansion is the body itself.
